text:
On first visit, we walked in with a group of six people after arriving in their very old limo, which was a nice experience. It was extremely loud and there wasn't even a band playing (yet). The place was PACKED. I mean packed, back to back, like a can of sardines. It was hard to maneuver oneself to even get up to go to the bathroom. It is a lively atmosphere though, if that is what you are looking for. However this is not a favorable choice to go to when meeting someone's parents for the first time to share a great meal with conversation. We had to yell across the table at one another. Funny stuff.

Now onto the most important part. The "cuisine:"

Ok, I get it. We live in America where American Italian cuisine is heavily prevalent and this is Vegas so why not mix the two together? Casa Di Amore blends classic Italian American dishes with an old Vegas mob-style vibe to their restaurant. Dishes such as eggplant parmigiana, veal marsala, chicken marsala, baked lasagna, osso buco and the good 'ole spaghetti and meatballs are to be expected. 

Frankie, Dino and Sammie would be shaking their heads in disappointment at this place.

When a customer sits down to a table, it is expected to have a waitress/waiter greet them  timely and get acquainted with the place. After we all sat down, it took anyone to come over to our table to order drinks, a good 15 minutes before we could order a couple bottles of their house wine. We were not served bread or anything.

I eventually ordered the Eggplant Di Amore. I could not believe how DRY this dish was. It was intensely dry. Being that there was spinach, mushrooms and sundried tomatoes and umm...EGGPLANT...in a tomato sauce? This should not be so dry. As I cut into it, it was like cutting into a brick. "Where are the mushrooms?..the spinach?...that sundried tomato flavor?...where is it?" I was excited to try a twist on the classic dish but was severely disappointed. Not only was the eggplant parm dry but it was room temperature, overly salty to compensate for the lack of flavor. All I tasted was mozzarella that seemed like it was sitting there for a while and a solid hunk of nothing.
My mother had the Pork Chops With Vinegar & Peppers. She was excited since she grew up with this dish. At first bite, the pork chop was so tough I couldn't tear it off with my teeth from the fork! The weirdest part was that the pork had an extreme fishy taste to it! It was unbearable! 
My mother's husband ordered a piece of chicken with a potato and veggies on the side...hardly memorable.
My sister ordered the Gnocchi Alla Prosciutto, which was one of the better dishes at our table. There was hardly any prosciutto in it and the spinach was "missing" again. I don't know if they make their own four cheese sauce but this one was especially bland.
My sister's boyfriend ordered the Veal Marsala. Ok I love marsala dishes. I even prepare in my own kitchen from time to time. The veal at Casa Di Amore was overly dry and not the tender suppleness that a great veal dish should be. The marsala sauce tasted nothing like a good marsala wine was used. I was actually disgusted.
His mother ordered the same and was greatly disappointed.
We also received our bread when we received our entrees! blasphemy!

On the ride home, we hopped back into the limo. The limo driver was a nice woman but we weren't told that we would share our ride with a couple of other parties. There was absolutely no lighting in that limo so we were neck in neck in the darkness with strangers. We had to wait to go home because the limo driver thought it would be fit to drop those people off first. It was about an hour wait to go home when we only live a couple streets over. The limo is complimentary, but still.

Overall, the food here is not worth a second try.The classic marinara sauce in a place like this should be a signature. It is not here. For the price you are paying, the food is completely not worth it. I can find better quality for half the price, elsewhere. I am at a dismay at the hype of this place, but I suppose it is a good place to go to if your just subconsciously craving a pseudo-Italian American dish at the last minute....desperately. Ya know...that. "I'm starving, I'll eat anything!!...let's go to 711 and get some nachos," mentality. The food was so bland, dry, too salty and their combination of flavors had no flavor at all. I've had a lot better experiences in Vegas with this type of cuisine. (Can I mention Buon Gustos? Thee Best!! Seriously, try it!)

Casa Di Amore needs to be toned down a little. Maybe it's too busy for themselves to handle? Maybe they would put more effort and love into their food and serve fresh food otherwise. Suffice to say, we will not be returning here.

Awesome Italian Food! Moving from NJ I know some good Italian food . This place is the best I've had in Vegas. Great old Vegas atmosphere with live music every time I've ever been.
The service was great also! Highly recommend Casa Di Amore :)

I am not sure which good thing to say first, since the entire visit was amazing. I made reservations a couple of weeks before our visit since we would be in town for a few days. This was no ordinary day for us, we were renewing our vows after 25 years and didn't want to go to just any restaurant. We wanted to go somewhere special. Casa Di Amore was definitely that. We arrived still dressed from the big day. We were greeted by multiple members of the staff and congratulated over and over. Even many of the locals (we knew they were locals because you could tell this was their local place to go to eat) stopped by to talk with us. 

We were seated near the entertainment and had a great view of them playing and singing. The food was AMAZING. I had the salmon and it was probably one of the best salmon dishes that I have ever had. My husband had the chicken marsala and he finished the dish and loved it. 

The staff went out of their way to ensure we were having a good time and that we were recognized for our special night. So much so that they had the band announce our names and why were there (to which the rest of the restaurant gave a round of applause and their congratulations, some even stopping by the table) and the band played a song just for us. 

I cannot say enough good things about this place. Please do yourself a favor and get off of the strip, eat at a local place and have an amazing time. We will definitely be back the next time we are in town.

This place was SUPER SUPER cute. It is a really authentic mob looking italian place. The food was prompt the service was good. There was a piano guy who was playing requests the whole time we were there. Only downside was that every time the waiter came up to me I totally felt like I was in his way because he was refilling my drink or removing my plate. He even moved my plate away from me when I was mid putting food on my fork!!!!!!!
But besides the overeager waiter the food was AMAZING!!!!!! The chicken parm was to die for and the bruchetta (Is that how you spell it?) was heavenly!!!
My husband and my favorite restaurant in the world! We live on the East Coast, but have visited Vegas several times. We always make a point to go here and it's the highlight of our trip!

Had a killer meal tonight The pork chops with vinegar and peppers had this great sauce meaty and filling. I've eaten here before I did not like the lasagne It was way to cheesy the ravioli the same. I'm so glad I gave this a second chance Yummer's 
Tony our waiter on point Good job.

This is THE BEST Italian food!! We discovered this hidden jewel about 5 years ago on one of our many trips to Vegas and now a trip to Vegas is not complete without a visit to Casa Di Amore!! Not only is the food AMAZING, but the staff is as well.  We always get the limo and the limo drivers are great.  We have had just about every server they have there and they are all fantastic! Even though we only go twice a year (being out of towners), they remember us!!! That alone is amazing, that they can remember us out of all of the customers they serve. I love the fact that the ambience hasn't changed since the Rat Pack ate there.  That's what makes this place so special, the highbacked maroon leather booths, the wood paneling with all of the pictures of Old Vegas, my only regret is that the Rat Pack is not still alive to join us for dinner.  Someone else reviewed that this place smelled of smoke even though it's a no smoking restaurant. I don't know what they are talking about because I have never smelled smoke in this restaurant and I am very sensitive to cigarette smoke.  The food of course is the most important part and all I can say is FABULOUS!!! We have NEVER been disappointed in anything we've ordered.  Can't say enough good things about Casa Di Amore, this place is the BEST!!!
Absolutely perfect delicious food time less music very nice servers awesome ambience fun Place for the family

Michael is the best waiter! So nice and attentive and honest! Food was great, ambiance was nice and the entertainment was great! Very old school Frank Sinatra Vegas vibe! Breath of fresh air from all the trendy overpriced strip restaurants! Local place. Check it out!

Service was great, our waiter Brad was amazing. The food was so-so, a little over priced. I had chicken parm and it was bland. My friend had penne alla vodka and it was delicious. If I go back that's probably what i would order. The live music was cool, but if they played "Happy Birthday" one more time I was going to lose my mind. Overall I was underwhelmed and disappointed  in the food.

Great service all thanks to Michael, he was an outstanding, friendly waiter. Made my wife and I feel like we were at home and not just guests. I highly recommend you ask for him next time you go in, what a wonderful experience!

Casa di Amore was recommended to us and is a great example of authentic Italian food prepared like Grandma cooked back in the old country.

We dined as a party of four adults.  There was a tasty gluten free penne for one of us (she ate every bite!).  Another ordered the baked mostaccioli and it was also tasty and filling.  I wanted the Linguini with Clams but chose the Frutti Di Mare instead.  It was excellent.  Others in my party agreed it was the best choice at our table, although everything we ordered was flavorful.

Before dinner, we enjoyed the calamari appetizer with marinara sauce.  Simply awesome!

Complimentary table bread was never offered, which is odd for an authentic Italian restaurant.  So we ordered garlic bread but didn't know it is made with melted cheese on it.  It tastes really good, but one of us could not eat cheese so we needed to order a second one minus the cheese. 

Our reservations were at 5:15pm, just after opening, so the restaurant was fairly empty.  They accommodated us to sit in a booth where we could watch the LA Kings play in the NHL finals during dinner.  Our server "Toni" was fun and attentive. 

The restaurant is quite a distance from the Strip so they offer a pick-up service, which is convenient if you don't have your own vehicle.  The driver was right on schedule picking us up and "Sig" drove us to/from safely.  The wait to leave by limo was longer than expected, but we still made it to a show at the MGM on time.  Don't expect top of the line limousines.  For a driver gratuity of $3-5 per person, it is better than a taxi ride!

If craving good, authentic Italian food, we would eat there again while visiting Las Vegas.

Great food, great music, great atmosphere! The meal was about $30 per person and the portion was a little on the small side but I still left a very happy customer! Just topped this night off with some desert from my favorite ice cream shop on the way home!

Wonderful food, great entertainment and stellar service. Our server Michael was great. As a gluten intolerant customer, I figured I'd have little to no options at an Italian restaurant. Not only did they have several options, but Michael was quick to navigate me through the menu. The scallops were delicious and my fiancé said that his gypsy pasta was a wonderful spicy dish. If we lived here, we'd be back in a heartbeat. When we come back to Vegas, we'll be sure to come again. "Just remember, leave the gun, take the cannoli"

It is the best pasta I would recommend everybody thank you so much they have the best service
They have the best dessert thank you again
I will come again I will tell all my family and my friends

A real East coast neighborhood Italian feel. Godfatherish. I fully expected to see Frank or Dino in the next booth. Not a tourist joint. I loved the atmosphere lots of families, birthdays, just regular people. Food was good, not great. Entertainment and atmosphere made up for it. We  went on Sunday, half price wine night. Very enjoyable experience.I would recommend it. Prices reasonable.

Aside from the yummy steak entrees and live music, our server Stefan made our dining experience to this place memorable. We're first timers to this place as recommended by a business associate and Stefan made sure we were attended well. Thanks for taking good care of us!

Casa Di Amore' is  a very traditional NY-like Italian restaurant with a Las Vegas twist. There's a lounge singer crooning Sinatra ( primarily) tunes all evening. George Bugatti is amazing. I heard this guy open for Don Rickles a few years back and was blown away. If you closed your eyes you'd think Frank was in the room singing. The food is excellent. The service is over the top. The crowd is neat as its a good mix of locals with tourists.  Our table's top dishes- Osso Bucco and Veal Parm.
Like going back in time.  This is The real Vegas Paul and Randy style!  The veal Marsala, cioppino, and antipasto were legit.  Loved everything about this restaurant.

Awesome resturant! My boyfriend and I were spending a weekend in Vegas, and he found this resturant (we felt like leaving the strip). This will now be a resturant we stop at every vegas trip. 

First, the atmosphere is fun and a nice change from the Strip. 
Second, the food was really good! We actually shared a 1lb pasta bowl, I personally am a huge pasta fan (favorite food) and this pasta was delicious. We got the Spaghetti and Meatballs with meat sauce. The meat was full of flavor and the pasta tasted so fresh. 
Third, the live music was AWESOME! Unfortunately I don't recall the name of these two guys, but one played piano while the other drummed. They seemed to know any song, and we even requested a Frank Sinatra song and was not disappointed. They really sounded amazing and if I was local I would definitely book them for a party. 
Fourth, the service was a bit slow, but with the music and nice atmosphere we didn't mind. The dessert was not up to par and they immediately took it off the bill and asked if we wanted another, altho we were too full, the consideration was very thoughtful and overall the service was very friendly. 

Definitely a must try if you're looking for Italian and fun night!
Real ITALIAN food. Amazing dishes and incredibly friendly staff. It's the LOVE restaurant.

Sooo sorry to add this. Haven't been here in awhile and loved it before. Just not what it was:-( Music was fabulous, service was excellent BUT rating food 6 out of 10! Enlarged the kitchen to NO avail. Food was mediocre at best:-( Definitely one and DONE! Heading west to Mastrioni's.
They have something to eat and drink for everyone, great service, live entertainment, and super romantic... We come here for date nights.... It can get really packed so we always make a reservation.

The food was tasty though I didn't really eat much because an hour before going, I had just stuffed myself at a buffet the way you do when visiting Vegas. So I'm just going to discuss it point by point:

The limo to the restaurant is awesome! The really nice driver picked us up in front of TI and drove us to the restaurant and back. He was really patient. At the end of the night, he had another party to pick up but was really nice about getting us to make up our minds whether we wanted to go or wait until he came back.

The server was awesome! He was super sweet and really helpful when my sister and I couldn't figure out what wine we wanted. I also kept running to the bar area to watch the SC game at one point after ordering a new bottle and he brought my glass to me at the bar. Sweet! :o)

The bar area has the standard bar/pub feel. TVs everywhere you turn. The bartender is really nice even though she was a fan of either Ohio or Oregon, I forget. Well, either way, she was not a fan of SC. :oP

There is a guy who plays piano and sings all songs Dean Martin/Frank Sinatra-esque. Gives the entire place an old school Vegas feel.

All in all, I had an awesome time there. The antipasti were delicious. The wine was fabulous. The game was SHWEET (though unrelated to the restaurant but it just added to my terrific experience because SC won WOOHOO!!!) :o)

Totally found a gem!!!!! Thanks to good ol' yelp!!!! Great food! Great service! Tony was such a pleasant server! Very attentive and informative!!!!! If you want a great place to eat off the strip this is your go to!!! Supper yummy!!!!

Last night, I went out with my sister in law and some friends to the club. After a long night of dancing, we had DEFINITELY worked up the appetite to eat a good meal, so we stopped here at the Casa Di Amore restaurant. 

Let me start off by saying how LATE we were coming; we went around 3:30 and the bartender (I believe), Brian (or Bryan) was getting ready to close after what seemed to be a long night. He decided to let us dine in and extremely sweet about it. I have to commend someone who is so willing to risk a little more of their late night to please a few strangers. Brian has reminded me of why I'm a people person. 

The service was incredible to say the least. I had the Philly Cheesesteak Sliders. They came with wonderfully made fries and I had a lemon water. On the side, we all had warm bread and butter. 

The meal was delicious and Brian came by to check on us periodically to make sure we were enjoying ourselves. The setting and the lighting of the restaurant is gorgeous and romantic for any couple who may consider going (including my man and myself). 

Thank you so much, Brian. You are an outstanding server and person. If you haven't gotten one already, it's definitely time for your promotion!!

Pros:
Good and friendly service
Free limo (I doubt otherwise the place would be popular - quite far from The Strip)
Nice, home-like atmosphere

Cons:
Food. Poor presentation, very average taste, absolutely nothing memorable.
Best Italian food I have ever had.  I love the feel and absolutely EVERYTHING here is good...  It's a little pricey, but the fried shrimp and spaghetti is totally worth it :3

We had a large party(about 30 people) here and we were so pleased with the service, food, and ambiance. Kathleen helped us coordinate the party and set a menu. She was very helpful, professional, and accomodating to last minute changes.  They sent two limos to pick us up.  This was really nice!  The drivers were very friendly.
The restaurant is very old school east coast Italian. There was a singer...and he made the restaurant feel very intimate. 
The food was great! The antipasti was really delicious and I was very pleased with the veal piccata. The service was especially wonderful! The wine was flowing...we didn't need to ask for anything!  They were so on top of it!  Brad was especially great!!!  He took extra steps to make sure we were all happy!
Thanks for such a great experience...we will come back on our next trip to Vegas!  We will recommend this place to our friends and family.

Another great dinner with co-workers. We come here every time we come to Vegas for a trade show. Never disappointed!  

I had the scallops au gratin this eve (without the mushrooms) and it was delicious. Melted in my mouth. 

Excellent service. Great atmosphere with live entertainment. 

A must go place to eat when you visit Vegas!

What I like about Casa Di Amore is that it offers an escape from the prepackaged,  homogeneous vibe most places in Vegas have.  It's got a real old school vibe, although I'm not sure how long the restaurant has actually been around.  But if it was in business in 1959, you can bet Sinatra and company would've loved this place.

I went here with a big group of friends and all agreed that the food was great!  The service during dinner was also friendly, welcoming and the courses were brought out neither too fast or too slow.  As an added bonus they even sent a limo to pick us up and take us back to our hotel.

was at this place again....11/29/08. this place opens at 4pm and so i called to ask what was the wait time without resevation and i was told no wait. so we got there at 6pm. there were many open tables. our waitress was Toni. she was good until she forgot about us when i needed more bread and more coke. i stopped eating for a few minutes waiting for her to come by and ask her for bread and coke. 

so i ordered spaghetti in marinara sauce and a coke. my bf has some alfredo pasta with sausage and he ordered a side of meatballs( which is 2 of em). my spaghetti was really good. the house bread is good too..so warm and soft! he liked his pasta specially the sausage. the meatballs were to die for!!! so good! YUMMY!!! i wish i could make some like that. for everything we paid $41. 

there was a guy singing...it was just one guy and a keyboard. he sang christmas songs and played peasnuts songs on the keyboard. my bf really liked that. he loves peanuts specially charlie brown.

I am writing this review because I dined at your restaurant a couple of weeks ago and I was not pleased. Food was below average and there was no room to move. Tight quarters to say the least. Our server was Toni from Brooklyn and she was FABULOUS!! Made us feel like we were part of her family. It was loud to begin with and to top it off there was a server ( male ) tall guy that was extremely loud with his table next to us and he took about a dozen pictures constantly bumping us. At the end of the dinner, an African American man came over and asked us how everything was. We still don't know who he was as he never identified himself. Very creepy!! Kept staring at us. Will not be back.
Great old Vegas feel, talented entertainment, delicious food! Definitely an experience to remember!

Food is always delicious. Get the eggplant di amore and you won't be disappointed! There is plenty to share with enough to take more home.

Ambiance is spectacular. It's always noisy and fun. There is a nightly house band that plays anything from Sinatra to Fats Domino- so much fun!!! 

You will likely wait, even if you have a reservation. Just knock the chip off your shoulder and enjoy. It can be about 45 minutes because the place is packed and no one wants to leave their table.

I've never had a good experience with the limo service. You will probably wait about 1 hour for your return ride, so be sure to request the limo long before you order dessert or request the check. The limos are old and the driver doesn't adjust heat or AC so you'll probably be uncomfortable.

Love this place!!!
Super tasty fresh meals.
Friendly service and great old school Las Vegas: music and decor.
Classy but not overdone!!!

as an extremely serious italian cuisine critic blathering from a mouth spanning from generations of proud & well-fed italiano descendants, I typically dined @ Casa di Amore tenuously. The gnocchi was pretty good, salmon was exceptional and the service was very friendly & knowledgable. Entertainment very nice, and the dark lighting & photos throughout of old Vegas very comforting. The crowd was very loud and boisterous, enhancing the old italian family dining experience. No surprise that the pricing was way out of line though. fifty bucks for a decent dinner and a cocktail?... seriously, like they should be spoon-feeding me & wiping my chin @ those prices.

This place is awesome. "Vegas the way it used to be" is there slogan and they are spot on. Great food, great ambiance, great service, and great entertainment. Diandre provide absolutely great service. Can't wait to come back!

The food is always good at Casa Di Amore they have a wonderful Gypsy sauce it is a fried tomato paste that is very spicy with lots of crushed pepper and oil this is my favorite thing on the menu and I Dip my bread and fried shrimp in there it is wonderful pasta is always good cherry pepper steak and pork chops is off the chain it is a must-have if your first time going there the waiter Brad is always nice and speaks gypsy language which is a plus and makes it funny to be there music is always good place is just fun all around

Went here with a couple co workers last night for half price wine and pizza and had a wonderful time. 
Amazing ambiance. And food tasted absolutely delicious. Server was attentive and made sure we were enjoying ourselves.

Ambiance is fantastic. A bit crowded and clustered, but it makes for a loud and fun environment. Hostess, waiter, and the rest of the staff were very attentive and friendly. The live music was a nice touch.

Food was delicious all around from the large meatballs to the calamari linguine and cioppino. Exotic bomba was a refreshing dessert.

Came with a group of 8 and it was unanimously our favorite meal of the weekend. We ate at a varitey of places like Bacchanal, Gordon Ramsay Burgr, Yong Kang Street, and Hash House.

A hidden gem off the Vegas strip. First off, the service is incredible! Everyone was super friendly and appeared to be helping each other out to serve food, refill drinks and clear tables. Even with that, it was still clear who our waitress was and she was super attentive to our needs and was very knowledgeable about the menu and daily specials. I believe her name was Joanne, so kudos to her! She's awesome! The food is here is amazing! I tried the ravioli, but based on the menu, I don't think you can order something "not good" here. The cocktails are also well-made and they certainly don't short you on the liquor. Even the pre-dinner bread is good! :) The manager was present the entire evening and was talking with folks as well as stopping at tables to check on people. He was very nice and welcoming. The live music is also a great bonus to this place! I will absolutely be back here and rant and rave to anyone traveling to Vegas to dine here. As another reviewer said, it is worth the drive from the strip (I believe they also do transportation, but call ahead!) and you should not leave Vegas without dining here. I second that!

Really, some of the BEST Italian food I've eaten...and, I'm Italian.  The ravioli's reminded me of the ones we used to have in Brooklyn - the sauce was fresh, fantastic and not sweet...which is how most American's mess it up.  The baked clams reminded me of the ones we used to have on Christmas Eve and the chicken special my boyfriend ordered with a pesto cream on top was to die for. Old-school, Vegas atmosphere as great as the food.  Will definitely be back with family and friends for many years to come!

Half locals, half tourists, this place perfectly captures a 1960's New Jersey Italian restaurant. It's that red sauce Italian all the way, but damn good. The atmosphere is perfect off-strip Vegas: it simulates some other time & place, but does it so authentically that you'd almost think that this is what a Northeast Corridor Italian restaurant is still like. Which is to say: the locals nay not even fully realize how impossible it is to find a joint like this in the rest of the US anymore. Mostly, it's the most enjoyable restaurant experience I've ever had in Las Vegas.
The perfect resteraunt!  From the service to the food, this place is top notch!  The best Italian resteraunt I have been to in Vegas hands down!

Went there on our last night had a coupon from rest.com. the service was slow when we did get our wine it really had to be one of the worst glasses I have had in a long time. Had the antipasto for started and it was very good. I had the stuffed pork chop (half) order it was really nothing to speak of the twice baked potato I think was frozen at one point and just reheated with Jared roasted peppers. My wife had the pasta with ham in a cream sauce that was over loaded with salt. Fresh bread was good, the live music was maybe the highlight but not worth the trip. It may have the old school feel but with so many other choices in town save your time.

Fantastico!   Casa Di Amore is an incredible Italian restaurant.  It's cozy, authentic and the staff is very friendly.  This is our second time here and it's the best we've had here in Las Vegas so far.  

My wife, bro in law and myself got here about half hour early and they received us with open arms.  They made us feel like old friends.  I had the Eggplant DiAmore, bro in law Shrimp Fetuccini and my wife, good grief, turkey dinner.  And all was delish.  Bottle of red wine, raviolis and mini Osso Bucco.  Molto buona!  Topped off with a canoli and coffee.   Not kidding, this has to be one of the best places to have dinner.  It was our 22nd wedding anniversary and they had the gentleman singing during dinner sing for us.  And guess what?   He sang our wedding song!  What a fabulous evening.  

Casa Di Amore, you are on top of our list in Las Vegas.  Congrats to you and your fabulous staff.

Came in today and service was so bad sat at the first table after 20 mintues still no service never asked if we wanted a drink.  Bus boy, host and waiters walked by us each at least 8 times we ended up walking out. Very disappointed!

Went out on Yelp and read the reviews. Went to setup a reservation through Yelp and the earliest we could get a reservation was 2 hours out. Called the restaurant and they confirmed they could take us with in 1 hour. Of course, we opted for the 1 hour. Our party was eight people.

The staff was lovely as well as the food. The portions were large and we were able to split meals between two people. The staff was okay with the splitting of meals and continued to give us great service.

The atmosphere reminded me of old style Las Vegas of the 60s and 70s. Tables were set in such a way you felt like you had your own space and were not sitting on top of others. The booths were in the old style as well. The entertainer for the night sang mostly Sinatra and Martin songs. He did an an outstanding job.

The next time I am in Vegas, I will be eating here again.

If you're not up for really crowed and loud restaurants.. This place isn't for you. Food was amazing! Music was wonderful! And the staff was wonderful! First time eating here and definitely will not be my last! Our server Brad was awesome! Love this place!

This is a great place to go off the Vegas strip (about a 10 min drive) and they offer a free limo ride to and from the restaurant.  They have half off bottles of wine Sunday and Mondays.  Great Italian food, full bar and live entertainment nightly and the atmosphere is very laid back.  The restaurant looks like a whole in the wall but you must try the food here when you're in Vegas!

What a fun place!  We were staying on the strip and the restaurant sent their van to pick up our group and return us to the hotel after dinner--a very nice touch!
This place is old time Vegas at its best.  There are vintage pictures on the wall of Vegas locations and the many movie stars who have played Vegas locations over the years.  
There was live entertainment the night we were there which only added to the ambiance.
Our server was very customer service oriented and took the time to answer all questions we had about the menu and the specials that evening.  There was about 7 of us and we all seemed to order something different.  Everything was fresh and delicious--especially the Sea Bass that was the special fish of the evening. I could sense that this is a mainstay location of the locals and it is always nice to find a diamond in the rough!  Can't wait to go back on our next Vegas trip.....

WOW.

First of all a few things that might have skewed my experience.  
1) There's no decent Italian in Hawaii
2) I just spent the rest of the weekend in Vegas spending triple digits on food that wasn't astonishing.

THIS PLACE IS AMAZING

It's open super late, the staff is incredibly accomodating and the food is out of this world.  

we got pasta, pasta and pastas and destroyed their large enough to share portions individually.

NOTE:  Their Fra Diavolo is not joking around, i spent a week eating sichuan hot pot and this bowl had my mouth on fire.

Super thankful we ran into some friends that live in the area, otherwise we would have never found this place.

SO GOOD.

In town for a convention and looking for some good Italian not on the strip. Found this place on Yelp (as I so often do) and was for the most part not disappointed. 

Staff was very friendly and service was good. My drink never ran empty, dishes were cleared promptly and the server was gracious. 

The live music was a nice touch. I arrived around 6pm and the place was pretty empty but by 7:30pm the place was packed. It was quite loud which made for a good atmosphere and since I was by myself it didn't really bother me but it might be hard for people trying to have conversation. 

The lobster ravioli and Caesar salad were good, as was the warm bread. The exotic bomba, which is tropical sorbet in a white chocolate shell was quite delicious. 

The reason I gave four stars instead of five was the shrimp scampi. It was just ok. I love shrimp scampi and this just didn't hit the spot. Maybe next time I would stick to a standard pasta and sauce dish. Based on the service and all the other items I would recommend it and would go again.
Had reservations for 4 on Wednesday night. After waiting 50 minutes were told another 15 to 20 minutes wait for our table. This was unacceptable and we left vowing to never return!  Be warned.

The live music was a hit! The caprese and garlic cheese bread were great starters. The gnocchi with cream sauce and prosciutto was amazing!
We will come back again when we are in town!

If your looking for great italian food off the strip this is the place.

This place is not that big but it seems like there is always a table.  The food is amazing and they have live performer that sounds just like Frank!  How can you beat that.

We usually start out with a house salad and some calamari and I usually get the chicken Marsala or Parmesan.  Every time it has been delicious.  Usually too full for dessert  but always kill the wine which is very reasonably priced.

Now i'm a asian guy and don't claim to know what great italian food is ilke i do with more asian cuisines.  That being said I have been to italy so i think i have a good foundation.  If that doesn't help maybe this will.  A good friend of mine is Italian-American by way of NYC.  This is the only place he will eat.  Enough said!

My husband and I go to the Casa di Amore once a week. We always have a great time and enjoy sitting at the bar and visit with the best bartenders in town: Roshy, Brian and Nicole..So I thought it would be nice to give my husband a surprise birthday dinner and invite some of our close friends. The guest list grew to almost 25 people. The management (Kathleen & Mike)and servers (Stephen)were perfect and everyone was served with courtesy, promptly and at the same time (which has never happened in a large group situation anywhere else I've been). Even late arrivals were served immediately. No one had to ask for a thing because the service was flawless. The entertainment George Bugatti and Paul Stubblefield are the best you will ever experience! Thank you Casa di Amore for a great birthday dinner! We had the time of our lives!! I highly recommend this restaurant for all of the above!!

The is by far one of the best meals I have eaten in my life. I cannot recommend this restaurant enough. Always the best service and the best food as well as great music. Make yourself happy and have dinner here.  We had 10 people in our party and we were treated like kings. The Oso-bucco is amazing, the drinks are great (and very creative) and the staff could not be better.

Awesome atmosphere for a group or a romantic dinner.  Great wine list too.  The wait staff are on point from the time you walk in the door. 
Stefan our waiter never let us sit and feel unattended. 
I ordered spaghetti with meat balls and sausage.  Absolutely delicious, not overly saucy and the pasta was cooked perfectly.   The 2 meats were seasoned like my grandmother had made them herself.
My wife had fettuccine alla pepasito. It was a wonderful dish.  It had just the right amount sauce and seasonings.
Our friend had the gnocchi.  She was extremely happy with her dinner (she's been here 10+ times).

So if you're in Vegas for a getaway please try this awesome restaurant out and see what we found out tonight...old school Vegas still exists!

First time here, classic Italian old school place. Apps we shared mussels, calamari and some amazing meatballs. I had the veal parm for dinner, one of the best I've had. Great place that the locals go to, and worth the trip off the strip!

This restaurant is a gem, and nothing short of perfection. Around 9 on a Monday night, I was surprised to see the restaurant so busy. It didn't take long for me to realize why- this place is so much fun! The decor is warm, cluttered and in your face Italian, but most definitely in a good way. Booths are cozy, tables are close, and it feels as if you're sitting down for dinner with family and friends. There was live music and a welcoming atmosphere and to be honest, I wanted to stay all night. Service was attentive, very informative, but not overly pushy. I didn't feel like our server was trying to get money out of us, he truly seemed passionate about the food and was quick to offer recommendations without being pushy, which is a HUGE plus in my book. We shared the calamari appetizer, my boyfriend had the Linguine Luciano (warning VERY spicy) and I had Fettucine Alla Pappasito. Both were superb. This was a real treat, and I can't wait to come back! Not at all what I expected to find tucked off of Tropicana. Perfect date night location or place to bring the whole family. EXCELLENT!

We went to Casa di Amore last night for dinner and it was perfect. Even though we arrived at 830 on a Saturday night without a reservation, the hostess didn't give us any attitude, she just directed us to the bar. We ordered drinks and bruschetta and chatted and listened to the live music. About 30 minutes later they called us to a table, which seemed quite reasonable given the crowd.

Our server was friendly and prompt, and the food was great. We all thought the live music was a plus - more interesting than canned music, but at a volume where we could still talk. It's nice to have a place where you can hold a conversation without having to shout.

We left with wonderful memories and will definitely come back on our next trip to Vegas.

Old school Vegas.  Try the "broken leg of lamb."  Just kidding.  Lots of managers that look like they could have been in Casino or Goodfellas.  Solid food and good drinks.  We loved the band-- Randy and Stubbie.

honestly, this place sucked.  here's why.  I've NEVER left an italian restaurant hungry until I went to casa di amore.  The seating was ridiculous.  my wife and I were sitting so close to other guests, that we could've eaten off of their plates.  I had hopes in the "homemade" noodles only to be let down.  Couldn't tell the difference between that and store bought.  Not to mention, I ordered chicken alfredo, right?  I could have literally held the amount that they served me in the palm of my hand.  I had like 5 or 6 cubes of chicken in my pasta. It was pathetic and didn't taste any better than the $1 crap I could've bought in the wal-mart frozen food section.  I paid over $20 for a $2 dish.  The italian ristorante to the west or the sicilian ristorante to the east beats this place by leaps and bounds, no question, and they don't treat you like cattle.  Let this be a lesson to you casa di amore, stop screwing your customers.

Well yet again the reviews let me down it had so many high four and five stars that I thought this must be the absolute best Italian food ever so we went there thinking we're going to have fabulous Italian food and as it turns out it's just average the portions are very small and the plates start at $28 so just for Two Plates without drinks it was $66 you add on some drinks and an appetizer and with the tip out the door you're at $110 for two people... I eat at a lot of fine dining establishments and for the price I would not have paid more than $50 for the dinner,drinks and everything... food wasn't nasty but it certainly wasn't nearly as good as everybody said it was and the portion sizes are ridiculous vs price!!
Very nice atmosphere and great band up on stage. Really nice service with delicious food. Great for a Saturday night!

The food here was pretty good. I had an Italian seasoned steak that was perfectly cooked and my dad had chicken caprese. The tomatoes on his meal looked like they came from a mass produced hot house and had zero taste. I lived in Italy for 3 years and even a tourist wouldn't get tomatoes like that. He was very pleased with the chicken under the tomatoes and ate all of it. The service was prompt but the server didn't know much about Italian food or pronunciation....lol!

Food was great. Good service. Nice atmosphere; photos of old Las Vegas on the walls and Sinatra on the stereo. Good place for a date or a group dinner. 

Eat it!
Amazing dinner and ambiance!  Excellent service!  We will be back! Loved the live music on Saturday night.. Both of our meals were cooked to perfection!

This was our 3rd time eating here and it got better everytime. The live music is great. The food is the best. The service is amazing. We went there on a Monday night. Tony was our waiter. Very friendly and knows everything on the menu. He provided Exceptional servive. Ill probably ask for his section the next time im in there. He told us about the !/2 price wine bottles.. We ordered a penot noir form oregon that wsa great. He told us about the specials and one of them jumped right out for me. Tenderloins with gnocchi in a white gorganzola sauce. I odered that and my girlfriend ordered a penne and veggie dish adding sausage to he. Both dishes had great flavor to them. we started off with the "prawns". Never tasted shrimp like that. perfectly baked. The sauce is a little on the sweet side but still worth adding on. The mussels in marinera were so good we were dipping our bread in to eat like a soup. Having eaten a whole lot didnt have much for desert. but when Tony informed me that its shipped from italy and light, I had to try the cherry bomba. He was on the money again. Full and happy we hung out for a few and listened to music. not once did it feel like they were trying to get us out the door. perfect setting. Even better service. I highly recommend this place. You wont be dissapointed!!!!!

We were visiting Las Vegas and had this restaurant recommended to me by friends who visit Vegas a lot.  It was my friend's birthday so we wanted to go somewhere fun. The limo picked us up from our hotel, he was on time and very professional.  And then we got to the restaurant.  The place looks amazing.  You feel like you've stepped back in time and that a member of the Rat Pack could walk in any moment.  The service was wonderful. The server made sure to bring my friend a birthday drink, made great suggestions and made us laugh a lot.  And the food was delicious.  We split two bowls of pasta and a salad between three women and were absolutely stuffed.   The wine list is terrific too.  Then cannelloni for dessert which I couldn't eat because I was too full but my friends said it was divine.  This will definitely be our go-to place when we visit Vegas. It was great to be off the strip and hang out around locals.  Plus the band is here is FABULOUS.

Loved the food and our server! We ate at several places on and off the strip and found this place to be the best we had. So thankful we came across it!! I doesn't look like much from the outside but the food and service is fantastic! We ordered shrimp appetizers and calamari to start - great! My parents ordered lasagna. I got the Tortellini soup - delicious! My brother ordered a salad and basically ate off of our plates because the portions were huge. My other brother got stuffed veal - AMAZING!!! We stayed for dessert - our server was wonderful! He even got the band to sing Happy birthday to my 6 yr old nephew! We will definitely return!!

Six of us decided to visit this pace based on great comments from our friends whom had visited over  the past years. 
First, it was crowded, tight seating, and noise but I will say the life music is good which makes the small place and so so acoustic rather harsh on the ears. 
That night it seemed like half of the guests had birthdays as it gets old quick to hear Happy Birthday being sung so often. 
Our server was very good
My veal was just average as I've had better for a few dollars less.  My wife's lasagna was better than my veal but a somewhat small portion.

This is perhaps the worst Italian restaurant that I have been to. I ordered Chicken Marcela and the sauce was like thick gravy,  Tasted terrible. I was using a 2 for 1 coupon and it was still overpriced.
Everything is amazing! The staff are kind and very accommodating. Food in unreal! This is our anniversary spot!
This place is amazing!!!!!! Their food is definitely authentic and full of taste! The live entertainment was great and the staff was so accommodating! Love the bartenders!

We looked on Google for the best Italian restaurants in Vegas and it gave us Casa Di Amore as one of the search results. As it is pretty close to our hotel, we decided to choose here for dinner. When we first walked in, we quickly realized just how eclectic the personalities of everyone working there were. It seemed like they all had great senses of humor, yet still keeping things classy like a classic Italian restaurant should have. The Food was excellent (I recommend the classic spaghetti and meatballs), and they had classic Vegas live music the Saturday we went as well. For dessert we had cannoli, which was fantastic. Overall a very satisfying Italian experience in an old style Vegas restaurant.

Me and my wife come here every year, they pick us up in a limo and take you to the restaurant, the restaurant has a live singer, nothing but the best love songs, its very affordable, the fodd is GREAT!!!! I didnt want to yelp it as I dont want anyone to go, LOL!!!! must reserve in advance!

This restaurant was fabulous - well worth the drive from the strip.  Usually I'm not a huge fan of live music but I enjoyed theirs.  It looked a little quiet outside but inside there was a packed house full of loud italians and good portions of delicious food.

We booked this place for our wedding party of 40 with only 4 days notice and without eating there prior- we had never even seen it as we were just in Vegas for our wedding.  We hit the jackpot!  The staff was extremely gracious and wonderful service! My family and friends thoroughly enjoyed the dinner and atmosphere that they were able to provide to us-very old school Vegas with Rat pack pictures everywhere and a 3 piece band singing Sinatra and all the classics.  Another couple even got engaged that night while we were there!  The waitstaff was patient and sweet with our large party. Our children were treated wonderfully.  The band was fantastic and the bandleader took the time to speak to me and my new husband personally and was so sweet as to ask for song requests. WE LOVED IT!   More than one of our guests mentioned that they will be coming back next time and will be recommending to all of our friends.  They even have a limo that you can reserve to pick you up from your hotel-just have to book that ahead of time but we were able to get it on short notice with some luck...

We had the car pick us up from the Mirage. The driver, Oscar was very friendly. We are here on a Monday night and drank a bottle of Valpoli Allegria. Can't beat 1/2 price bottles. Husband had the Osso Buco Veal. It was so tender you could cut it with a fork, delicious too. I had the Gnocchi Proscuitto. Yummy! It was fantastic. We will definitely return on our next visit. 
The band was great, food was great, our waiter, Steph was exceptional. Thank you for making our 20 year anniversary memorable.

After a 2.5 day video game binge I realized I was hungry, at midnight, on a Sunday ...  so I set out to find some place that was a) open b) would feed me (not just get me drunk), and c) not jack in the box(or anything of the sort).  What I found, was Casa di Amore.

First, let me say that I wasn't expecting very prompt or excellent service given the time and day, but within a minute of walking in I was seated, and very shortly there after had a glass of wine. :D Clearly I was happy with the service.

The menu was quite expansive and the wine selection was very good. After ordering, the wait for the food was relatively short given the time. around 20 min if I remember right. ... WOW! the food ... damn it was good!

The atmosphere was relaxed, not too loud, and quite comfortable all around. The background music wasn't the typical Italian joint 10 song album on repeat, it had quite a bit of variation, still lounge music but at least unique, in a way.

I'll definitely be going back, likely many times. I gave it 4 stars, would have preferred 4.5 though. Only reason I didn't give it a 5 was the price of the food. It seemed everything started at $20 a plate BUT it was worth it.

Fantastic experience, great ambiance, and top tier service. My friends were in town for our one year college reunion, so we took advantage of the free limo ride to the restaurant. You can't really beat that. The food an atmosphere are excellent. There was a live musician ready and willing to take requests. It's a little on the noisy side, but not bad at all. 

Although the food is fantastic, what really made this place excel was the service. Our waiter never missed a beat. He was funny, informative, told us the history of the restaurant, and made sure our wine glasses were never empty. Highly recommended. 

It was very busy on Saturday night, so I would suggest making reservations.

My favorite restaurant I have EVER been to! 

Great service, Great people, Great atmosphere!
We always go here when we're in town and will keep doing so. They have live bands playing and they do fun songs that you can really get into, they sung some Sinatra and it was awesome. The band members come by and talk to you on their breaks and you all become family. Atmosphere is darker, more "Romantic" "relaxing" type of setting.. definitely old school Vegas with pictures of celebrities  all over the restaurant. 

the food is PERFETTO! My favorite dish is the  Gnocchi Alla Prosciutto. I get it every time! Great wine and drink list. Service is fantastic even when they're crazy busy. You HAVE to get the cannoli's! FANTASTIC! (You even get a free shirt with it.) 

If you're staying on the strip ride in their complimentary limo! Very clean and did I mention... COMPLITMENTARY?? No nasty expensive cab ride, and it's nice to get off the Strip for a bit. 
I do recommend making reservations (at least for the weekend) because they get crowded fast for dinner time (Hint: make reservations online for easy and fast booking..but if you want a limo you do have to call).

As far as attire goes, you can either dress up or dress casual (I always go for some type of special occasion so I'm dressed up, and no you won't feel out of place.) Great for a date night with your special other half, or for a family get together graduation, bday, or even bridal shower celebrations!

Casa Di Amore is a classic. We go there on each visit to Vegas. We giggle with delight upon the arrival of the vintage limo to pick us up at our hotel. The staff from the limo driver to the hostess to the servers are all impeccably personable and make for a wonderful dining experience. Is it the best food I've ever had? No. But the pasta is delicious and it's the experience that you have when you get to Casa Di Amore that makes it so memorable. You feel like you've stepped into a neighborhood haunt in Vegas with a large Italian community and many diners celebrating life's milestones. It's cozy, charming, and somewhat tacky but in the best way. The live music is great. We highly recommend a visit to Casa Di Amore on your visit to Vegas. PS -- try the Gypsy pasta and tri-flavored ice cream dessert. Yummo!

ok so first don't go here when I'm town making this place all crowded and stuff.. If you can agree to that then you can read the rest of my review. did a yelp search for a restaurant with live music found this gem.. Called ..hostess was super nice and helpful made our reservations and got us connected to the shuttle to come pick us up.. shuttle driver was very polite and took good care of us was friendly with out being overly intrusive or creepy.. restaurant was dimly lit and romantic.. live music was oldies soul my fave but also took requests and came around to the tables singing.. food was delicious as were the cocktails (thanks goodness for the free shuttle) my only gripe was the remodeling of the restroom that was in the works and the drunk that couldn't wait and walked in on my girl in the ladies room talking about he worked there or was regular or some bullshit and they share.. wish she would have told me before we left.. anyway.. the waiter was very fun and friendly great recommendations on food. this place is a grand slam!! as far restaurants go. We spent a pretty penny here but worth it in every way. not expensive or over priced but we did drink and feast and hey that's what you do in Vegas!

I looked up this restaurant and read the reviews.  They were excellent and so was our vist.  MICHAEL our waiter was EXcellent.  Food was fantastic and music was great.  Will return fagain.  Very memorial evening.  Thanks michael. SMITH AND THE CHIEFS.

I have been coming here since I moved to Vegas in 2006. I love the food here. I've tried maybe 3 plates to be honest, once I ordered the Shrimp alla Vodka it was all over. That's literally the only thing I've ordered since my third time there. It used to be 24 hour food, then it stopped being 24 hours and went to 3 am - 10 am bar only, now I'm not sure what it is because I haven't honestly been there in about a year. But I think about it daily, and wish that it was closer to where I live or drive past for work so I could go there for food. The last time I was there it was the same waiter that served me 10 years before, and just about every time I'd been after my first, and he not only remembered me but covered the cost of my desserts as well. I recommend this place to anyone coming to Vegas looking for an "authentic" meal, but also to anyone that lives in LV that hasn't been here yet. This place has both ambiance, with the 2 person band playing old Sinatra classics, but the locked front door and open backdoor with security checking you in feeling like you're something special for knowing one of the few LV secrets left in town. The food, let's be honest, is better than whatever the cr@p was you ate at the casino last night. If you're a local, you know that because you don't go to casinos anymore. The ambiance is like a 1970's gangster get together with Sinatra wannabe's crowing in the background. Not to make the singers sound bad, but nobody is Sinatra except Sinatra, so F off haters. They do their best, but that's all they can do is their best. Nobody is Sinatra except Sinatra. Story end. The food is better than anything you'll get at some overpriced Strip extravaganza. It's not new, or special, just the best. If you want the best, come here. The locals know it, and if you don't and you're a local, rethink your life. You don't truly love Italian food until you've been here.

Brad was the best server ever! ****We are from SF California and were not expecting an exceptional server on a Thursday night in LAS VEGAS. He went above and beyond our expectations. Not only did he cater to our specific needs but maintained an upbeat spirit throughout the process. Thank you BRAD! You rocked!

I wanted to give this place a try but they would not have me. Had to deal with the most unprofessional lady manager yesterday. They will not serve you anything on the menu to go. They will also not allow you to sit, eat something, and then order something else to go. All because the bar is under construction and they don't have a place to charge me. It doesn't makes sense at all. More than half the seats were empty. I was willing to pay for an additional meal while seating. Pretty ridiculous policy and a manager that was unwilling to work with a customer. Instead of introducing herself, the manger stood right behind the hostess and had her repeat over and over that they can't serve me. Hey if you're the boss, learn to approach a customer head on and see how you could help instead of putting your bitch face on and standing there like a statue.

We had a large party planned 4 mos in advance, they forgot we were coming, demanded we show  at 4pm, not enough  waiters, food not ready, very few of us ate the food  was so bad, over charged for cheap wine, then we had to be out by 6:15 for there next party, plus no music, sounds great doesn't it!

If you are looking for a place to have a romantic dinner or just a place with a gourmet feel, this is definitely the place to go! It's off of the strip so you don't have the loud noise of the casino atmosphere in the background. They'll also come pick you up in a limo if you request (for free I believe). The food was absolutely delicious, but what made this visit special was our waiter. Brad was the best waiter I think I have ever had at a restaurant! He was very attentive but not overly in your face. He was very professional but fun. Overall I would definitely eat here again and recommend this place to any and everyone!
I love this place! The food is not cheap, but the environment is great. Kind of loud in our area of the restaurant this time, but it was a loud patron's fault.

I'm sorry to say this was the worst value yet in Vegas.  I've never given anything two stars (you can check my record), and it's hard for me to even write this, but honestly I can't understand the positive reviews.  The only thing this place has going for it is a vintage ambience, but the food was exorbitantly priced for such mediocrity.  My boyfriend and I started with the fried calamari, which had no seasoning and no calamari.  Then he got the chicken special and I got ravioli.  For what little chicken was on his plate over linquine completely drowned in congealed cream sauce, it was remarkably average and needed to be doctored up.  My ravioli, while large, was the same.  We both were looking for someone to come around and shave some fresh parmesan over our meals, but all they offer is the shake can on the table.  None of this would be horrible if our plates were $10 or $12 dollars a piece, but his was TWENTY-EIGHT dollars (always ask how much the specials are first) and mine was $20--shocking (shocking!), to quote Joan Cusack.  For three small plates (the fried calamari, the chicken, and my ravioli), and just two small glasses of wine, the bill was $100.  Worst $100 ever spent on food.  In every other city, we can get two very well-put together and flavorful meals for the price of one forgettable piece of chicken at Casa Di Amore.  So . . .two stars because the food isn't completely inedible.  Just  underwhelming and a terrible bang for your buck.

First time eating here and we were NOT disappointed! The Fettucini Alfredo was wonderful but would stood out more than the food was the atmosphere and wait staff. Our waiter Stephen was super attentive as were the bussers and all the other staff helping. The live music was such a nice and classy touch and the restaurant itself was super cute...what I imagine old Las Vegas was like. We would definitely go back!!

As others have written, this is Old School Las Vegas...and I loved every bit of it.  Our party had Brad as our waiter...this guy is great!  He's very sharp, upbeat, and funny.  We brought wine in and they took care of all of that perfectly.  We ordered a lot of food and wanted our dinner served slowly throughout the evening so as to enjoy the musical entertainment.  Everyone raved about their dishes, and the food made me feel like I was back in Brooklyn...a very good thing. I will definitely repeat.

I absolutely LOVE this place. One would never guess how awesome this pace is by looking at just the exterior. It looks like a hole in the wall joint, but once you get inside, its a cozy traditional NYC italian atmosphere. Our server, Stephan, was great. My husband and I moved to Las Vegas from Chicago, and we've been very unimpressed by the service in this city. Stephan was a breath of fresh air. The food was fantastic. I'm a New York Italian, and my husband has worked with traditional Italian circuses, and we were very impressed. This place has so may specials (half price bottles of wine, half price pizzas and cocktails) and it's open and serving until 5am to boot!!! This place has now become our favorite hang out in Las Vegas. I would recommend it to anyone, and dare them to not fall in love.

Love this place.  Definitely call ahead with a reservation or go to opentable.

Had the zuppa d'clams with white wine. $16.  Dozen large half dollar size clams in a wonderful broth that comes with garlic bread for dipping - although their house bread is yummy for dipping as well.  My friend drank the broth like it was soup!

Also ordered the meatballs as an appetizer.  Wow.  $4 for 2 large meatballs - just slightly smaller than a tennis ball.  I asked for extra sauce to dip that yummy house bread in after my friend drank all my clam broth :/

We ordered the osso buco $42 which is always a hit.  Comes with risotto.  Can get a side salad or soup for an extra $3.  The Caesar had just the right amount of dressing.  Only thing missing was the anchovies.  Special soup today was Boston clam chowder.  My other friend used his finger to clean the cup clean.  What's with my friends and soup?!  I digress.

I ordered the penne pesto (garlic, pine nuts, basil, parmigiano-reggiano with heavy cream $22) I failed to see the page description of ONE POUND PASTA BOWL and ordered grilled chicken as an add on.  I was shocked to be warned that it was a $10 add on but wanted some protein to go with my oh-so needed carb craving so I agreed to it.  Later I found out that you can add chicken to the fettuccine alfredo for only $3 which made no sense but I didn't bring it up.  It did turn my 5 star experience to a 4 star.

My other friends ordered the linguini and clams (oth chopped and shelled clams $24.  Half the size of my penne but he could finish his pasta and I took mine home) and the rigatoni.  Server commented "excellent choice" to the rigatoni order and not to the other 3.  Didn't get the price but he ate it all.  Was on the one pound menu (emoticon with the big eyes)  I tried to look it up on their online menu but it wasn't there but I did notice that several items on their physical menu were not listed.  They also have daily specials.  Today was a grilled chicken and filet tips - both sounded fantastic.  Hopefully they'll have this on our next visit.

PERKS and FREEBIES!!
free t-shirt with cannoli or creme brulee purchase.
free limo service from the strip - bummer doesn't benefit us loyal and awesome locals who want to enjoy some wine with our pasta - or soup if you're my friends. lol

What can you say about a restaurant that gives you old style Italian-American food with the casual ambiance of Momma's kitchen but still maintains a gentler, kinder Old World dignity? We loved it!
We got picked up by complimentary limo and whisked to the restaurant like we were special visiting family from out of town.
The Sunday and Monday 1/2 price bottles of wine are an excellent value especially with large groups.
The antipasto platters were a big hit as well as the appetizers...there were forks flying back and forth; I expected sparks! The stuffed portobello special that night was to die for good.
The portions are little large, but hey, it was our first night in Las Vegas and airplane food is non existent these days...
My seafood pasta was tasty but the mollusks were a bit gritty and there was some broken shell pieces....quite the surprise to bite down on a crunchy shell that you thought was a piece of mussel....the lighting is very dim.
But I just ordered another bottle of Barbera and moved on....
My husband's pork chops were excellent, but he is picky about his cheese, so the fontina was not to his taste....but I just ordered another bottle of Barbera and he moved on....
The rest of the group ate, drank and enjoyed their meal immensely while being serenaded by the keyboardist....who kept mentioning it was my birthday....but I just ordered another bottle of Barbera and, so do you see where this is going? It got a little raucus....mea culpa Tony (our waiter).
The complimentary tiramisu they sent over for my birthday was excellent, and the creme brulee done to perfection (most brulees are overcooked like a custard; this was creamy and fragrant with vanilla bean).
If you want authentic Itatlian gourmet, then go someplace that charges for the tap water and you can wear your cruisewear. But if you want good, honest food that is the a product of the evolution of Italian immigrants making  American ingredients their own, then you gotta try Casa di Amore. Did I mention they have Barbera?

Love the atmosphere there. 
It's a nice American Italian place. We and my girlfriend use to be regular there and unfortunately no more. We tried almost all they pastas and weren't bad. They started making their pasta portion really small and since it isn't handmade fresh pasta and cost most of them over 20$ or  30$ if you order it with sea food, so for me is not ok. Think that a good brand of Italian pasta cost them less than a dollar. The service on the other end is one of the best you could ever get in Las Vegas and that's why of the 3 star.
Very good food, great live music. Great personality from the staff. A little noisy, but it's just people having a good time. Great experience.

Walked n on a saturday evening around 6:45 and was seated within 10 minutes with no reservation.  Staff and servers were very friendly.  Had a spinach salad, calamari, and gnocchi. Food was great.  Will definetly come back if in Vegas again.  Live music was nice.  Atmosphere was a bit noisy.  

This is a great place to go and get off the strip with all the tourist a holes and drunk people.

What can I say? Casa di Amore delivers the goods. We had no reservation, but our table of three was quickly seated for an early dinner. This is an old school joint with large red booths where vintage Vegas posters and photos of Sinatra dress the walls. 

Warm bread got us started, an order of calamari ($13) followed. I love calamari when it's done right. When it's bad, it's BAD. There's nothing worse than deep fried rubber bands. No need to worry here, this calamari was tender and lightly breaded. The marinara sauce on the side was fantastic - well seasoned, not too acidic. I rarely find this to be the case. Needless to say, we devoured it so quickly I never snapped a photo. 

Moving on to entrees, we ordered two orders of Eggplant di Amore ($24). And the house specialty, Osso Buco ($35). I couldn't tell you which is better. They are wildly different, but equally delicious.  Eggplant di Amore has slices of eggplant layered  like lasagna with ricotta cheese, mushrooms, spinach and sundried tomatoes. It is served with a side of spaghetti.

Osso Buco is classic Italian. They roast the veal shank to perfection, it falls off the bone. It's served with what I believe is an aged sharp cheddar risotto. It is unexpected and mighty scrumptious.

I was much too full for dessert, but a canoli and tiramisu were ordered. The canoli is filled to order so the shell remains crisp and the filling is rich and not overly sweet. It was a surprise to learn a free T-shirt comes with any canoli order. Service was steady and pleasant throughout. Not a single complaint could be made. Casa di Amore is a winner.

Casa Di Amore successfully tries to recreate the Rat Pack era vibe with it's ambience, music, and food. The food is excellent and reasonably priced. The lounge singer hit all the right notes with his Sinatra decade music. But our waiter, Brad, made it memorable with his service and quips. He was helpful but not intrusive. Corny but funny.

restaurant is going downhill beyond I wish I never came is messed up my birthday first of all every time I come here its jam packed to the ceiling and I don't know why the food is not all that great but now it's even terrible not even edible restaurant is not calm and nice it is haywire nervous racket I ordered the shrimp and spaghetti spaghetti was overcooked they hardly put any sauce on the spaghetti I had to ask for more sauce which they charge more money and the sauce what they called gypsy sauce was burnt it was burnt to the max I had stomach pains as I was eating it you're not supposed to eat burnt sauce had the antipasto salad and it was good before but now it was just water so that they did not put any dressing if they did all I tasted was vinegar and water I had to ask for more dressing which I was surprised they did not charge me for the dressing their so called complementary bread is burnt and hard as a rock had a terrible time terrible experience left with a stomach ache and heart pounding and we got a free limo ride which I was embarrassed to Ride in it is a piece of junk it was dented and there was no interior lighting or nothing I never seen a limousine with no interior lights like neon lights and we was with other people in the limousine which was not right and we did not even finish our dessert and they drove us out to go to the limousine cuz those other couple waiting overpriced crappy burnt food and too nervous restaurant besides that our waiter was good but I wish I would have spent my birthday somewhere else and I wish I woulda took my car instead of taking the rundown limousine I will not go back in that limousine if they paid me . . I am very upset i did not finish eating my food . Owner came to me and said there is people waiting for you in the limo. So thanks casa di amore for  giving me a stomach ach and heart attack  and for not letting me finish  my food to go back in your run down limo .

I guess the limo thing is a gimmick for tourists. I'm a local Las Vegan. The atmosphere is like a cafeteria. It was so loud that it gave me a headache before we ordered the food.The prices are stupid high for what you get. $25 for a bowl of spaghetti with some crappy sauce & some red pepper flakes thrown in (no meat). Add $10 for 5 small Vandecamp style fried shrimps & $5 for a small & I mean small loaf of cheese bread.. I think this place is for stupid tourists that don't know any better. Any steak house at any Station Casino blows this hole out of the water.My wife & I went because our friend gave us a gift certificate. When the waiter realized that we were not impressed & we paid $80.00 of $100 gift certificate including a large tip, He through a $20 bill at us & said "Lets call it  good". I don't think they care about locals, they just want the big spending tourists.

My wife is the Italian food eater. Not me. I want burgers and fries, pizza, and soda. Typical American.
But it was my wife's night and I wanted to take her to something I thought she'd love. So I took her to Casa Di Amore. 
It was a win. The ambience, live music, the service, the food. They had it all. 
I don't eat pasta when I go out. Such a complete waste of money. But the pasta here was great. None of that frozen crap. It was the real deal. 
If you're looking for some good Italian cuisine, you might want to check this place out.

The good, the bad or the average first? - I will start with the good.

The good....The restaurant is far enough from the strip to avoid a majority of the tourists, but not too far where the cab ride will be more than a couple of glasses of wine. We walked into the restaurant and man was this place packed, but not a touristy, crazy, I gotta get outta here packed. It literally felt like I walked into a scene from "The Casino". Family and friends were sitting at tightly packed tables chatting and laughing, a live two man band was against the wall belting tunes and the walls reflected old school Vegas pics. MY KINDA PLACE, I WAS AT HOME!

The bad...My three person party walked in for our RESERVATION, told it would be a few minutes, so made our way to the bar. The first 45 minutes of waiting was not too bad, but as our wait dragged into over and hour it was clear that people were just not leaving their tables (and why would they when the wine is flowing and fun is being had). The bar and walls around the bar were packed with other parties waiting....waiting......waiting. After a couple of advances to the hostess station and getting the "15 minutes" "15 minutes" line, we were finally sat after about an hour and a half wait. The worst of the worst was when the waitress came to the table and commented to us as if we had multiple heads "So, you guys have been waiting a long time", no apologies. 

The average....The food and the service. Nothing much to wait an hour and a half for. 

Thoughts...If you have a big party or can get in without a long wait, the ambiance is worth it.

Just returned home from a week long trip out there and had to take the time to write a review on this gem of a restaurant. Although this place is always packed, the staff is always courteous, knowledgeable and treat you like you are a member of the family. The atmosphere is a time warp with a flare of modern. The walls are adorned with old pictures of Vegas and across from the bar are large flat screen TVs that rotate through pictures of how Vegas use to look as well as faces from the past. Now my favorite part, the food! On this visit I started with the arancini (rice balls) and bruschetta with buffalo mozzarella. I could eat both of these appetizers everyday and not get bored. For my entree I had the veal cannelloni. This was the best cannelloni I have ever had and will definitely be ordering it in the future. My last visit was unique in that the restaurant has opened Tiki Di Amore on the back patio. It was relaxing and a great way for our group to sit together and enjoy a drink before heading back to the strip. If you are visiting in town or a local to Vegas this place is a mandatory for dinner.

What a fun place to be! Love the atmosphere, decor, no valet parking, and half price wine on Sunday and Monday! There is live performance and totally old NY Italian feel. Awesome! 

The food is good too. The green salad came with real "green" instead of iceberg, the chicken noodles soup is delish, and the bread is warm and addictive. My friend ordered the house favorite vinegar and pepper pork chop and he loved it. The spice and vinegar is too pungent for me but for those who love it, it's great flavor. I had the fillet and risotto special. It's good but not great. The steak over cooked and risotto too mushy. Not gonna dog them for it. Still a great experience. Definitely will return when I'm back!

Fantastic in everyway! The food is excellent with a diverse menu of Italian Dishes. Great appetizers, many choices of Italian Style Chicken, Steak, Seafood, Pork and of course pasta classics. Everything is fresh  from the pasta to the seafood. Fresh french bread is served while your waiting for your order. Classic "Old Las Vegas Vibe" in the decor,  music and atmosphere. They even have a live band. My husband and I were so full we could even consider dessert from their array of dessert choices. We had enough to take home to have for dinner tonight!  He had the Veal Parmigiano the Shrimp Al Diablo. Both served with linguine with homemade sauce. This is definitely a gem in Las Vegas. We are locals who will  continue to go again and again! The staff is fantastic as well. Perfect for a special occasion or just because you want great food.

The restaurant itself was very unique along with the live two-man band.  However, beyond that not many great things to say.

The cab ride there and back was $50.  They only had one of three limos operating that night so we didn't have any options other than a cab.  We had reservations for 6:45pm.  It wasn't until 8pm that we were finally being seated at our table.  What's the point of a reservation?

The prices are way too expensive for the quality of food.  The pastas aren't even made in house.  The sauces were bland.  I found adding copious amounts of salt gave the food some flavor.  

One other good thing was our server though.  Very friendly and took the time to answer all questions we had.  Was it all worth the far trip and the long wait....no.

Nice little find on our last day in Vegas. It honestly looks almost like a low key strip club from the outside, but when you walk inside it's like an old school 40's-50's kind of feeling. There's also a random tiki bar in the back. There were a couple of guys who looked like they were part of the Rat Pack that played some good live music. The staff was super friendly and service was quick. The food was good too. My boyfriend got Grandma's chicken soup and really enjoyed it. The antipasto platter was good, nothing fabulous, but you can only do so much with that so I won't fault them for that. We shared the chicken parmesan which was super tasty and a good size portion. Overall we were pleasantly surprised. We will definitely stop by again on our next trip. The best part was the free shirt you get when you order the cannoli, especially because it's from one of my favorite movies :)
Old time Vegas restaurant. Now that's Italian. Live music evenings. Family went other night enjoyed entire evening. Band members sang to little nieces. They loved it. Danced.

My wife and I went there last night sept 27 2015 for dinner. As soon as I walked in I loved it. It's an old school feel and vibe with very friendly staff. Great live music. We talked with other tables. And the food was unreal. What a great experience. Coming from Boston and growing up with Italian food I can honestly say when in Las Vegas go here!

I'm a huge fan! Live music, old school Vegas style theme, and delicious food... I'm sold. I've been coming here for years and I honestly feel it continues to get better and better. Brad has been my server several times and he's awesome. Treats you like family and provides excellent recommendations. If you're debating between this and a different Italian restaurant, choose this!!

Are you serious? How am I just learning about what is going on inside Casa di Amore (CDA)? I've seen this restaurant more times than I can count, and never, not once even considered stopping in to check it out. I'm not a fan of Italian food so it never even occurred to me to see what they were offering inside CDA. That was a huge mistake.

I feel like I've been looking for this place for years. And didn't even know it. I don't trust anyone who doesn't dig their old-school decor and energy. And the service is outstanding.
