Lynn, the music coordinator helped  turn a simple birthday gathering into a real celebration. The band sang a special birthday song for everyone that requested it.

From what I can tell, this is a go-to birthday spot for many people. How do I know? I heard Happy Birthday at least 4 times. But who cares? There was certainly an air of celebration in the place. 

The food was solid--the insalata di amore, calamari, and cioppino were all tasty. The cioppino was (rightly) the standout of the night. And the atmosphere is pure retro-Vegas charm. I am such a fan.

Had dinner at Casa di  Amore last Saturday night.  This was our first visit, and unfortunately, it did not go very well.  The restaurant is not very big, and we were seated next to a large table of folks celebrating a birthday.  As they drank more and more, the decibel level became unbearable.  Added to that the fellow singing and playing the keyboard and his drummer kept getting louder and louder.  It was  impossible to have a conversation there.  I realize that the restaurant is not to blame (other than the singer/drummer), but it certainly made for a very unpleasant evening.  Food was good, but certainly nothing that special.  Service was attentive and professional.  Will probably not go back.

This is The Gargoyle's favorite Las Vegas off strip place. Great atmosphere and phenomenal service. The food is fresh and homemade and always delicious. Treat yourself to a fine atmosphere with a laid back attitude. Don't be surprised if someone is dancing to the live lounge music. Plenty of locals and out of towers feel at home here.

I love this place. The atmosphere is wonderful, old Vegas style, homey, and relaxing. They play classic oldies live music. The musician even came to our table, and asked for any requests.  Everyone was supper friendly from our host, waitress, and bartender.  Yet, the food was the big star. We had the Chicken Parmesan, Osso Bucco, and a Ghnocci side. Everything was amazing, and the portions were very generous.  This place probably has the best Chicken Parmesan in Las Vegas.  The cheese on top was creamy, while the chicken underneath was crispy with just the right amount of marinara sauce.  There was no need for a knife with the Osso Bucco, and it just melted in my mouth.  I couldn't stop eating it.  The flavor was rich, meaty, yet light and buttery at the same time.  It had the perfect balance. The Ghnocci hands down was the best I ever had, anywhere! We had it with the meat scauce, which I was impartial to (due to a herb flavor I personally don't enjoy).  Overall, amazing experience from the food to the ambience.  Most definitely recommend, and most definitely will be back.

The last time we were there the staff was great but the Cook was not.  He would not cook the food the way we asked for which we have asked for the hundreds of times we have gone before.  He was rude and should not be so self absorbed and know that we come for the food and the atmosphere, I am sad to say we will not be going back anytime to so we use to go three times a months minimum but since our last visit we have not been back (over a month and half ago).   Go enjoy but do not let the cook be rude to you, your paying and should get what you order!!!!

Ended up here on the recommendation of a waiter at one of the high-end Steak places in old LV. I asked "What is the Italian equivalent of this place" ( Unchanged since the 50's Las Vegas Gangster Vegasoid) Sorry to say I was VERY disappointed. This is basically foodservice grade Italian with decent sauce. Lobster Ravioli? Yep- it's the round frozen crap they sell at Costco... for $15 bucks (appetizer) Crazy. This place is mediocre by American Italian standards... if you've ever been to Italy, it's functionally inedible. Packed with screaming kids? Just like Jimmy Hoffa- you'll never see me in there again.
Excellent find. Really friendly staff and the food was excellent. Was looking for  great "off the strip" find and was not disappointed. Check it out!

Food was okay. Service from Lynn not so friendly and personable if you are comparing it to the other gentleman waiter. She never took the time to greet us and explain specials or come back to check on us periodically. When we asked her questions, it was like we bothered her. If it wasn't for the other waiter being so nice to the other table, I would not come back here.

Service was impeccable but unfortunately I did not only go for the service I went for the food..

I love Italian food and am very Familiar with authentic Italian

The appetizer bread is amazing  but I asked for butter and it tasted like it had been  in the refrigerator wide-open all night. The bread was great with some oil and vinegar.

We had the Lasagna and Eggplant di amor.
Both with fairly dry and we had the server bring us some more marinara and it still didn't do it :( 

All in all we did have the crème brûlée for dessert. It is homemade and was delicious!! 

The service, bread, and crème brûlée are great but if you plan to have a good on entrée based on what I had (which is said to be the favorites)  I would not recommend this place

Ps: the live music and the low lit he ambience is awesome so if you're looking just for a date and not worrying about food or for late-night pizza it would be fine

I have been going there at least 8-10 times a year over the past 15 years until lately.  I hate to say this about a place that I use to just love and thought that not only the food but the atmosphere was first rate.  Tonight ended my love affair with Casa.  This was the 3rd time over the past year that I was really disappointed with the food .  Granted the atmosphere still has people flocking to it but there are just to many fabulous restaurants in Vegas to go to and the quality in my opinion has really been compromised.  What did it.  To start with was the salad. In my opinion they must have prepared it well ahead of time and then refrigerated it.  Why, because the cheese and salami that make part of the base were basically frozen to the plate.  Yes, stuck and hard to peel away from the plate and finally when biting into it you could tell it was frozen.  Finally, the steak my wife ordered was way overcooked.  The waitress apologized but didn't make an effort to ask whether she wanted another.  Well, finally the service was slow as if they were understaffed.  We didn't complain about anything because we both knew that this was the end of an era.  I don't know whether ownership or management has changed but the quality has gone down hill and I haven't even mentioned my order.

Italian DISASTER!  This place promotes itself as if it is bigger than it is, so they stuff you in the bar to wait then cram you around a table in the cramped dining room.  Family style?  Not my family.

Now this is a hidden gem in this cookie cutter dump of a town.  Doesnt get much better than this.  Love the atmosphere here.  The food has always been spectacular.  Been here 5 times and never been disappointed.  Spent a New Years Eve here and it was fantastic.  Highly recommended.

We recently went here for our anniversary and man, it was a poppin place for a Friday night! We had reservations for 9 but weren't sat until close to 10 but that was okay, they had warned us they were behind. We are locals here and really enjoyed the vibe of this place. We sat at the bar and enjoyed the live music and conversation of strangers, it was great! We were seated and apologized to for the wait. We ordered the most delicious mozzarella and prosciutto crustini, they must make their cheese in house because it melts like butter, sooo good! For dinner we had the chicken piccatta and chicken Marsala, the portions were great and very tasty and our server was a great man full of helpful suggestions about the menu. Thank you for the great experience, we will definitely be back!

Very good place with interesting perks. They offer shuttle service to hotel guests in the area (or to locals that want to leave their car in a hotel near their house instead of driving) and live music daily, for example. Prices are a little steep, though. A meal for 2 cost us $120. If you can spare the $$, it's worth it. 
Brad was our server and he's delightful! He's been here for years, so just ask him any question and he has the answer!
He recommended fried calamari for an app, and it was delicious! Their marinara sauce is amazing!
We had the Fettuccine alla pappasito and Eggplant di amore as entrees, and they were very good. Eggplant was a little too salty for my taste, but still good. 
For desert we had tiramisu and cannoli, and they were both phenomenal!

Overall, the food & service were mediocre.  The highlight of our dinner was the osso bucco - I would suggest it to a friend.  However, do NOT try the twice wrapped shrimp appetizer!  OMG - what is that??  Is it wrapped in donut dough?  And is the dipping sauce a caramel base?  It tasted like carnival food.  We were confused & so were our taste buds.  

On the other hand, the entertainment is pretty solid - some might say "jaw dropping!"

Got to love old-school Vegas ambiance: velvet walls, high booths, a gaming bar in the back with random regulars popping through the back door. 
 A 1-3 piece music act delighting the room with Mob-age treats.
The food is excellent; the menu extensively covers Italian favorites, classics, and a few twists.  Spicy lovers, do the Gypsy sauce if you can handle it.
They have delicious veggie meatballs.....but you have to pay extra for them......only sometimes.
Bar specials after midnight
Open 5pm. to 5am
Closed on Tuesdays

WOW!! Such an unforgettable experience at Casa Di Amore! Tony our waiter was amazing! The chicken Parmesan is delicious! I ordered mine with angel hair pasta- the sauce is so good! My husband ordered the Steak Flambe with the bernaise sauce- rib eye! It was delish! For dessert we got the cannoli (shells are flown in from Brooklyn, NY weekly and they stuff with cream to order) and we also got the Spinoni (flown in from Italy!) WOW!! Desserts were amazing! The live music is Motown jazz and excellent! Will definitely return soon!! Plus, I also got a free t-shirt with my cannoli dessert!!:)
Grabbed some takeout but it had such a charming vibe inside I will definitely come back for a dine in experience :)

Honestly such a hidden gem went in last night and our server Michael was awesome. Very knowledgeable and attentive. The bread is to die for we got full off bread and salad. And our entrees were the best Italian we've had in vegas! And their live band was a great definitely will be doing back!!!
We go there every time we go to Vegas and once we went on valentine day great food and very friendly staff this would be the fifth time in three years

More like 4.5 

First time I walked in here, I was a little scared that I might be walking into the Mob's headquarters. But after we were seated, boy was I charmed by this place.

There's live entertainment on the weekends (not sure about other times) and that man can sing! He knows how to work up the crowd and get people dancing. It's just a feel good environment and everyone makes you feel like family in there. 

First time I came, there were 3 of us and we decided to share everything we ordered: the antipasto sampler, eggplant di amore, gnocchi alla prosciutto, and their special of the night which was a herb chicken with pasta. The food was nothing short of amazing, except for the gnocci. It was too rich for my liking. Cheese sauce plus the gnocchi, which are just potato dumplings, was just too much. But other than that, food was pretty great.

Second time, my bf and I started off with their fabulous garlic loaf. When they say fabulous, they mean FABULOUS. It was stuffed with garlicky cheese and just hot out of the oven. Delizioso! Then we had the twice wrapped prawns which had a tasty sweet walnut sauce. It was pretty good but I'd say it could use less filo dough and more prosciutto and cheese. Still not bad though. Lastly, we had the fettuccine alla pappasito and that was excellent. The sausage was spiced perfectly and there was a large helping of them. Also, usually if you split an entree, they'll charge $5, but our waiter just brought out an extra plate for us to split it at the table so the $5 charge was waived. Super nice of him!

This place has been fun times each time I came and I think there will be many more visits here. Good food, live entertainment, great restaurant!

Wow, I hate to sound grumpy, but I feel like I went to a different restaurant than the reviewers who gave it 5 stars. Over priced and marginal food at best. Sadly, my favorite part of the meal was the half priced bottle of wine. They had a keyboard player and violinist and they were talented, but the volume was so loud we couldn't even hear each other talk. The room is so small, the music just overpowered everything. Won't be back any time soon.

We went late on Sunday night and the place was packed and we didn't have reservations. Didn't think we'd need any at that time. However, they were able to seat the 2 of us right away at one of only 2 tables available. The food was phenomenal and the staff was very friendly. Our waiter, Tony, was very personable and attentive. My wife needed to custom order her dish and they gladly accommodated her needs. It can get a bit expensive if you order an appetizer, dessert and a lobster dish. Our dinner for two, even after using a $25 gift cert from restaurant.com was $98 including tip. If you order a canoli or creme brulee, you get a free souvenir t-shirt.

this place is off the beaten path and very unassuming in the strip mall area, but we had so much fun here, that it is worth the trip.  The wner is entertaining, he plays instruments, sings to everyone and keeps the atmosphere very upbeat and fun.  We came with a big group from work and we were all apprehensive about the appearance and the location, but were we surprised.  The waiters were terrific, the place was filled with locals and the decor is that old school rat pack, Vegas as it used to be style, its really nicely done.

I had the veal. Tammy the linguine & clams, we both shared and the food was great, portions were huge and the rest of the people we were with all had the same compliments.  The drinks were healthy and the wine list, although limited, was sufficient and well thought out.

This is the type of fun place, that the owner should be proud to own and as a patron, i was glad we were lucky enough to go in here.  I will definitely be back again and again and if we laugh 1/2 as much next time as we did last time, then it will be 2wice as much as we would have expected anywhere else.

I could go on and on about this place, the food, the music, the fun, the people, the service, the friendliness and spirit - were a perfect combination and even as i finish this review, i wish i were there.

Was recommended this place by a fellow lover of eggplant and I'm glad it was. 
Everything we tasted was amazing. The staff was amazing. The ambiance was amazing. 
We'll be back for certain.

Every time I go to Vegas, I'm from California, I come to this Italian restaurant. It is the best in Las Vegas! It's off the strip about a mile or so, but worth the drive or cab ride. From the moment you make a reservation, to walking in the door and being greeted by the host, to meeting your waiter, the service is impeccable! 

Now, for the food...I had spaghetti and meatballs. They do not skimp on the portions. I have left overs for days, or you can split a meal with someone. This spaghetti is almost identical in flavor to the spaghetti I had in Southern Italy! Sooo amazing! The meatballs aren't the best I've had, but they are great too. I absolutely adore this spaghetti because they cook the noodles to perfection! My partner got Lasagna, he loved it! My mom got chicken parmigiano, it was also delicious. 

I also had a party of ten, with a reservation, we were immediately seated and served drinks. Our food came out quick, & piping hot! Our server was so nice an assertive, he always smiled and took care of every need! The manager even came over to make sure everything was perfect! Now that's service! 

On top of all, they had wonderful singers, two gentleman sang some of our favorite frank Sinatra songs, and serenading a 90yo birthday girl! It was fun to watch. I just love this restaurant and everything they do!

Probably the best Italian food besides my nonna's. Great drinks, friendly staff, delicious food, and fun musicians. I highly recommend their gnocchi's. Been many times before but never remembered to write a review. Can't wait to go again!

Hit this for a friends birthday. I was impressed with the food and the atmosphere is classic vegas. A lounge band and singer really get the place moving and it is something that really feel like an old school experience. 

Food was good. No complaints form our party and everyone was pretty satisfied. I would recommend for family style itialian with a Vegas lounge feel. Probably best for parties and large groups as the accomodation just feel that way. Also, have a limo service that will pick you up form the strip areas and drop you off. A nice feature for parties.

Even with a reservation, it took about 45 minutes extra to seat our party of five.   This is a small, very busy restaurant with limited space once you are inside.  Seating is congested and you need to get accustomed to the general noise level which includes the live music and  chatter of waiters and customers

Surprisingly, I was the only one of our group to order a regular meal off the menu.  I chose the Chicken Alfredo which I found to be a nice size, tasty and fairly priced.  The others in my group elected to try various side dishes for their meals including a tasty meatball and various pasta options.  Overall, most of our group felt the portion sizes were larger then they wanted to eat and were happy with the smaller plate options.

Service was attentive, prices were fair and the noise level was higher then we would prefer. .

My dance group and I traveled to Las Vegas in December. In total there was about 30 of us. We were looking for a place to have one last team dinner before returning home. I called asking if we they would have room for us in about 30 minutes. They said they would try their best but can't guarantee all the tables will open up. We arrived in 20 minutes and they were all ready for us! Our dinner here was one we will never forget! The staff was so friendly, the waiters and waitresses were extremely accommodating to our large group, the food was amazing. THE SINGERS! They sang some Chicago songs specifically for us as we are from Chicago and even let one of us get up there and sing a song too! Definitely some of the best service we have received. Would recommend to anyone!

We discovered this restaurant on a recent trip based on a recommendation from a family member. Everything about the experience was awesome. The staff, the food, the ambience. We ordered the stuffed pork chops and chicken caprese. I think my husband might of fallen in love with the pork chops. The twice baked potatoes were surprisingly delicious. Love that it was off the strip, and more local. I'm Italian and originally from New York, and this honestly was some of the best Italian food I ever had.

The two stars are solely for the entertainment director and the 2 guys in the black shirts that kept checking on us. Came in on a Saturday night, pretty busy; we were seated quickly though. Our water was so awkward and disconnected, was so off-putting. The food was the biggest disappointment. The lamb on the bed of risotto tasted like dirt. The chicken francaise (sp)? tasted like the entire bottle of salt was dumped on it. And the water...I think the ditch water might have tasted better. The entertainment director told us to tell our waiter it was our sons birthday bc they do a little something special...aaaaaannnddd nothing. Needless to say our waiter can kick rocks and he didn't get tipped. The entertainment and our two runner guys got the tip. Thanks guys. We won't be back...ever.

My husband and I went here while we were in Las Vegas. It was my first time!! I LOVED this restaurant and it will be a favorite, when we go to Vegas! The food was great, there's live entertainment and out waiter, Brad, made the night!! I HIGHLY recommend going here!!!

What more can I say the food was delicious and the service was phenomenal and the music and entertainment took me back to the old mafia days when Las Vegas had character.  My favorite dish was the angel hair pasta spaghetti and the special bread loaf.  Last but not least the singer reminded me of Frank Sinatra and Tony Bennett and Tommy Dorsey and Sammy Davis Junior.  good times and good food what more can you ask for.

It's funny that I went here after I watched the Anthony Bourdain where he bemoans the trend of traditional Italian-AMERICAN food disappearing, as it dissolves into a mishmash of regional cuisines of Italy. Is there something shameful about a veal parm? Not in my book, and not in Bourdain's either.

Old school, dark walls, candles on the table. I also had the pleasure of watching the Godfather on AMC's mob week before I went here, so it was awesome seeing pictures of old Vegas like the Sands with Dino and Frankie on the marquee. They send a limo to pick you up, and all you have to do is tip the driver. 

Onto the food! Well first the wine. Their wine list was surprisingly pricey, but the cheap 30 dollar chianti was a solid pick. The bread was uninspired, the butter clearly pre-frozen. I ordered the pork chop saltimbucca, half order, because TWO 8oz pork chops is a little too much. It was pretty good, a little salty. My friends ordered lasagna, fettuccine, eggplant parm. I tried all of them, and while it's nice to have these italian american classics around, I could have made these at home for half the price, easy. However, it's a solid place and I liked that it was off the strip and not touristy as hell.
What a zoo. It's crowded and very loud. The food is good enough but who want to eat in a high decibel crowded equivalent of a rock concert. We wont be back.

So I'd heard about this place a few times, but I had never actually been there.  The most I knew of this place was that the former Frank Sinatra sound-alike that used to be at the Brown Derby at the MGM Grand (now Craftsteak) performed there.  Well, I'll tell you that this is some of the best Italian food I've had here in Las Vegas.  Yes, the place is small, but the atmosphere is wonderful, especially the live music during dinner.  I liked the fact that the singer came from table to table shaking hands and singing.  Also that people felt free enough to dance and to toast each other.  I had the Pomodoro Fresco, which is the pasta with garlic butter and tomatoes.  Yummy!  And for dessert, I had their cannoli, which was absolutely fabulous!  Reminded me of cannoli from the late, great Albina's bakery and also from back east in Buffalo at Ilio DiPaolo's restaurant.  Also, because I got the cannoli, I got a free T-Shirt with the restaurant logo on the front and the immortal line "Leave the gun, take the cannoli" on the back!  So cool!  Will definitely be going back there!

Short trip off the Las Vegas strip! Excellent Food!  We had a party of 29 people!  Service was top notched! I had the Shrimp in Vodka, I wish I had taken some to go!  Would go just for this place.   It gives you the ambieance of an old Las Vegas club and the singer they had that night wasn't bad!  If your in Vegas you gotta try this place out.

Food was very good,especially stuffed garlic bread, unfortunately,several problems were encountered. We were seated very close to a wedding party, and our chairs were constantly being bumped by guests and servers. The singer, within 2 hours, sang5  songs, 2 of which was happy birthday. Noise level was excessive. Server had no clue if they had certain foods, and manager, at least we thought it was the manager, did nothing but walk around doing nothing all night, till we left, then asked if everything was ok.  drinks were not served in correct glasses. I will try again, since the food was yummy.

Excellent restaurant! Went to dinner here for my bachelorette party and it was amazing! The food was delicious and the service was excellent! Loved how they played live music too! Also, they drove us back for free!

Stepping through the Casa di Amore door is like going back in time to old Vegas of the 1960s. The decor is vintage and New York Italian restaurant style with low lighting and some big plush booths. There was a live pianist/singer there, who is talented and took requests. My husband and I requested some songs that are not well known, however he knew them all! Even though we were staying on the strip, we were willing to venture out to try authentic Italian food, which did not disappoint. I ordered the pasta with clams, which ended up being a huge serving with a generous amount of clams. My husband ordered a special, which was a pasta with pesto, seafood, and artichokes. The bartender knows how to make good old fashioneds here, and there is also a great selection of wines to choose from. The ambience is really special here, as the audience gets into the music and you truly feel like you are a local back in old Vegas. 
***I recommend making reservations if possible, as you will probably get one of the better seats. I would also recommend taking a Lyft/Uber/taxi as it would be quite a walk from the strip, and walking back afterwards could be a bit challenging since the drinks are potent and reasonably priced ;)

Absolutely the best Italian restaurant I have been to here in Vegas. Reminds me of east coast. The staff is warm and welcoming, the garlic butter is delicious and I have yet to have a dish there I ever wanted to stop eating.

Old school Vegas at it's best.  This place is arguably the best Italian food in town.  I had the Eggplant de Amore with a side of meatballs.  Both were perfectly cooked and incredible.  It's a bit pricey, but well worth it for a special night out.

How have I waited this long to review this place?!? One of our favorites, we can't stay away. For romantic date night, special holidays, dinner with friends this place is the best. The servers are always incredibly friendly and helpful, the place is always lively and filled with good vibes. There are two lovely gentleman playing music for you, they take requests and have serenaded me a few times. They are one of the highlights of this place. I can't even begin to name all of the items we have ordered off of the menu because we have been here so many times, but they have all been delicious! A few of my faves are their meatball appetizers and the ravioli, but seriously try everything. We celebrated Valentine's day here this year as well, and although we don't normally do anything on that holiday we are thinking of celebrating here again because it was so much fun. Check this place out, you won't be disappointed!

I came here for my 21st birthday dinner with my family (we had a party of six).

First off, we were picked up at our hotel, The Orleans, and driven to the restaurant by the complimentary limousine. The limo driver was extremely nice, the music was great and it was so relaxing not having to stress over parking or finding the exact location. 

When we arrived, they immediately sat us down and took our drink orders. When they brought our drinks, one of my brothers was extremely thirsty and chugged his drink. Before he could even put down the empty glass, they were there to replace it. It was crazy how great the service was. I honestly wouldn't have even expected anyone to see that he had finished his drink since they had literally just brought it to us. 

We ordered a wide variety of meals from lasagna to chicken parmesan to chicken marsala. Every single one of us LOVED the taste/quality of our meal. It was by far the best Italian food I have ever eaten.

The atmosphere was great. It's a small restaurant so there aren't an overwhleming amount of people and it has a very classy feel to it. There is live music playing old school songs (Sinatra for example) and the entire ambiance is very comforting.

Lastly, we ordered cannolis for dessert. These were also very delicious. Not to mention, the great service stated earlier was maintained throughout dinner.

This place was perfect. I debated between numerous restaurants for my birthday dinner and I was far more than satisfied with my decision. My family and I will be back for a nice dinner every time we are back in Vegas.

Nice old school Vegas look and feel. Very small, so I recommend a reservation. I had lasagna, my friend had chicken parm, and we had the garlic loaf....everything was amazing! Another nice thing, they are open until 5am....perfect for vegas lol!

Love this place! Yes they were under construction but it's ok. Went with 8 to celebrate my husbands birthday. They were fantastic. The manager didn't charge us a corking fee to open my husbands gift of crown royal since the bar was closed and they were fantastic in serving the cake that I had dropped off. We come here at least once every few months. The food is fantastic! Very friendly server and very attentive!
What a great find. Food and wine were great. Atmosphere and service top notch. Very comfortable  place.

We went to Casa d Amore since we hadn't been there in a long time.  We were so disappointed in the food. We ordered chicken parm and eggplant parm. Both were bad. The eggplant tasted like freezer burn and the chicken tasted like a slab of processed plastic. Nothing tasted fresh. It was awful and overpriced for the quality. It used to be one of our favorite places, but we won't be back. Service was ok and they did make a small adjustment on our bill.
Fantastic food and great servers!  Very fun atmosphere. The live music was fantastic. Our server took lots of pics on our phones for us and we didn't even ask.  It is an awesome restaurant.

When planning our most recent trip into Vegas, the girlfriend and I decided we wanted to get away from the Strip and do something different, and Casa di Amore seemed to fit the bill. I made reservations with their complimentary limo service a little over two weeks in advance, just to be safe, but I think you could get away with reserving it the week of your visit. Our driver arrived promptly and was very friendly on the short trip to and from the hotel. Upon arrival at the restaurant, we were seated promptly and treated to exceptional service from our waiter, Stephen. He was very professional and extremely helpful, but also very personable and friendly -- he earned one or two stars on his own. (I had no idea about the pint chug challenge at the Aria, but thanks to Stephen, I'll be trying that on my next Vegas trip.)

The food was nothing short of delicious. I ordered the Chicken Caprese at Stephen's suggestion and my girlfriend ordered the house specialty, the Osso Bucco. Both dishes were tender, flavorful, and came in very large servings. Neither of us had room for dessert, though there were many tempting options on the menu. (It was challenging enough finishing our bottle of wine after all that food.)

Great ambiance. The live music was entertaining, the decor hearkened back to old school Vegas, and every staff member we encountered was wonderful. Could not have asked for anything more in this area.

One more note: while this place gets the $$$ by Yelp standards (upwards of $30 per person), it's fairly priced for a delicious Italian meal in a very fun environment.  Throw in the free limousine service, the discounts on wine bottles on Sun/Mon, and the exceptional waitstaff and it's unlikely that you'll be disappointed in your dining experience.

We'll definitely be bringing friends back with us on our next weekend in Vegas.

What?!  Outside looks like an old Pizza Hut. Inside?  Like you've time traveled to Vegas in the 1950s!  Fun lighting, close tables and booths, live music with sing-a-longs.  Service was outstanding (how could our server hear over all the singing??). Food was outstanding. Tiki Bar outside in the back is icing on the cake. 

Go.

Here are just a few things I did not see on the other reviews. First as has been mentioned good Italian food but for off strip a bit pricey.
They are closed on Tuesday which you dont see very often. They are opened until 5 am in the morning. From 11PM until 5AM there is half off Pizzas and Cocktails. And yes they sell Pizza and its quite good.

My favorite old school Italian! Besides great food at a reasonable price, you'll be entertained by a small band that plays Sinatra, Elvis and requests. The restaurant isn't very big but they cram a lot of tables in there. Still, you should make a reservation unless you want to hang out in the bar and play video poker while you wait. Lots of fun old Vegas pictures hang in the walls too. Large portions of food! The gnocchi with steak tidbits is amazing! As far as I know, it's a special they offer occasionally and isn't on the regular menu. They also make a great martini!

Been wanting to try this place for quite awhile and finally got the chance while my parents were visiting for the holidays.  Everything about our experience was incredible...starting and ending with our awesome waiter, Brad.  He took care of us from the moment we sat down and at every step along the way....we will definitely be requesting him for our [many] future visits.  Everyone at the table enjoyed all items that were ordered, starting with a bottle of Sauvignon Blanc, followed by an appetizer of mushrooms and followed by 4 very different meals; ranging from eggplant to salmon to chicken to veal.  The portions were huge but our take home containers were surprisingly light.  Whether you are a local or a visitor, you won't be sorry with a visit to Casa Di Amore!

We went here for dinner as a group because someone had heard about the restaurant and knew the owner. It is a few miles from the strip, so normally we would never go here.
They will send a van/bus for free to pick you up and return you to your hotel if you request it. Just tip the driver!
The food was very good and we all had different dishes. Spaghetti and meatballs were excellent and the scallops au gratin were great too. My wife had a chicken dish (don't remember the name) but it was very tender. The dessert cannolis were great. We had a fun time and would definitely recommend going off-strip to give it a try!

This is our favorite restaurant in town. When we have to entertain people from out of town or have a special occasion or just a date night, this is our place. We celebrated our engagement here. 

Do yourself a favor and eat the stuffed pork chops here before you die. The best I have ever had. They have a great wine selection. The family and friendly environment adds to the quality of this place. 

You can not go wrong. The prices atmosphere and lets not forget the amazing food have this place right up there with the best of Las Vegas. Sure it's not the most expensive, rare, or trendy place in Vegas, but who the hell wants all of that all of the time?

My husband and our friends were headed to Vegas with some friends to celebrate our 15th anniversary. We wanted to try something authentic and off the strip and I looked at Yelp and found this place.  Since I had never been in a limo I was quite excited that they provide free limo service to and from their restaurant.

We were picked up promptly at 6 at the MGM for our reservation at 6:15.  We were sat immediately and greeted by a very pleasant server (Lynn?) She was very attentive at first but as the restaurant filled up we saw her less and less and seemed like were an annoyance when we asked for something.  

Drinks were very good, so was the bread. My gnocchi pancetta was TOOOO good.  Amazing really. I have had a lot of gnocchi and this was obviously made fresh.  Husband had fettucine and said "meh".

Couple with us had lobster ravioli, he said the sauce overpowered the lobster but that it was still good. They also had steak and it was the best steak i have ever tasted. It actually melted in your mouth. Thankfully it was big enough for her to share :)

We had canole and creme brule for desert.  I have had much better creme brule.  I wasnt impressed.  The canole was pretty tasty tho.

The ambiance is really great. It has the feel of old 50' s mobster style Vegas. Red paint and bricks. Just cool. The live band was awesome and really set the tone singing Dean Martin and Frank Sinatra.

So where does the star fall off of a 5 star rating?  When we went to pay the bill I had a restaurant.com gift certificate (which by the way is a rip - dont use them....lots of hidden fees and rules - pain in the butt).  I gave it tand my credit card for the remaining balance to the server and she disappeared. She brought back a receipt and our friends bill which they paid.  I was confused that I didnt have a receipt for my credit card and tracked her down because she was not coming back to our table. I asked if the bill was settled and she said it was and said goodbye.  The limo driver then drove us to the strip. Half way there we were basking in the great meal and mood of being in a limo and satiated.  When the phone rang. I could hear the limo driver talking about an unpaid bill.  He asked me if  we had paid and I assured him that we had.  He argued with someone on the phone and then handed me his cell phone.  The guy on the other end asked if we had paid and I told him what had happened and said the server confirmed we had paid.  He said for some reason she didnt run our card and therefore I gave him the card info again over the phone.

I did not appreciate the insinuation that we were dining and dashing, especially since we were obviously taking THEIR limo back to the strip.  WTH?  I also didnt appreciate the server not taking responsibility for her mistake and then putting the issue on us while we were trying to enjoy our limo ride back to the strip. I spent 5 of the 10 minutes on the phone with the staff working out payment.

I think they need more servers because our server was fantastic and then when it got busy we barely saw her and this mistake occurred, surely because she was busy.  Still obnoxious.

All told, we would go back but I really was pissed about the payment issue.

Flattering original review (see below) ... complete with venue backstory ... but ... UPDATE: Houston, we have a problem.

I dropped in one recent weekday evening around midnight. I ordered the 16 ounce bone-in Ribeye Sinatra (again), medium rare. 

What I got was a 10 ounce, no-bone, zero-marble cut of meat. I am pretty durn sure I was passed off a sirloin strip instead. OK, MAYBE the cook trimmed out the bone ... but that would have to have been a HUGE bone. And where's the marbling?

And it was dry. Really, really dry. Dry like chew-chew-chew dry. The exact opposite of juicy. Dry. Desert dry. I say again, dry.

And, under oath and penalty of perjury, I testify there was SOME pink in there to be seen, but really the steak was cooked to the far side of full-on medium. And it even tasted a bit sour; let's hope the day-shift hadn't already written-off this hunk of meat as too far out-of-date. 

So we are talking wrong and/or bad cut of meat ... and cooked wrong, to boot.

Now I am wondering if my slab of ribeye actually landed somewhere else, given one was already paid for. By me.

Oh, and there was no waiter. He/she had apparently been cut and so the bartender - while trying to appease about 10 drinkers/players at the video poker bar - also had to appease me. Given he might miss a winner's sweet tip due to being too inattentive at the VP bar, I was fortunate he worked to give me most all the attention I required. But a scrambling bartender does not equal a waiter. And, as I said, not fair to the bartender either.

And what a racket! Blasting some kind of crazy hip-hop rock nonsense (instead of music) that could only be appropriate for mentally blurring the VP players into dropping more money.

After soda, salad (a $3 add-on) tax and tip, I was out-the-door for well over $50. At that price, this quality of steak & service & ambiance was just a flat-out fail.

And perhaps that is why the next booth over (the only other occupied booth in the house) they were splitting a loaded 18" pizza (that did look tasty) that was coming in at about $12.50 due to a late-night, half-off deal. Instead of ordering from the full dinner menu.

I thought about sending the steak back, but instead decided to just tough it out (pun intended) then take a pass on CdA for a while ... and give it a chance to smooth over these jagged edges. In the meantime, I've pulled a star back ... and started noting other all-night dining venues of merit.

Wow, the staff at this restaurant ROCKS, they are some of the best I have ever seen, everyone has a smile on their face and is such a pleasure.  The food is very good, the place is loud, talking is very hard,  They have some great live music, so just be prepared to have some good food and very little conversation.  The only disappointment was the 'Fabulous Garlic Loaf', man, my mother could kick the crap out of that.  I was expecting this great Italian bread loaded with garlic and butter and baked to perfection, what I got was a hot loaf of bread and some garlic butter...really, for $5?  You guys should re-think this.  But, the place is always full and the food is good and the staff is AWESOME!  I will be back.

This place was really quite good. I'm giving them a rating of three stars for a couple reasons. One the place tries to sell itself as being a little higher class than what it really is. It's in a seedier end of town actually not that nice inside. 
Having said that, the food was quite good. The sauce was good, garlic bread also very good, and they had a surprising prawn appetizer which they wrapped in bacon and served with a peanut caramel sauce. 
All in all a good spot, just know that if the prices were a little lower and you have a better understanding of where you're going it makes for a better experience. No need to dress up

Such a fun place to eat a Birthday dinner at. Loved the look of the place. They had live music. A huge bar. Great servers and managers always asking if everything is ok. The food was sooooo good. We had pasta od course. Definetly a great portion size. And great tasting as well. Just the right amount of everything in it. The Garlic cheese bread is so soft and fresh. One of the best i ever had. Hands down. I thought everything was great.... Then the Canoli came out. OMG!!!!! The BEST!!!!!! You even get a free t-shirt when you order it. Which i think is hilarious to me. But damn...... One of the best Canoli's that i ever had in my life. And trust me... I had a lot of pasteries in my time. LoL. If you're not planning on going back for the music or pasta. You'll go back for the Canoli. Trust me. It's that good.

Simply the best restaurant in Vegas.

Casa blends the decor of old Vegas with the warmth of an Italian family and food that is consistently *perfect*. 

No ... seriously ... this food is ridiculous.  There's not a single item I've tried on the menu that did make me stop chewing to stare at my wife in wide-eyed amazement.   Everything from the tender meat to the pasta to the sauces to the tangy, perfectly salted house dressing is incredible. 

The staff is friendly and funny, the live music is old Vegas and hilarious.  

You'll eat like royalty and feel like you're in Goodfellas (without all the murder). 

Casa di Amore is the very spirit of Vegas.
Incredible food and atmosphere and wonderful staff. The service is incredible, very friendly and know the menu. The live music is phenomenal. Overall one of my favorite places in Vegas.

This is a slice of old Vegas.  The ambiance is vintage and makes you feel like Frank is in the next booth. The service is good, and the food is excellent. There's only one thing to say about this place. "Leave the gun, take the Cannolies."

Wow, what can I say.  We came here because of the great reviews and we were not impressed.  No, it wasn't bad.  It just didn't "blow us away" like some said.  We ate here on a Wednesday night and it was pretty full.  The service was good but the singer was not very good.  I felt embarrassed for him a couple of times as he kept hitting the wrong notes.  The music was a little louder than I liked and it made it difficult to have a conversation.  The food was very tasty, the portions just right, but the prices were a little steep for the location.  $22 for a plate of gnocchi was a bit too much for this old building.  I say that if you drive a 78 Cadillac and think slicked back hair is cool then this place is for you.

Not quite 5 stars, but neither is it 4 stars. I agree with Dad on this one: 4.5 (Unfortunately, I can't give half stars). But since everybody else LOVES this place, I'll bump it up to 5 instead of giving it 4 stars (this one's for you Dad, since I just rated the Buffet at the Bellagio for Mom).

A limo from the restaurant came to pick us up at 7:25 PM for our reservations at 7:45 PM. Dad said the limo was complimentary... I have no idea. Dad did the research and made the reservations- I just tag along and eat.

GARLIC LOAF: Loaf of homemade bread sliced and stuffed with garlic, Italian seasonings, mozzarella and parmesan cheese. It was VERY good, albeit a little salty/garlic-y. And maybe a little too cheesy. But still delicious.

OSSO BUCO: It literally is fall-off-the-bone good as the restaurant claims. Not too salty (which is a big thing for me). But the shank is HUGE.

PORK CHOPS SICILIAN: I think Dad ordered this. Two 8 oz pork chops served with potatoes and vegetables. Definitely a man's meal.

CIOPPINO: Very tasty dish comprised of fresh seafood including: lobster, clams, mussels, scallops, crab, cod, and shrimp. The soup part goes very well with bread (but I'm trying to lay off the carbs). I'm pretty sure Dad enjoyed it, though. He claimed he was stuffed, but kept dipping bread into the soup.

Dad also ordered a side of meatballs, which I heard were pretty good, too. There's just a little bit of spice in it to add a little kick, according to the waitress.

The waitress was extremely friendly, and there was live entertainment. Unfortunately, we had no room for dessert. Definitely next time, especially since they're open until 5 AM!

Frank Sinatra ribeye! Leave the gun and take the canoli. What a romantic place.  Live music, food is whats expected with a name like House of Love. 
Cant wait to return on our next trip to Vegas. 
Thank you Tony.

This place was pretty cool and the food was delicious. I ordered the rib eye steak and was not as tender as I thought it would be. It was good. My husband ordered the chicken park and loved it. My favorite was the cannoli and the mozzarella sticks. Our waiter was really nice and attentive. I really liked the wall art, it was old school Las Vegas. I enjoyed it!!!

This place has been here since it can remember and I've been in Vegas 30+yrs.  The place gets a pretty good mixed crowd, parking lots a lil small and it can get loud but it's a great place to sit at the bar and grab sum drinks or sit at a table to eat.  I've had pretty much everything on the menu and have yet had anything less than par.  I love the pork chops w/side of gnocchi or keep it simple w/a couple of meatballs (with a side of gnocchi, lol)

The ambiance makes up for anything else you might not like. I am a foodie but picked this particular place based on other yelp reviews - how could I resist the chance to step back in time to old-school Vegas? Holding true to its reputation, Casa Di Amore had a two-person band cranking out tunes old and new, taking requests, and flirting with the audience. Our server was attentive and helpful and while I wouldn't give the pizza 5 stars, the Osso Bucco and Cioppino were quite authentic.

My absolute favorite restaurant to go to. The wait staff is SO amazing that it just makes the food taste better, as if that's even necessary. 

Whenever I have visitors this is the place I take them to. By far my favorite Vegas spot.

First time visit, very impressed.  great crowd, live music on Saturday night, more of a neighborhood place, nice alternative to Strip.  We both ordered specials as entrees.  And the cannolis were delicious.

Good Italian restaurant open late.  Came here for a first date and enjoyed my meal.  We split an order of brushetta.  My date had pasta with clams in a white wine sauce.  He said it's his favorite here.  I had the lasagna and was a little disappointed.  Very salty but otherwise flavorful and large enough to take half home for the next day.  Our server was attentive but not overbearing.  I'd definitely come back here but would try something different.

Excellent service, fast and friendly. Live entertainment is nice and gives an old school feel to it. Food is great, presentation is nice, over all, a very nice, and fantastic place to go to, especially if you're on a date!

A friend and I went on a Thursday night after 7pm, and it was packed. We didn't have reservations, but were seated quickly and our waitress promptly introduced herself and began serving us.  There was live music, and at first it seemed to add to the noise of the crowded restaurant, but after we settled in, the songs flowed naturally into the background. It added a nice touch to the atmosphere.
Everything on the menu looked delicious, so it was hard to choose any one thing. Even just the bread provided at the beginning was enough to take me to heaven and back. For appetizers, we ordered the arancia (sp?) - sort of bread-covered rice balls - which were DELICIOUS. Their Caesar salad was perfect, and my friend's gnocchi and my eggplant pasta dish were both mouthwatering. We absolutely loved everything we had, especially the large cannoli at the end. And we got a free t-shirt! We were both extremely happy with both the service and the food and will definitely come back. Special shout out to Todd, whose consideration and wonderful service helped us to have such a fantastic experience.

I am giving them 5-stars for the service and atmosphere. The atmosphere is cool. The pictures near the bar would change and show old Vegas photos. For a short while, they had live music. The service was great! We had an awesome, personable waiter. (I didn't ask his name, but the receipt said the server was "Brad G".)

I would have to give it 4-stars for the flavor of the appetizer and main course. For appetizer, we had the twice wrapped prawns. For our main course, I had the chicken piccata with angel hair pasta and my bf had the chicken Parmesan with angel hair pasta.  The food was good with a good portion size. 

5-stars for dessert! For dessert, we had the cannoli and the creme brulee. Those were the bomb! And what's cool is that if you order a cannoli or creme brulee, you get a free T-shirt :)

The next time we return to Vegas, we would definitely go back to this restaurant.

First time ever at Casa de Amore and we tried it during the biggest celebration of the year, New Year's Eve 2017! The place did not disappoint. From the moment they greet you on your arrival to the time that they seat you & take your order and serve, it's a smooth and seem less process. Our host, Tony took very well care of us and gave us recommendations that were superb. We were personally visited, at our table, by the manager, Smith who checked up on is and gave us complimentary desserts. I have previously sent two separate family members who each got married in Vegas to Casa de Amore and each of them gave high and great compliments to the place. Alexandra, the lady who took our reservations and who welcomed us as soon as we arrived was very sweet, professional, cordial, & it shows that she loves what she does. 
The food was magnificent and the entertainment, by Paul and Randy was so lively and fun. I think that every selection in the menu are all very delicious. 
I recommend this place to everyone. It's like going to one of our family parties that I grew up doing.
Delicious food ate here last night best Italian food I ever ate would definitely recommend to any one

Clearly a local's haunt, Casa di Amore did not disappoint. Our party of 7 enjoyed the calamari appetizer, which was a little thin bit still very tasty, fresh baked Italian bread, the Osso Buccu, Linguine with Clams, veal cannelloni, and both a chicken and veal marsala. Each plate was removed empty. Add to that a fantastic waiter who provided attentive but not intrusive service.  If you are looking for off-the-strip authentic Italian, you have found the "diamond next to the gun range". And be sure to head to the outside Tiki Bar (yes, that is not a typo) and be sure to get your photo sitting on the Gorilla's hand or in the arms of the Octopus.
In terms of Italian this place served the best I've ever eaten. The service and atmosphere was simply amazing. Will return for our anniversary!

I can't believe how many 5 star reviews are on here. Yelp has failed me for the first time in ever! I tried this place 3 times in about 3 months I started this review in Jan and thought I'll wait.....give it one more try 3rd time's a charm right, it's not, at least in this case. This was from my experience back in February.
 I had faith Yelpers! We had a reservation at 8:15 we arrived at 8:17 I know a couple minutes late, but the parking was not convenient, and it took us a minute to walk over there. We gave the girl our name, and waited. and she told us we could wait at the bar, unfortunately my mom cannot be at a bar for personal reason, so we declined, but there was no where to sit or wait. after about 10 minutes I asked when we would be seated and the girl told me 'when we have a table' and told me I could wait at the bar, for a third time now; and at some point the manager walked over and told us we could wait at the bar, and we were in the way; but we couldn't be at the bar and there was no where else for us to be. Well we finally got seated when we started discussing going somewhere else by this time it's 8:45. So Much for reservations. Then there was the awful service, we sat for another 10 minutes before the server came over to get our drink order, and rushed through the specials. and treated us like we were bothering him when we wanted to order an appetizer. Once we did that we didn't see the server for another 15 minutes. And only after I went to the front to ask if he could be sent over because we wanted to order. Finally we did,  the manger delivered it, and asked how everything was. So I told him it was a bit disappointing because of what had happened. He said he would take care of our appetizers for this inconvenience. I asked for fresh grated Parmesan for my gnocci but they don't have that. I thought is was a pretty common thing to ask for in a nice Italian restaurant. Well the food was good, not great, definitely not worth the wait and lack of customer service. At the end of our meal the manager ended up not taking our appitizer off the bill. I thought he must have forgotten considering it was extremely busy. So I told the server he asked the manger and came and told us the manger didn't tell us that. I asked if I could speak to him after waiting another 15 minutes just to speak to the manager he came back and told me there was nothing wrong with their service and he wouldn't be taking anything off the bill. This is what made me decide NEVER again. I didn't ask for anything or expect anything, but don't tell me you're going to do something and then not do it. Especially the manager. Aren't the employees gauging how to treat customers based on their treatment of customers. I did call and complain the next day. But still nothing. No invitation back no offering to give us anything. Nothing but we'll look into this....great.

If you love old Vegas vibe...you will LOVE this place. Live entertainment...spend your evening being serenaded by old blue eyes Frankie, Sammy Davis Jr. And Dean Martin. 

I found this gem through a restaurant.com website. Went on a Monday night. The special was lobster ravioli and shrimp with pesto over linguini. We ordered one of each. Awesomesauce!!!! And Monday is 50% wine so we had the Sangiovese from Tuscany. Wow!

For dessert...ordered the Creme brûlée. Got a free restaurant T-shirt with "Leave the gun...take the cannoli" on the back. 

Food-SCORE! Wine-SCORE!! Entertainment-SCORE!!! Old Vegas atmosphere-SCORE!!!!
Easy parking, seated us on time, fantastic waiter, fantastic food, great old world live jazz band.  I will definitely be coming back!!!

This is an interesting place. Some of the better Italian food I have had in town and the wine wasn't bad, either. Real meat or cheese ravioli instead of the pretentious spinach or Swiss chard type you get at the high-end Strip Italian restaurants. Atmosphere is very old school with posters of Vegas as it used to be. The dining room feels a bit cramped and service can be slow. The bar at the back diminishes the place a little, because its appearance and the crowd it attracts remind one of a sleazy dive from the 70's. 

Singer/keyboard player Doug and 83-year-old violinist Bill entertained on Sunday night and were excellent - both very talented guys and not too loud.

The biggest drawback for tourists is that it is located a good long way from the Strip. It's right next door to The Gun Store, making it a good place to complete your Vegas Mafia Experience after trying out that machine gun you've been itching to get your hands on. ;)

This place reminds me of the typical Italian eateries from the East Coast. For atmosphere, I give it a 5/5. There was live music, singing, celebrating, and interaction with the guests. For service 5/5, the server was attentive. For food 3.5/5, my frutti di mare had shrimp that were gray, so it was not even edible. I also find that salmon is not the best choice for that pasta because its flavor is much stronger than the refined flavors of the other elements. 

If you want fun, go. If you are looking for great food, it's a toss up.

It's as if Frank Sinatra and the Rat Pack still hang out here. It's "Old Vegas" and it really does embody American Italian cuisine. Honestly I love that the kitchen opens late until 4AM and the bar until 5AM but I find the prices to be a bit over the top. Don't get me wrong the food isn't bad but for a salad it's $12 and a 1 pound pasta dish is $22. Not to mention my girlfriends and I split the 1 pound pasta dish thinking it would be plenty but it was teeny. We are hungry young ladies who EAT! We ordered the cannoli and tiramisu for dessert. Final verdict; it's average and the prices are high. For late night I encourage happy hour in which they have but only for pizzas.

I went there for an early dinner recently and overall it was a fun experience, albeit an expensive one.  The prices are higher than the quality and that's really the bottom line here.  The service was excellent.  Every member of the staff we encountered was professional, knowledgable, and personable.  The food, while overpriced, was still very good.  I ordered the half serving of the stuffed pork chops and it was very tasty.  The cannoli for desert was very good as well.  Others at our table ordered a wide variety of items, to which the consensus was the food was great.  
So, really you are paying for the ambiance and the service.  The interior of the restaurant is dark and has an old school feel to it, which to me is awesome.  The only sticking point is the prices on the menu, where I feel you can absolutely get food at least as good at other places for a better value.  I will go to Casa Di Amore now once in a while to change things up, but not as my mainstay italian restaurant on town.

I do not often write reviews, but this place needs to be documented...
I am an executive chef and I have worked for some of the most prestigious places including Buckingham Palace. 
On this visit I joined some friends and I was so glad that I got the invite. Smith the Manager greeted me as always what a guy he remembers all his guests. We got to the table where some appetizers had already been ordered and arrived a few minutes after we did. Brad who was our servers is outstanding...He remembered my drink and asked if I would like to enjoy my usual Gin and Tonic...For someone to remember such detail is awesome! George was singing as usual, NOW if you haven't been here before George is an amazing "Entertainer", If you close your eyes sip you Martini its just like listening to "A young Frank Sinatra". 
We put our orders in and I ordered the Daily Special with Modifications I wanted to try the Risotto. I am so glad that I did...This dish blew my mind, I would rate this is as one of my all time best Risotto dishes. I have had quite a few especially as I did part of my Chef Training in Genova, this rates right up there with some of the best. My friend ordered the Cioppino and this was so rich and flavor full, the sauce was divine...

I have to say as a restauranteur I am amazed that the labor turnover is so low, this shows one thing that the team members want to be here to work, most have been there over a decade...

When visiting Las Vegas this is a must visit place I know it not on the strip but a 15 minute jaunt off the strip is totally worth it...They can even send a limo...we got one back to the Hotel...
This is a secret that the locals all visit....YOU NEED TO VISIT THIS PLACE...DONT LEAVE VEGAS WITHOUT DINNING HERE

After looking on Yelp and Trip Advisor, I was excited to take my parents who were in town visiting to Casa di Amore. I've heard good things about this place and was sure to make reservations as it was a Saturday night. As we walked in, the host informed us they were running 10 minutes behind. It was a nice night so we decided to wait outside. After waiting 30 minutes, we went inside to check and were told there was one party in front of us. After waiting another 15 minutes, we went in to check again and the hostess told us that she had accidentally cancelled our reservation. No apologies were made for the miscommunication at which point we promptly left. I was extremely disappointed by this first impression and living in a town with so many great restaurants, I doubt I will give them a second look.

Food was good.  I wouldn't say it is fine cuisine, but it was good.  Basically just good down home cooking. The reason this place is so cool is what I would call the ambience and the old Vegas feel to it.  I would definitely come back for the experience and bring some out of town guests to see an old Vegas feel and what seems more like a locals place.

Best Italian good in Vegas, great atmosphere - go when the live music is playing. Great wait staff. Eggplant parm, Veal, pasta, rampini, all their food is delicious and a glass of Chianti washes it down perfectly.  Finish your night with an expresso and a cannoli. Yum!

This is a true gem. The menu is as delicious as it is diverse. George has crooned to diners for years, and his vocal talents are remarkable. In a town filled with lounge singers, his entertainment chops are special. Plus, CDA has lots of Old-Timey, nostalgia  And, it is perfect for a date, a family meal and a dinner party. 

Just finished off the Pork Chops & Vinegar dinner. A classic! Great service from Brad and Nicole. 

Spend your money and your time in this spot!

This place must be paying some of their reviewers for the 5 star ratings. There's absolutely nothing great about this place. We went there last eve. Couple of hours after we ate there, my son got sick. It's been 24 hours and we're sitting at the emergency room with him. The food was horrible. The only reason we stayed and ate is because I worked all day without having the time to take lunch, I was hungry and exhausted to just get up and leave. The worst possible experience. I will never go to this place again. And I will be calling a health department to complain.
This place is the best. Spaghetti and meatballs were bomb. Garlic  yep try everything you won't be disappointed.  Must eat here for sure

My husband and I dined for the first time at Casa Di Amore last night, after multiple recommendations from friends and family. It totally lived up to expectations! The food was delicious, and the atmosphere was great. We loved the old school Vegas vibe. The live music was entertaining, and it was nice to have dinner be a social experience. I can't wait to go back! We started with the prawns. They were delicious. I had the Eggplant Di Amore and my husband had chicken Marsala. Both were great. I can't wait to go back!

I looooooooove Casa Di Amore!!!! We always stop in and have dinner if we're in Vegas! Antipasto for two is always amazing and it's a lot of food! I always get the Parm so I'm not sure about anything else. What I do know is that it's good and it gets busy call and make a reservation.
Great place...a little warm inside (but it was a dry heat).  Food was delicious, wine superb, the staff was top notch, and entertainment very Vegas-y. Will be back next time I am in town.

Amazing place! My brother and i took our mom here for her birthday... Its an unexpected place ... A hole in a wall kind of restaurant... 

We went in and they asked us to wait at the bar and they will call us when our table is ready... Only thing i would say is me and my brother got some drinks and the bartender creeped me out a little because he kept starring at what i was gonna write on the receipt when i closed out my tab...

Any ways... We got our table and our waiter was really nice... He told us about the specials they had... I got the similar to baked ziti and my brother got the chicken Alfredo.. My moms choice was pretty bomb.. She got the steak rib eye with peppercorns and glaze on it... It was delicious!!! There was a live band playing music which fit perfect with the atmosphere... Definitely recommend this place... Coming back soon!

WOW!! If I could give them 10 stars I would! This place is FANTASTIC from atmosphere to the service to the food.  From the moment we walked it it's like stepping back to" Vegas the way it used to be" our waiter Brad awesome personality AMAZING waiter. Superb service through out the entire resturant from hostess to the bus boy. The live entertainment was great. I could go on and on!!! Quite possibly the best dining experience I have had to date. Haven't left and and I already can't wait to come back to Vegas just to return to Casa Do Amore! Fantastic authentic Italian food. And Holy Canoli

What a surprising place!  Too bad the place was dimly lit or I would have taken and posted pictures.  So crowded that we had to eat at the bar, but they had special wooden placement to make eating at the bar very easy.  Sitting at the bar, we were near the live trio entertainment. Something of a "old style Vegas act" performing 50's Rat pack type music. Up front and close they were quite the impressive guys.  Anyway lets talk about the food.  First, the bartender/waitress was extremely friendly and helpful. We followed her suggestions for the specials. A buratta and pancetta  bruschetta on toast with roasted red peppers was just excellent.  Next we shared a caesar salad which was a little disappointing - just kind of flat in the way of flavor. The entree was really special - very fresh ingredients - a garlic shrimp over fettuccine. The sauce was not ready or too rich and had some sausage, fresh tomatoes. The only thing that would have made it better was larger fresh shrimp. Had a great night here. People watching is always a great entertainment!

This is a great restaurant in a random location. Hint: You can request free limo service from anywhere on the Strip. It's quite small, so definitely make a reservation.

The ambiance and decor are the true draw of this spot. It's very old school Vegas. There are old school pictures of Vegas and various celebrities all around the restaurant and bar.

At the rear of the restaurant is the bar. There's video poker, of course. Hint: If waiting at the bar for a table to be ready, they cannot transfer your drink bill to your table, so you must pay the bartender before being seated at your table. There are several cocktails and a few wines by the glass. The wine menu was a little underwhelming.

Despite trying to be more upscale and fancy-ish, this is a rather casual spot. There were kids running around and lots of folks in jeans and sweatshirts.

The live music is a great touch and adds to the ambiance and decor. However, it also escalates the noise level. Between the band and the patrons, we couldn't even hear each other - and we were at a tiny two person table. Hint: Request a booth on the far side from the band. There's some seriously awful acoustics in this place. The noise level and the inability to carry on a conversation with your date really kills the romance.

For food, we opted for a side caesar salad, the bone-in ribeye steak flambe and the gypsy pasta. The food portions are pretty generous. The salad was nothing of note. Hint: While there's free bread, they don't give you olive oil and balsamic vinegar, just butter. The steak was tasty, but not mouthwatering or crave-worthy. The gypsy pasta was crazy spicy - and I love spicy. It was almost too much it was so spicy. And the pastas are 1 lb, so it was a significantly large portion.

The service was nice and friendly. Our waters were never empty, we were checked on, etc., etc.

All in all, I like the concept, which is what gives it the 4 stars. And I'd be willing to come back, perhaps on a less busy night, and try some other menu items. But I didn't love what we ordered and the noise level seriously dampened our experience. While a good spot if you're looking for a vintage Vegas vibe, If you're looking for a nice, romantic restaurant, this is not that spot. But totally good for experiencing that old school Vegas feel.

This is a great little place with a lot of atmosphere.  My wife brought me here for my Birthday on Monday night.  I must say that the other reviews are very accurate as to what you should expect.  It is a nice little place with live music. The food and service was very good!!  As a bonus the bottles of wine are 1/2 price on Sunday and Monday nights.  You need to ask because that is not advertised.  We had  an appetizer, two meals, and a bottle of wine for $80.00.  I would highly recommend this for a special occasion.

After driving by this place a million times while previously visiting Vegas, I sincerely resigned to never eating there because it looks really cheap and cheesy.  After searching for the highest ratest restaraunts in Las Vegas however, I found that this place had wonderful reviews AND free limo service! 

So, during our las LV stay, we called the phone number listed on the website, made a reservation for dinner and limo pick up.  Easy!  The very friendly limo driver gave us a courtesy call to let us know he has ten minutes out. He greeted us with a handshake, a smile and great conversation. 

We were promptly seated and offered drinks when we arrived to the restaraunt.  And, yes, it is as cheesy-looking as I thought it would be.  However, the entertainer was great, singing and playing the piano all night.  You can tell it's a locals' spot with all of the great banter going on around us.

My partner ordered a steak, and I ordered a chicken dish...it was all delicious.  The service could not have been better.

If you are looking to get off the overpriced strip and try something new, do it here.

The food was great, and they had a very large menu. Our waiter was fantastic! He made the experience that much more enjoyable. The scallops au grautin are to die for, and both our portions were exactly the right amount of food, and we came starving. Their Cesar salad is only an extra $3.00, and pretty large. There was definitely an old vegas feel, and a singer and piano player were there crooning all of us with mostly oldies, but it was so soft it in no way impeded on our conversation. Highly recommend, especially for couples! They also have a bar in the back with sports. Monday night is half off wine night, too.

This was a great restaurant and if you want to get off the strip and get a taste of classic old Las Vegas, I would highly recommend this restaurant.  Make sure that you ask for the complimentary limo service when you call to make your reservations.  The limo picked us up from our hotel and took us to a non-descript brick building.  The moment the big heavy door opened for us to walk into the restaurant, you could smell the delicious Italian food and hear the sounds of a two-man band singing classic Italian love songs.  We were in love from the get-go!  There were old photos of the original hotels on the strip and infamous Vegas icons on the walls.  The food was good, not necessarily outstanding, but good.  It was worth the price.  They also had their wines at 50% off for the bottle, which made it totally worth it.  Afterwards, our limo driver actually took us downtown to Fremont Street so that we could enjoy that experience and then we cabbed it back to our hotel on the strip.  It was a good time.

My friend recommended this restaurant (we are both from CA). My friend told me to request waiter Brad or Tony(male). I called and spoke to Lisa on a Wednesday for reservations for Friday night. She said Brad works later that day but Tony will be there. Lisa asked Tony male or female. I said Male. We get to the restaurant and I tell the hostess I'm here for my reservations.She said Tony female will be your waitress. I told hostess that I requested male Tony. Hostess says he comes later:( we get seated and Tony female arrives. She says something about the computer system so she took a while to come out. Another table had their waiter come to them and very social! Toni female is not friendly and seems like she doesn't want to be there. Doesn't check on on us. Did NOT tell us the specials for the day! The other table with the guy waiter was so personable ! Wish we had him!Poor customer service with female Toni!The lady bussing the tables was nice.The food was good but with female Toni the service was horrible!!!! Later she puts the dessert menu down and says we can take a peak! Really?! I don't know if we would go again! If we do for sure we will NOT want female Toni !!!!!!!!

Consistently the best Italian food in Las Vegas. The atmosphere is fun and very old school Las Vegas. This is the first place we bring family when they come into town because it is convenient to the airport and the strip. Order anything off the menu because quite frankly it's all great. Hours maybe a bit of a challenge as they don't open until 5, but honestly with the wait for great food that is much less expensive that the hotels and great service as well. This will continue to be our go to place for great Italian!

Hands down best Alfredo I've ever had in my life, no joke! Ambience was great too, tables are kind if close but has very homey feel and live band was good, tool any request. Is my go-to spot for romantic dinner next time I'm in Vegas!

Italiana!!! I found this place... Where... of course on Yelp! 

I was craving Italian food and I though we'd go check this place out and it was a hit. 

As for parking, we didn't have any problems finding one. They have parking on the side and also in the back of the restaurant. When you walk into the restaurant, it has a really nice feel to the place. The lighting is not to bright, people are having a good, there's live jazz music and it all just makes you wanna eat good food lol... 

There menu is just like any other Italian restaurant and you can look them up online. There price ranges anywhere from $13 to $45 depending on what you get. I went with the Cioppino ($38) which is a house favorite. If you like seafood, I recommend it! 

It's a dish packed with lobster, clams, mussels, scallops, crab and shrimp. I added some pasta to it as well. The portion is pretty nice. 

The staff there is really welcoming and overall I thought it couldn't have gone any better. Well unless if it was free but who are we kidding lol. If you're in the area, go check out Casa Di Amore.

This place is not good! Service was slow. Food took 30+ minutes to come out and was a just a bit above average, but not great. Food was overpriced as well. Oh!  How can I forget about the entertainment?!! That was so loud and "cheesy"! I'm not trying to be mean, but it was way too much for a Wed night.

What a pleasant dinner, went to Casa Di Amore to celebrate 9 mos with my gf. The server was very knowledgeable and made great recommendation. This place exceeded far beyond my expectations. Their house made sangria was refreshing, the Sinatra steak was very succulent. And the calamari was breaded perfectly. They had live music, a gentleman was playing the piano and was singing some great classics. Would definitely recommend.
great food. very old vegas. a fun place to visit. always busy, so plan to wait even with a reservation.

Seriously some of the best Spaghetti & meatballs I have ever had! Casa Di Amore is about 10 minutes away from the strip so it's not something you are going to just come across on the strip but do make an effort to come here when you are in Las Vegas. One of the main reasons this was a planned visit, was due to the great reviews. I will tell you that I was not disappointed at all. The spaghetti was absolutely fantastic, it was perfectly cooked with gigantic meatballs. The spaghetti was very fresh & hot. 

I do wish they would have had a smaller portion as 1 pound was too much for just myself but I tried my best to still finish it because it was that good. It was a smaller place with a great feel to it and the spaghetti was better than I would have imagined it to be. 

The staff was very friendly including our server and food arrived in a timely fashion. As a nice bonus, the server set us up with a shuttle from the restaurant back to the strip at no charge! I thought this was a nice gesture as again it's about 10 minutes outside of the strip where I wanted to get back to anyway. The shuttle was newer, clean & air conditioned. The driver was courteous and our party did tip him which you should do the same as after all it is a free ride. 

If you like Italian food, don't forgot to make reservations when you are booking your trip to Vegas! I will certainly be returning on future trips to Las Vegas.

Tony the limo driver came and picked me up with my two clients at Mandalay Bay right on time in the red limo. Tony was a really nice guy and gave us some information about the restaurant since it was our first time dining here. 
When we get there we were greeted almost immediately by our waiter, another Tony. He was friendly and offered recommendations for both wine and entrees. This place is OLD school Vegas. Dark, red booths, a guy with a keyboard singing some Sinatra, Dean Martin and the like. I got the peppercorn steak as this was a recommendation by Tony. My clients got the Osso Bucco and a pasta dish. We were STUFFED as the portions were HUGE! Not only huge, a lot of love is put into these dishes. Great food, great service, great ambiance! I went outside to make a phone call and talked to some people outside who were locals who dined here regularly. Locals and out of towners alike are treated like royalty. There is nothing better than a great meal with great service and GREAT people taking care of you. I highly recommend this place and will definitely be back on future Vegas trips.
Molto bene!!!
