We were picked up at our hotel by "Johnny Limo" in a cute purple limousine, arrived at the restaurant and upon walking in I felt as though we had stepped into a scene from the Sopranos.  We joined our friends, some of whom are Vegas locals, and I'm so glad they let us in on their secret spot.  The food was amazing!  Our table shared about 5 appetizers and everything tasted fresh and authentic.  I especially loved the roasted red peppers and fontina cheese.  I ordered the scallops as my meal and they were big and tasty, covered in melted provolone.  Thanks for the ride Johnny, can't wait to come back to Vegas.

I've never left a restaurant before...in fact I don't think i've ever felt the need to leave a review before. But as I write this we are sick in our hotel room with wicked food poisoning. We ordered the calamari, stuffed clams and penne in vodka sauce. We didn't wait for the penne. We sent back the food and left. The calamari was so greasy and it came out brown instead of the usual golden color you would expect. The cuts were too thick as if the squid that they used were larger squids for stuffing. The stuffed clams were little cherrystones that tasted more like uncooked breadcrumbs than actual stuffed clams. The ones i've bought frozen at Vons are at least edible. These were gross. The food poisoning most likely came from the calamari since my wife didn't touch clams. In the process of writing this she's been back to the bathroom 3x to hug the bowl. Great way to spend a weekend.
Delicious food, good service, great live music! They took a photo before we ask! :) I would love to go when I visit Vegas again!

This place has amazing pizza and pasta! The bar is well stocked and the portions are great for sharing. If you hit up their evening happy hour on the tiki patio everything on the patio menu is half off!

This restaurant has it all, the decor, entertainment, service and the best Italian food!  We bring friends here from out of town instead of the strip. 

Lynn is the best server!  

Make sure you make reservations, instead of waiting because this place is PACKED!
Old school, great Italian restaurant in Vegas! Food is wonderful and the service is outstanding. The atmosphere is nostalgic! Don't visit Vegas without checking it out!

Several of my friends have recommended this place over the past couple of years and I finally got around to checking it out this past Saturday night when I had some friends in town. 

The first thing you'll notice when you walk in is the ambience. It's a very cute little place and they take pride in the fact that they are reminiscent of the way Vegas used to be. 

They had a small two piece band that was pretty good, not great but definitely cool to have live music. 

I went with the chicken marsala that comes with pasta and added meatballs. The food was good but I also would not call it great. 

Our server on the other hand, was quite possibly the best I'd ever had. It was immediately apparent that he was passionate about his job.

After our meal, the manager came over and verified that we had an enjoyable experience and I also appreciated that. 

My actual review would be 3.5 stars but since that's not an option I'll round up to four because of the amazing service. 

Give it a shot.

Great Entertainment, great bartender, strong drinks but the food is average and they should be ashamed of their prices. 

We've been here dozens of times over the years and they are so nice that we've never wrote a bad word but enough is enough. 

We went on Friday night and had the pretty damn good garlic loaf and a thin, kinda soggy pizza. Our friend picked up the check for driving him home so I don't know what it all coat. We returned the favor and took him back to Casa Di Amore on Sunday. 

We had:

Two Jack and cokes, one small pepperoni pizza, and a slice of lasagna. IT WAS SIXTY DOLLARS! 

The lasagna was $24 with a small caesar salad! How do they sleep at night? The pizza was just okay but the lasagna wasn't good, It was small and had little to no meat... $21 ala cart, add $3 for a tiny caesar salad. What could be in there to constitute that price? This was JUST a slice! Maybe 5"x5". That leaves 11 more servings in a pan right? What's that $250.00 for a pan of lasagna??? 

This is the main reason we never eat Italian out and if we do, we'll just split a pizza.

We will go back but only late night, order no food, have some over priced cocktails, watch the great entertainment. We do love the thick old Vegas vibe here.

To be fair a lot of Italian joints like Bootleger Bistro and Capos are priced about as ridiculous. We don't often eat there either. If we are going to spend $21, it aint going to be on $1 worth of pasta, cheese and tomato sauce.

This place was awesome! If you want an old Vegas experience go here!

Italian-American food that was very good, good portions and reasonably priced.  Our server Toni was so nice, friendly and made our experience there worthwhile.  The performer (George Bugatti) sounded just like Sinatra (if you closed your eyes, you would swear it was really him).  It was nice to go somewhere off the strip and have it give you the Vegas feeling.  They even have a limo (free w/ tip) to come and get you and bring you back if you want.  You get a free t-shirt if you order the creme brulee or cannoli for dessert - which we did. There were quite a few birthdays/anniversaries that were being celebrated.

I would highly recommend it and will make it a point to go back when I return.

One last thing - there was a lieutenant in the air force who was being deployed next week there with his family.  The restaurant must have been notified about it b/c they announced it and everyone clapped for him.  They comped his dinner which was extremely classy in my book!
Get the gypsy sauce the stuff is spicy but great and the pork chops and cherry peppers love this place old Vegas at its best

Fantastic food. Simple solid classic menu. Great service from a staff that wants you to enjoy yourself. Lots of locals eat here. Limo service to Strip hotels is a great touch.., love this place, we come here whenever we get to Vegas!

Old Vegas gem off the strip.  Fantastic service and live music.  Chicken Parmesan is a winner, enough for two people.  Monday wine specials can't be beat - make sure to make a reservation for this locals hangout, restaurant is small.

Came off the beaten path from a recommendation from a bar tender on the strip. Wife and were picked up from a limo dispatched to our hotel ! The driver Pamela was hilarious and full of spunk. We always enjoy going to the local spots and this was a home run. Food was amazing, a full of taste and the atmosphere was old school Italian. I had the veal parmiganan with meat sauce, delicious!! The local musicians Roy & Paul we friendly and even greeted us when we arrived. Will come back for sure !!

Great name and old style Italian restaurant. I have went there a couple of times and really enjoyed it, the atmosphere is nice. The service is very good and staff is friendly. There was live music which is a plus also. I would get a reservation depending on when you plan on going as the place is not very large and can get packed. Mange! Mange!

The food here is fantastic, and the atmosphere is noisy and busy like the Italian restaurants I remember from Boston, though the pictures of old Vegas on the walls remind you where you are.  There was a singer/keyboard player there during dinner, but his music was not too loud or intrusive and he wasn't bad.

I had the rigatoni pesto, which has a flavorful pesto cream sauce, and I enjoyed the house dressing on my salad.  The bread was warm, and the butter appeared to be lightly herbed.

They unfortunately no longer seem to make their desserts in house, so no cannoli for me.  Probably a blessing in disguise, since (and this is unusual for me) I ate the entire large serving of pasta they gave me, and dessert might have pushed me way past too full.

Finally, a place to go in Vegas that's not totally overrun by tourists and has food and atmosphere that rival some of our better restaurants in Chicago. 

The decor and ambiance were outstanding. It has a somewhat over the top Rat Pack era Vegas thing going on, which was great. There was a live singer the Saturday night we went. I half expected the ghost of Dean Martin to breeze in the door any second. This restaurant is relatively far off the Strip down East Tropicana but they will purportedly send a limo to pick you up. I didn't see this limo but if it is anything like the decor in this place, you'll most certainly turn a few heads as it picks you up in front of the Bellagio. 

The food is traditional Italian. Lots of pasta dishes that you'll probably be very familiar with. Service was very good. Our waiter was attentive and the items we ordered came fast. They ran out of Cannelloni that we ordered and threw in a free desert because of it. Nice. Old school service.

The lasagna they did have was nicely done. Plenty of meat in meat sauce, and cheese in the product. Well seasoned and flavor. It was served at the right temperature - not scalding hot like many lasagna dishes you get. 

The eggplant was pan fried and then served with red sauce, cheeses and a side of pasta. It too was very good. Portions are not ridiculously large like they can be in some traditional Italian restaurants like this, which is good because if you're staying in a hotel, you obviously can't take anything home. 

If you're staying on the Strip, a trip to the Casa will be a nice way to get away from the tourist throngs for a few hours. A definite thumbs up!

It is one of the best Italian Resturaunts I have ever eaten at across the US.  Very friendly staff.  You make reservations and they will even pick you up at your hotel and take you back.  The price is very reasonable especially for the ambiance and for Las Vegas.  It makes you think of Vegas of Old.  Very charming and had a wonderful time.  I will go back any chance I get.

This place is totally Vegas. Food is wonderful. The atmosphere is old Vegas. The complimentary limo is a bonus. We frequent this joint every time we get a chance when visiting Vegas which is often. There's always a lounge singer which feels oh so Vegas.

We stopped by on a Sunday evening for dinner. I'll get straight to the point, the four and a half stars are well-deserved. If you aren't too worried about price and want some delicious Italian food, just go. 

It was a little busy and we didn't have a reservation, but luckily they had an open table for us. The ambiance feels very old school and cozy. It's a popular spot for visitors, but the service was still quite good.

We ordered Linguini Luciano and Gnocchi. Both dishes were very very good. Some of the best Italian food I've had in Vegas.

It does come at a price though. Expect to spend a little more than you would at Olive Garden.

I visited this place with my family. They came from across the country to have a great time in Vegas. I really loved the live music and the food. Our waiter which of course I forgot his name ( pony tail young guy) was amazing! He was super sweet/kind and very helpful. The reason why I put a low star is because a waiter was rude. I think his name is Nick (white male, bald spot, round belly) I asked him when the bread will be ready because we have been waiting quite a while, he said, " You'll get it when it's ready" The restaurant wasn't that crowded. His day was probably bad and just took it out on me. He didn't need to be like that.

I came to eat here with a party of 12, and they also had a moderately large wedding reception in the middle at the same time, but they could handle everyone just fine. Apart from the surreal positioning of being in a booth on the edge of some stranger's party with no real partition other than a walkway, we were impressed by the food and service here. The mostaciolli with marinara is what I ordered, and it was fantastic. Their marinara is very flavorful, which I prefer to the meat sauce, which is a little dry and spicy. They have a decent wine selection if that's your thing. Plus, you can go blast an automatic assault rifle next door afterwards and fulfill your Godfather fantasies. Only in Vegas.

When we arrived, it was around 1 am. You have to ring a doorbell to be allowed into the building, which could be either entertaining or annoying depending on your disposition. Once inside, there's a bar area and then a restaurant right past it. The walls are decorated with photos of old Vegas's hey day, with Frank Sinatra, the Flamingo, the Sands and other old locales pictured. It's pretty cool, and during their earlier hours they have live entertainment performing.

After midnight they have a special on their bar menu, 1/2 off on all the food. It's basic appetizers and sandwiches, like wings, chicken fingers, sandwiches and pizza. They also have 1/2 off wine on Sundays and Mondays, which we took advantage of while we were there. Their full restaurant menu is also available, so it's worth checking out.  

We started out with a half price bottle of wine that was suggested by our server. It was a good choice, with low-acidity and a robust, smooth fruity flavor that beautifully compliments a variety of meals. We enjoyed it, savouring a glass each throughout our meal and bringing the rest home. It's a really nice deal! Worth going on a slow day to take advantage of that fact. 

Matt, our server, was pleasant and performed a polite demonstration of table service with our wine. He handled the front of house aspect very well considering how busy he was, going back and forth from the restaurant area and the bar. 

Our meal started with a bread basket with butter and then the caprese salad. The bread had a crisp exterior with a softer interior and was good with the butter. Not baked on premises, I'm guessing- more likely from the Great Buns bakery down the street, because we were given a loaf later and it was completely identical to the first, a signature of mass manufacturing. I didn't eat too much of it, though, because I didn't want to fill up on starch. As far as the caprese, the tomatoes were mushy and largely flavorless; mealy and obviously refrigerated. I understand the necessity of doing so, but in a dish like caprese salad, comprised solely of the tomatoes, mozzarella, basil & olive oil, it's imperative that the ingredients be truely flavorful. It was mild & a bit mediocre. We ate it, but it wasn't really worth getting excited over.

We then had the Osso Bucco, or slow-roasted veal shank in a tomato based sauce, with a side of risotto. I immediately noticed that the risotto was REALLY dry and crumbly. Because of the sauciness of the osso bucco, it worked out well enough for me to eat a small portion of the meal, but I wasn't particularly impressed. On the menu they brag that the meat is so tender a knife isn't needed, but I used one. There are tendon pieces, or tougher ligaments that need it on the outer portion of the meat but the interior it IS indeed very tender. 

This is a restaurant with potential, though it failed to meet my expectations. My boyfriend and I shared our meal and we had enough leftover for our lunches today. 

I may come back to enjoy their half priced wine and chicken wings. It seemed the bar had a very boisterous clientele, so maybe that's the place to be at the time of night we were being served.

We took most of our meal to go. I asked about how dry the risotto was, so the server promised it would be rehydrated for me to take home. Upon reheating for lunch it was still crumbly and dry, though perhaps slightly better. Our server gave us a loaf of free bread to take home with our leftovers, which was a nice touch.

Service was excellent! Fave items were the garlic loaf for $6. The Osso Buco was not bad, but just not to my taste. It's a preference thing. Generous portions with the mussels. Can't wait to go back again.

Service was phenomenal. Food was good and we enjoyed the atmosphere. There was a live band which was good as well. This place was recommended to us and I see why. The score is based on the overall experience. I'd say food alone was 4. We were served warm bread w/olive oil & vinegar while we waited and it was tasty. My spouse and I split a salad, plate of pasta and a cannoli and we were full from the portion size (pretty big eaters too).

This was the first time I ate out on Easter, instead of cooking.  What a nice change!  My family enjoyed the live music.  The waiter was really pleasant and professional.  The food was excellent.  Chicken Marsala, calamari, osso bucco was so tender it fell right off the bone, and what flavor!!  Yum.  I think I can make eating out for Easter a thing now.  Tonight we ordered dinner to go.  Stromboli, I heard my husband order this over the phone.  "Ok I'll have that, and that, and that too".  Pepperoni, veggie, and sausage.  It was a hit, my sons gobbled them up.  What a great find; great food, great service, and entertainment.  I'll miss this place when I leave Vegas, but I'll be back again!!

Love love this place!!! The Italian food is so authentic and the service is great! They also have live music which I enjoy a lot. The calamari is to die for and up to know I have loved every dish I have had. Go there every single time I can and will continue to do so for as long as they keep the great food and service.

it doesn't get any better than casa di amore.  the food is top notch; service couldn't be better; and atmosphere is unparalleled.  this place is my family's go-to for christmas eve dinner and it NEVER disappoints.  

although i always plan to order something different each time i visit, CHICKEN PARMAGIANA is my staple, and i can't seem to get away from it.  thin chicken cutlet, slightly browned cheese and the perfect amount of sauce-- it doesn't get any better than this.  

visit this place.  there is absolutely no reason not to and EVERY reason to.

The atmosphere is very old school Las Vegas.  The live entertainment is fun. The food has always been great.  I have been going to Casa Di Amore for 14 years.  It is one of the best Italian restaurants in Vegas.

My family came here for the first time, everything was great about this place. Seriously can't complain..
 will definitely be back!! Our kids even enjoyed it :)

I never have a bad experience here and I think that is more because of the amazing service than the amazing food. 

My girlfriend and a friend of ours stopped in here on Saturday night after a long day of baby shower planning/shopping. We didn't even realize it was Saturday night at prime time (6:00 p.m.) until we walked inside and the place was PACKED. There was a wedding reception being held as well as regular dining reservations. We didn't have a reservation, but the manager came over and said, "You can have this booth but you guys have to be done by 7:30, and that should give you plenty of time. Does that work?"

OF COURSE IT WORKS. 

We got the garlic bread loaf (heavenly) and I got a Caesar Salad to start. Yum! I love their dressing!!!!! I ordered the special for the evening - Lobster ravioli (tossed in Vodka sauce) and it was perfect. It came with NINE HUGE ravioli stuffed to the brim with deliciously fresh lobster meat. The sauce tasted great too, and I know my vodka sauce - trust me! ;)

My gf got the chicken parm and she almost finished the whole thing. That's how you know something is good! I had a few bites and really liked that the chicken was moist but not too thick! Our friend got the fettuccine alfredo with chicken and she barely even looked up from her plate before she finished eating. So, I'm assuming it was perfect. 

Overall, I give the food a 4.5 (it's not THE BEST ITALIAN FOOD IN THE WORLD but it is VERY GOOD) but the service gets a 5++++ star rating. Brad, our server, was on his toes all night. He had recommendations, explained the menu, was friendly, never let any of our drinks get even close to empty, and had things taken care of before we even needed to ask. Thanks, Brad. 

I like that this place is away from the strip and I really love how dark it is inside. There's usually live music in the form of a 50's era style crooner and the decorations are flawless. Stone brick wall - PERFECTION. 

Check it out!!

I can't say enough about this small, off strip restaurant. It is hands down the best Italian food I have had, and Italian is my favorite food genera, so have had quite a bit. I ordered the penne alla forno and it was delicious! My husband had a seafood linguini and he ate it all even though he wasn't even very hungry. Dessert was excellent as well and we went on a Monday which meant half priced bottles of wine. The atmosphere was comfortable and romantic without being obvious or cliche. The service was impeccable, items were cleared from the table within seconds of being done, wine glasses were never less that half full- our server, Tony, was very attentive and made excellent recommendations. There is live music that really kicks up the ambiance and made the whole experience that much more memorable. My husband and I both agreed this was the highlight of our trip to Vegas!

Excellent as always!  Had the 1/2 off bottle of wine on Sundays, followed by the
baked clams and stuffed pork chops.  Also always get a side order of meatballs to split for an appetizer.  The service is terrific and the live music creates the perfect evening!

Very nice and cozy spot. Staff very friendly, food great, atmosphere relaxing. The only reason 5 stars was not given was the prices. The prices are strip prices. We paid about the same amount going to a couple higher end strip Italian restaurants.

Hey Now!
This place is really old school Vegas.. The Mafia looking owner greets you at the door, great nightly entertainment. Food is genuine Italian. Service is outstanding. They even have a stretch limo valet both ways for just a tip!
We make sure to stop in every trip. Members of R.com, and they have a coupon in this year's LVA MRB..

Pork chops and peppers
Gypsy pasta 
Antipasto salad 
Chipino all was great 
Service atmosphere it was great

Great place! Lobster ravioli to die for and spag and meatballs were super!  Wait staff were extremely friendly and attentive. Got a free T-shirt for ordering Creme brûlée which was . Highly recommend this place!

Old world Italian at it's finest. Screw the on-strip fancy pants joints, if you want a taste of what it's like dining in an old-school Mafia style Italian eatery, this is your joint. 

Exposed brick, colored Christmas lights, live music (or singer I should say), classic Vegas photos on the wall and a more than friendly staff to ensure your experience is fantastic. 

The food (in my humble opinion) was DELICIOUS, however I feel they are a bit heavy on the price tag (hence the star short of perfection). I mean, let's be real, for $19 I could make eggplant parm for an army, ha ha! 

Perfect date place, dim lighting, great ambiance (as you've read in most of my reviews, ambiance is extremely important to me..makes the food taste better), and a friendly staff. 

I celebrated a big birthday this year and courtesy of some pretty amazing people choosing this venue, I had the BEST time! 

Check out Casa Di Amore for a swanky night out on the town with your guy or gal..totally worth the experience.

After reading all of the reviews, I was expecting a great dinner in a romantic environment. I was wrong!!!  The restaurant was under construction and had no atmosphere at all. There was a duo that played old school Sinatra type music but they were on break more than they played. 

Food was ok at best. Had lasagna and a Ceasar salad. Just average. My date had pizza which was pretty good. Nice thin crust and cheese with just the right amount of burn. Only bright spot was the service. Our waiter was very attentive and checked in on us frequently but did not over do it.

I would be willing to try Casa again but only after the remodeling is complete.

We had a wonderful experience. The limo arrived on time (and it really was a limo). The driver, Oscar, was very courteous and helpful.  The restaurant was very much like an Italian restaurant you may have gone to during the Brat Pack era. Our server, Tony, was excellent. He helped us order our wine and food. The Bruschetta was to die for!  I had the Eggplant Di Amore which was heavenly.  Live music (not some DJ ) made the night that much more special.  Heartily recommend this place!

It was very, very loud.  In part due to a live Jazz duo (drums and keyboard). Dim lighting.  Rip in the plastic bench booth seat.   

Service was ok - fast enough, but inconsistent.   (We had to mention we never got our drinks).

The food was unremarkable and somewhat disappointing.  Not bad - but my baked ziti variation featured overcooked pasta.  Inexcusable in an Italian establishment that should know what al dente means.

There are so many choices in Vegas, and the best I can say about this place is: the parking was very convenient.
cute little restaurant with great food. people are friendly. service is good. food is great. I love this place.

After reading all the great reviews, I took my husband here for our first anniversary. We had an amazing time. The food was great!!! We had the chocolate truffle for dessert and it was one of the best things I've ever tasted!!!

The atmosphere was the best part. I would recommend this place for sure!!

My wife and I had decided to come here for dinner a couple of nights. We were looking for a place close to my work and UNLV. My wife mentioned there was an Italian restaurant near the coffee shop she frequents. I'm always up for Italian, so we decided to give it a try.

It had the feel of an old school New York Italian restaurant.

For our appetizer we ordered the twice wrapped prawns. It was okay but not nearly as good as I was hoping it would be. The flavors just weren't there.

For our entrees we ordered the pork chops with vinegar and peppers and the eggplant di amore. Both were quite good, and the portions were large. 

The restaurant is a little pricey, so while I may go back, I doubt I'll be a regular.

Live music till 10pm on week days.
Good service. Antipasto was very good, nice selection of meat/cheeses. Sautéed mushrooms appetizer is worth passing on. Had veal and chicken francaise and both were tender but sauce was very heavy vs brothy,lemony, buttery it should be.  Theirs was more like the consistency of a hollandaise sauce.
Good dessert.
Overall good, I just live across town and came after a Rebel game cuz it was close to T&M. Would I travel across town? No, would I stop by if I was within 10 minute drive-yes.

Tony was the best, Great service and food.  I will be coming back for sure to have tony wait on me again.  Love that they give you a free t-shirt with purchase of a cannoli.  For sure stop if your looking for late night Italian food and great service.
We loved this place!  The atmosphere, service, food, and free limo were perfect. I highly recommend the basil Bloody Mary.

This place has amazing costumer service everyone that works there is truly nice. Our waiter who I don't remember his name was really nice to us and was friendly from start to finish. As for the food I'm not a huge fan of Italian food but my girlfriend is so I had to take her here after reading the review. The food did not disappoint everything we got was delicious. Best part of it Was that my girlfriend loved the food and when she's happy I'm happy!! Since then we've been here a few times now and we plan on going back.

My friend wanted to have dinner in an old style Italian restaurant typical of the Rat pack with live music. Case Di Amore was everything she wanted. The waiter Tony was very good, experienced and friendly. His wine recommendation was perfect. The ambiance was what a Vegas Italian restaurant should be and the singer was very good with lots of variety and great showmanship. Last but not least the food was excellent. My Chilean sea bass was perfect and her bowl of pasta also very good. All this for a very reasonable price esp on the wine and cocktails. I really recommend Casa Di Amore!
Solid old style Italian food.  Service was great and the food was spot on.  It's no North End Boston, but for a good family style meal in Las Vegas, make this a place to check-out.
Super fun place. Great food, awesome live music and a totally old school Vegas vibe. Oh yeah, and they have kick ass little tiki bar on the patio! Awesomeness all around!

Ok so How do you describe this place? Well it's Old Vegas in all its glory. When you walk in you are transported back to 1950s 1960s Vegas. The decore is dark. Old pictures of the casinos, tables with candle lit wine bottles. Our Server was Brad.  A veteran server who is well versed in the Menu. Quick wit, And makes you feel welcome. Now for the food. We started with the calamari. It was cooked and seasoned perfectly. I had the linguini and clams in a white sauce. Clams were perfect and fresh. The linguini Wes well done and sauce.... let's just say nothing was left on my plate. We had the Astoria Prosecco with our meal and finished it all with that cannoli. Full belly and content. I almost didn't want to leave. All that was missing was Bugsy Segal to walk in.

We had read reviews about this restaurant and booked it for Christmas dinner and we're so happy we did. The entire experience was one I will never forget. First they offer free limo service from your hotel you just have to call ahead of time and reserve it, then when you walk into the place it is like stepping back in time The service was great and the food was tremendous. I got the Scallops Florentine, One of my sons got the twin fillet mignon, and my other son got steak flambé. We all got the Caesar salad to go with that and everybody loved their meals. To top it off they have live entertainment with just a variety of old music and it appears they take requests. We figured this restaurant had been around since the 60s but found out it's only been around for about 13 years you wouldn't know it and it was just like old Vegas.

Seamless limo pick up with really hospitable driver Dick whisked us away from our hotel right to the doorstep of Casa di Amour. Make sure you set this up with your reservation. Well paced out meal, great piano man and excellent food. I'm from New York and really this food was comparable to New York City quality Italian. Had the eggplant parm, Caesar salad and my wife had Lobster ravioli. Recommend the house of love to anybody.

Took us 12 years to get here but it was worth the wait!
Food was great; loved the Arancini risotto balls, the Veal Piccata & Chicken Parmigiana rocks!
Our server Michael was fantastic!
We'll be back...

Did come back, this time with my MIL and SIL, we had a real good time, the place was packed and jumping. The last time I was there it was for an early dinner and we were some of the only people in the place, this time as I said jumping. They had a singer at a keyboard and he brought the diners into his act, the atmosphere was more like being at a party, a total turnaround from my last visit.

Food was very good, everyone enjoyed their selections. The t-shirts were a nice bonus.

This was such a fun night here. It really is a locals place. The only bad part about the night was we had a reservation and it took them 45 minutes to seat us so maybe they overbook or don't plan well for how long people will linger.

It was half price night for wine so you could get a bottle of wine for the cost of 3 glasses of wine so we said why not! It was very much the east coast style Italian restaurant. Small, dark, intimate with a real lounge style singer covering all the classics. It was a two person band and they did a pretty decent job of everything they did.

Be prepared to be a part of the act. We were there mid week and during our 2-3 hours of being there they sang happy birthday 6 times and the whole restaurant joins in!! It was great!

Now how about the food? I was expecting to be unimpressed but it was pretty darn good. Don't be looking for Italy style Italian food but instead think heavy New York Italian and you will be bursting at the seems and very happy. For the older crowd I am sorry to say they do not have spumoni. My Mom was with me and she was really hopeful that a place like this would but everything we got was great. I had chicken parmesan and she had a pasta dish. 

If/when I go back to Las Vegas I will get off the strip one night and eat here again.
Some hiccups from the start with the food and drinks but they made it good.  Lower stars mainly because the music is a major attraction and the speakers are blown.

My friends and I went to Vegas for a girls' weekend.   We had one night where we were going to splurge on dinner, so we wanted the second night to be more low key and less expensive.  I did a search on Yelp and found Casa di Amore and decided to try it.  As someone who grew up in Vegas, I really don't expect much of places that are "off the Strip", but I will definitely be going back here!

First of all, the fact they have FREE limo service (although they do suggest you tip $5 per person per way) to and from the restaurant is awesome.  Granted, the limos look like they stepped out of 1992.... do they even make maroon limos anymore???  Our driver was really nice though, and impressed us at his ability to maneuver the traffic even though he was, shall we say, a mature old chap. :)  

The restaurant is this cute little brick building and seems a bit out of place on the street.  Inside, it is reminiscent of something you would find out of "The Godfather" (minus the guns and shooting).  

Ahhh,.... the food was SOOOO good.  We had to place a second order of the bruschetta - it was the best I've ever had.  We decided to order family style since there were five of us, and I'm glad we did because the portions were huge.  We got three dishes - the clam linguine, eggplant parmesan and I can't remember the third... but all were amazing.  Seriously - I highly recommend trying this place out.

It is a small joint so definitely make reservations before hand.  Also, allow plenty of time if you decide to use the limo.  We had tickets to see a show afterward and our limo driver ended up leaving to take someone else back to their hotel... we had to wait for twenty minutes for him to come back and barely made it to our show in time.  But our tummies were happy so we didn't complain too much. ;)

This place is definitely old Vegas in a good way, and worth a trip to try it out!

The best Italian food I've had in Vegas. The atmosphere is great, it is small inside, which can be a problem on busy weekend nights, but it creates a really good vibe, especially when the live music starts. I in general am NOT a fan of live music while I am eating. It is often too loud and the performers are typically of average quality at best. I was pleasantly surprised when the music started halfway through my dinner here. The volume level wasn't overbearing and I could still have a conversation with the people at my table without having to yell over the music. The quality of the performance was also pretty decent. The service here overall was great, our server was very attentive and friendly throughout our meal. The food was delicious. I had the chicken parmesan and it was probably the best chicken parmesan that I've ever eaten...anywhere. Will definitely be coming back here soon.

Want a great meal with live music and old school Vegas feel, then look no further. Loved it here. I wanted Italian and googled best Italian in Vegas and this was number four. When I looked at the other places they seemed so snooty and I didn't want to get all dressed up. So this seem to be the easy choice. What great service and the prices were unbelievable for Vegas. A must from now on when I visit. No 1 in Vegas as far as I'm concerned. Thank you for the great meal.

OUSO BOUCO!!!!

This place is AMAZING!!!
We go every time we are in Vegas.  I always have the limo come get us at our hotel and tip the driver.

The food and the entertainment are worth 10x the price

Came here for the 1st time tonight and I have to say I am very happy I did. I ordered the homemade cheese ravioli with marinara and it was the best ravioli I've ever had. The Caesar salad was delicious too. Only complaint I have is, it does get pretty loud and busy so it's probably not a place for an intimate dining experience. All of my party enjoyed their dish except for one person who ordered their special sea bass. She said it tasted frozen and didn't like it too much, especially for a $40 dish. However, I was pleased and will definitely come back in the future.

Cheesy as f*ck. That being said... the service and the food are AMAZING. Yes, it's on the pricy side... but man I had the best Chicken Marsala of my life. 

This is a pseudo-romantic restaurant off the strip with plenty of parking... and we went there with a group of 3 dudes. We were swooning alright... for the delicious food.

Thanks!

It felt like we stepped back in time when we walked in the front door.   The wait staff (Tony) was great and the manager thanked us for coming by.   The food was very good, they had live music and the atmosphere is fun.   We were a little skeptical based on the location but went based on great Yelp reviews and reviews on other sites and we were not dissapointed.

This is one of our favorite places in Vegas. It gives you the old Vegas feeling. It is dark with classic old vegas decor & live music from the past. The service is always prompt and friendly.  Too
Many dishes to write about but we have been happy every time and usually order something different each time. We do always order their cheesy garlic bread which delicious. The prices are reasonable and they are open late.
Food is good but overpriced and the service is not that great(tony)... bad service will ruin the atmosphere. Not be back for a very long time and that's how you lose business
Yum Deluxe! More bustling happy wait staff than any place I have ever been. Everything was delicious. Authentic throwback Italian place from the good ole days.

I was there last night for my birthday dinner.  Loved the food. I ordered the Eggplant Di Amore.  It was awesome as was the service.  I had a cannoli for dessert....omg, be sure to get one.  Be sure to make reservations to ensure prompt seating!!I will be back....

I am so confused by the positive reviews. I ordered takeout at 2am... Spaghetti meat sauce... A very difficult dish to mess up... Not exaggerating when opened the lid it literally smelled like DOG FOOD. Like a literal can of dog food. That smell. WTF????? The texture of the meat was grainy (how??? I don't understand; it was bizarre). I took a bite and called them back. There was very little sauce so I at first asked for more sauce, thinking maybe that would help. NO. There was something wrong with the meat. Mind you this is a $22.50 spaghetti meatsauce that smelled like dogfood. I don't even know how someone in their right mind could serve that to a customer... And charge $22.50... What????? The server and the manager dealt with the situation professionally and promptly so this review is not for them. They gave me a spaghetti meatball instead and gave me a canolli on the house. The canolli was great, but the dish they gave me was also sub par (waay too salt and i'm a salt addict)... not what you expect for $22.50 LOL!!! This review is for the cook: you need to re learn proper food handling/ safety because the 2 bites of your dogfood spagetti meatsauce MADE ME SICK. I will spare you the details. I cannot even wrap my mind around the ridiculous $22.50 price. How long was that sitting there???? Was that an old dish that was sitting there that you tried to get rid of? How old was the sauce and was it kept at the proper temp? There's no way. Would you serve that to your friends or family???? Would you pay $22.50 for that dish???? How would you feel if you were sick from eating it? Would you be pissed enough to write a one star Yelp review? Seriously, relearn proper food handling/ safety skills. If the health department came in there and saw you serving that, you would be shut down.

I like the atmosphere, service and the people that was there last night.  Server was excellent , but the menu is pricy and the food it's not even that good.  We had calamari, it's dry and needs some more seasonings.  We also had bruchetta, mine was better.  My my own opinion, I won't come back there anymore.  Thank you!

OMG it was under a little construction but they still made it very comfortable,  very good atmosphere,  single gut band but did good old music, the food was so good amazing Italian.  Get the twice wrapped prawns explodes in your mouth with flavor. And the bread all I can say get off the strip and try this place you will love. Only 3 miles away also from the mgm.

I've been here at least 5 times since we moved to Las Vegas.  The place is like the lounge from the 60s-70s but don't get fooled cause they have one of the best Italian food in town.  Since I've been in Italy a couple of times I have been so picky with meat sauce, pizza, and anything Italian .  But this place is good and the service is also good.  They are always busy so I would recommend making reservations.   By the way they also have lounge music - Sinatra or Dean Martin songs.

I had Casa Di Amore bookmarked for years and heard rave reviews from several friends.  It was one of those places that kept getting skipped over, usually for somewhere newer or fancier.  Boy was I was missing out.  This is totally my type of place.  You walk in the door and are instantly transported to Old Vegas.  I had a drink at the bar while waiting for my friend.  They were playing Motown, the bartender was friendly and my drink (lemon drop) was great.  I could have hung out there all night.  I seriously want to become a regular here.  Eventually my friend arrived and we were seated in a large booth.  We started with a couple drinks, Chocolate Martini for me, Italian Gatorade for her.  Both were delicious.  For our mains we ordered the Famous Garlic Loaf, Penne Pesto and Baked Mostaccioli.  Food was fantastic.  I've been craving it ever since.  Service was good and before we left live music started playing.  This might be my new favorite restaurant.
Stefan... Very cool dude. Working to be a stand up giant.  Oh, by the way, the food here is really good!

I really enjoyed Casa di Amore.  The ambiance alone is very old school Vegas...but be prepared for the facade.  We almost did not go in the restaurant given the facade.  I'm not sure if they have more parking in the rear but we both thought the front looked like a ghost town when we pulled in for our 7 PM reservation on a Saturday night.

Remember the abandoned restaurant the Fratelli's were hanging at in The Goonies?  Similar.

Anyway, glad we went in.  The food was superb, the atmosphere was perfect and the service was fantastic.  The entertainment...well, he sounded JUST like Frank Sinatra...but he looked like Ronnie from Jersey Shore.  Still great.

Pricing was pretty moderate.  I was full and happy when we left.

We had Christmas dinner at Casa di Amore and loved it! It was so nice to get off the strip and enjoy truly good food in a nice environment. My steak was absolutely phenomenal - perfectly prepared and served with a delicious peppery sauce. My fiance's linguine and clams was also very good. We had the tiramisu for dessert - delicious. Adding to the great food was the attentive service, unique atmosphere and very enjoyable live music. I would absolutely go back here on our next trip to Vegas and highly recommend it for anyone looking to get off the strip and enjoy a more local dining experience.

This is my favorite Italian joint for date night. Really good food, wine, and live entertainment. We are vegan but still love the options available. The pasta is delicious and they have a few appetizers we can eat. My husband and I like Italian wine and they actually have some for reasonable prices. Their live entertainment is amazing lounge singer, jazz, Vegas style I always enjoy it. They have machines at the bar if you want to play and enjoy a glass of wine. Always recommend this place to my friends and family.

This place was great - if you're looking for a semi fancy off strip restaurant with amazing pay and attentive service, give this a try. I made a reservation for 8 and they had us sat, wined and dined in no time, plus there was a cute jazz band as well as a fun tiki bar patio out back. Good times!

My husband and I were looking for an old-style Italian restaurant.  We didn't want to eat at a trendy or chain restaurant.  This is exactly what we were looking for!  It had that old charm to it-- leather seats, dimly lit, live music.  The food was amazing.  We had the calamari for an appetizer.  It was good-- we've had better.  The garlic loaf was cheesy and warm.  My husband had the eggplant and raved about it. I tried the lasagna and think it's the best I've ever had.  It was a little pricey, but still less than comparable food on the strip.  Definitely worth a try if you want to go off the strip!  But, if you're looking for a younger crowd, you won't find them here (at least when we were there).

A fabulous off the strip find.  The descriptions of mobster hangout, old school italian, etc. are all accurate.  We were here on a Sunday night and it was packed with locals.  The gentleman who does the entertainment/singing/piano is quite a character, he has a lovely voice and we enjoyed his music and spirit.  One of the highlights was him pulling his old friend, an actor/performer, on stage for an impromptu performance, very neat.  
Our waiter, Tony (of course), truly made our evening; the wine recommendation from Cakebread Cellars was bang on - and because it was Sunday (& Mondays too) all wine bottles were 50% off, wow!  
The lobster ravioli special was incredible as was the pomodoro fresco.  The bruschetta was good, but we wouldn't order that one again.  Desserts were excellent, made in house and imported from Italy.
The ambiance, entertainment, service, food and wine were fantastic; we thoroughly enjoyed this fun, cozy and romantic evening; for that, we thought the prices were reasonable.  It cost us $24 for a cab from the strip to here, but they do offer a complimentary limousine that we may take advantage of next time - oh yes, there will definitely be a next time.
A nice break from the high priced, fake, stuffy places on the strip.

If you're looking for GOOD Italian food and you don't mind driving 10 minutes from the strip, go check out Casa di Amore. The food was delicious (we got the gnocchi and the eggplant parmigiana). Both were excellent. And the garlic bread is not to be missed.

There's a live band playing in the background, adding to the already warm/family/old-school atmosphere.

And the service was top notch. Annie was super friendly and attentive. Another server, Todd, made us feel right at home as well. He even hooked us up with a fresh loaf of bread as he put our leftovers into carry out containers! The little things like that made us feel like we were truly welcomed.

Looks like a lot of locals come here which is always a good sign. Will definitely be back!

I took my newly proposed-to girlfriend (now fiancee) here for a nice dinner and it was thoroughly enjoyable!

I had made reservations the night before by calling in, although you could probably do them online as well via OpenTable or something like that. We arrived slightly early, but we were seated immediately. I can't remember our waiter's name, but he was fantastic. You could tell he was vastly experienced, as I believe he mentioned he had been working there for 10 years! He got a feel for how much time we had to dine that night (we had around three hours before our show) so he slowed everything down for us so we could enjoy each other's company and the wonderful live music, as well as the overall ambiance of the restaurant. 

We munched on the tasty bread and butter that were provided and decided to order some bruschetta to share. The bruschetta was delicious! It's strange how something so simple can taste that good. After a long while we decided to make our entree orders, which were the Gypsy Pasta and the Chicken Marsala. When I told our waiter I wanted the Gypsy Pasta he warned me about how spicy it was and that it was usually not very enjoyable for most people that ordered it. This brought to mind the question of why it was even on the menu, but before I could ask he told me it was because actual gypsies (there were two groups of them dining there at the time) would come in and order it and just love it. In the end, our waiter brought me some of the sauce to sample and, my goodness, it was hot. I promptly ordered some linguini and meatballs with a slightly less spicy sauce!

Our meals were delicious, and my pasta bowl was huge. We had to get boxes to go. It was a great experience. I feel like if I had told someone we had just gotten engaged we probably would have gotten a cannoli or something because there were lots of other people getting them for their birthdays and weddings!

Also, we had the cheesecake with strawberry sauce and it was very good.

To top off the impeccable service, when we first arrived I asked our waiter if it would be possible to use the complimentary limo service to get a ride to the Bellagio where we were going to see "O" after dinner. He said he couldn't make any promises, but that it would probably work out. Turns out he procured us a ride, so we got to show up to the Bellagio in a limo. The limo driver was fantastic. He was playing Star Wars music, so we had a nice chat about the new movie.

Went with another couple and WOW, was the food good!  Two of us ordered the Eggplant Di Amore (slices of fresh eggplant breaded and layered with ricotta cheese, mushrooms, spinach and sundried tomatoes, topped with parmigiano-reggiano and mozzarella cheese, then covered with tomato basil sauce and baked until golden brown).   This was so delicious, I wanted more.  Also was ordered at our table was the Veal Francaise and the Veal Francaise.  Both meals were also enjoyed.  I will be going back for round 2!

My husband and I went here for the first time the other night and we both thought it was amazing!

I had the Grilled Salmon Fiorentine and my husband had the classic Baked Lasagna.  He said it was the best lasagna he had ever had and my salmon was absolutely ridiculously good.  Went home with no leftovers!  Yummy, everyone should try this place.

We were each able to get a free drink from the bar with our foursquare check-in.  We also used a $25 restaurant.com gift certificate that we purchased for $2!!  Lovely date night with my husband at a romantic place on a budget.  You can't beat it!!

We loved this place!  From the amazing staff to the two band members, it was a wonderful experience   
The  spaghetti is a must as well as the cannoli for dessert!
You wil feel as if you stepped back in time to the "old" Las Vegas days....

So I am a huge Italian food fan and have even been to Italy for a long period of time.  I made reservations for this place at 5:30pm on a Tuesday to make sure we got a table.  Once we arrived, they sat us at a tiny table facing the stage.  I didn't care for whoever was performing because he kept talking to a guest he knew anyways.  And I really didn't appreciate the tiny table when there were other open ones.  

Anyway, our waiter took awhile to get to us.  Once he came to us, we started with the Calamari ($14).  It was really really good.  Probably the best thing in this place.  I like that it wasn't overcooked and wasn't overly flavored.  It's a must get here.  For dinner, I went with their Eggplant Di Amore and the person I came with ordered a side of Pesto Pasta and a side of their Gypsy Pasta to try both.  After we ordered the complementary bread and butter came.  It was a long warm baguette that had been cut up.  It was decent.  My Eggplant Di Amore ($26) can be described as an eggplant lasagna.  It was fresh breaded eggplant with ricotta, mushrooms, spinach, sun dried tomatoes, and topped with Parmigiano Reeggiano and Mozzarella Cheese.  The entire thing was baked just like a lasagna and served with a large portion of Spaghetti.  I thought the entire dish was alright.  I didn't see much ricotta at all.  I thought it was a little dry and was more on the salty side.  The spaghetti that I had one bite of I could have done without.  I got to try the pastas that the person I came with ordered.  The Pesto Pasta was pretty good.  The Gypsy, which is basically their popular spicy marinara pasta was also pretty good but nothing crazy.  The total was $60.  Nothing there wowed us besides their calmari.  

And the service definitely did not wow us.  The food took forever to come out and so did the bill and take home container.  The waiter didn't really made any good recommendations.  It was like he was just kinda there to do his work and quickly go home.  The inside of this place is small so probably why the long waits on the weekends.  There is the dining room and a bar area in the back.  The inside looked like a dive bar with booths to be honest.  There were a lot of locals there.  Mostly elderly people.  There was an annoying large group there to celebrate one of their son's birthdays.  One of the guys from the party knew the guy singing so they kept talking like I mentioned earlier.  The rest of his party also kept getting up.  They kept getting in the way when people were trying to use their bathroom.  No crowd control?  If this is Vegas top Italian spot, I feel bad.  Not sure I'll be back.

Great dinner place to hit for authentic late-late night Italian food. The service from Stephan was wonderful. He was attentative and well versed in the menu options. He gave great recommendations and was quick. The pizza was great and the pasta was super cheesy. The pasta was light on the lobster for the price as it had lobster flavor but not many pieces of lobster in the dish, but the flavor was Great! We frequent Vegas and since they're open till 5am we will definitely be back!!

Grab a Uber and leave the strip! This place is worth the drive. The staff was extremely attentive and friendly. The food delicious. Save your appetite because the portions are filling. This is our 5th night in Vegas and this by far our best meal experience. Next time we are town we won't wait until our last night to enjoy this place. Highly recommend!!!

Favorite Italian food in Vegas!! Feels like you've stepped into old Vegas, love the music, atmosphere, service, and THE FOOD... where do I even begin? Everything we ordered was fantastic!! We forgot to make a reservation so we landed a seat at the bar since it was an hour wait for party of 2, it was prime dinner time on a Saturday so not surprised it was packed after experiencing this phenomenal restaurant, we didn't mind sitting at the bar but will keep that in mind for next time.

If you are in the mood for Italian, this is your place! This place is a definite dining experience! Everything we ordered was delicious. The garlic cheese bread is a must! The service was excellent as well!

Absolutely the best.  I am sure all wait staff is wonderful, but I've had Stephen the last few times and he makes the experience rise to a whole different level.  Highly recommend this spectacular off the strip location!

I love Italian food, and this spot make me recall the time when i lived in Italia 5 years ago. It was memorable. The foods are okay, the price is reasonable for sure. The only thing they should be better is time serving, i had to wait a little bit long.

What's to like:
An old school "lounge" ambience.  You'll feel so Mafioso.  
Live music, played with the perfect volume to allow dinner conversation with having to speak in raised voices. 
50's pictures of vintage Vegas landmarks and images of the Rat Pack adorn the walls. 
The service is outstanding. 

The food is reasonably priced and better than average.  It's good... not fantastic.
Classic old school local feel Italian. Kept looking for Frank and Dean over my shoulder. Good portions but flavor out of this world.

The atmosphere of this place makes it great as soon as you walk in. The food was really good and the portions were adequate. I had a stuffed pork chop and it was AMAZING!!!  The Alfredo sauce is pretty amazing too. The prices are a little on the high side but worth it.

Walking into Casa Di Amore is like walking through a time portal - you are transported back to a time when Vegas was classy, opulent and fun. Big leather booths, lounge singers and black-tie service await you. The food was very good, big portions and decent prices. I really enjoyed dinner, and our server Stephen was excellent.

I can say confidently that this is a restaurant id happily give 120$ to again. I got an EXPERIENCE. Driver picks us up, wonderful lady. Unloads us, we get sat down in front of the band, the place was great! Old vegas pictures, Frank Sinatra and the Rat pack, the band was jazzy and the place felt like a New York Italian restaurant.


Waitress was full blown Sicilian and helped me make my decision and going rightfully so. The food was excellent, the service was excellent, my girlfriend and I had a very memorable experience
Excellent food great service old school Vegas all the way. Will be coming here religiously. Our server Bead made our night excellent.

Thank you yelp for helping me to find a great place for me and the girls to have dinner in Vegas.  We were in Vegas on a family trip this past weekend where we rented a house- 7 couples and 5 kids (all under 3!).  For girls night out we hooked up the 'puter and checked out yelp for something close.  Casa Di Amore was close, Italian, and had good reviews.  We were dropped off by one of the hubbies and were going to have the staff call us a cab- but low and behold- they have a limo!!! We asked if they could take us the the strip after dinner and they could!  It was really fun AND the food was so good.  We had a few bottles of wine and the bill was still under $40 a person.  Plus, they gave us each a rose AND there was a lounge singer.  We felt like we were in a movie (Swingers was mentioned more than once).  What more could a group of hot mamas ask for?  I recommend this place if you are looking for something away from the crowds where you and your group can have a nice meal for a reasonable price.

This place is awesome for a date night! ;)  

I stumbled across a review for Casa di Amore reviewed by another yelper Karlie G-and decided to try Casa. I had a wickedly wonderful female coming to visit me from LA that I adore visiting me last weekend, and wanted a place to take her that was romantic and cozy-and not on the strip. 

Checked  the website after reading the review-free complimentary limo ride if you have a reservation for dinner?!?! Yes PLEASE! Called the number on the website (you can't get the limo through normal website reservations) with the only requirement being you have have to be picked up from a hotel. Perrrfect!  I could drink with my date!

The person I talked to-Phil, Paul? I can't remember was super cool, had a pleasant demeanor, had me scheduled in no time flat to be picked up from palace station 15 mins before our reservation, thanked me for choosing casa and even put in a request in my request for a booth. 

Our limo driver Byron picked us up right on time He introduced himself, was pleasant, opened our doors for we were on our way!
 
Arrived around 7 at Casa Di Amore, and was wondering what to do with my wine glasses and my other bottle of wine we hadn't finished. Byron took anything I didn't want to carry and put it in his trunk and we proceeded right inside-carrying our wine glasses from earlier straight in with us. 

Greeted by a super cute, and courteous door girl, I didn't catch her name she was keeping the circus in check around her and doing a great job. She smiled as soon as we came in, and I think she even knew my name as soon as I walked in even though I had never been there before based on the time I walked in and my party size! Nice! What a pro! 

Walk in and the atmosphere blew me away!

The place is not huge by any means, but it just big enough to have an organzied chaos and frenzy of laughter, the smell of italian food, servers zipping about-the kind of place that makes you feel cozy and warm. 

Our seats were not ready yet, so they politely asked us to wait in the lounge area near the bar and Byron took led us to the back. We were still drinking our wine, not a thing said by anyone carrying in our own wine glass-double Nice!

A really good lounge singer was belting out some classics and originals and a keyboard player was right in sync with him-he was working hard for the money on the intimate little stage right in the middle of the place. It was just the right loudness to fill the room, without drowning out the conversations people were having. 

We sat for 10-15 minutes, I lost track due to the wine and a little buzzed, but the atmosphere was so enjoyable we didn't even notice. .

A few minutes later we were seated. Our server showed up right away with water's with lemons in them nice and chilly. We got a HUGE 6-8 person booth I requested for the just the two of us-even though the place was packed on a Saturday night-Kudos Casa!

Our server, who was a really nice blonde, asked us about appetizers, but we skipped that figuring we'd get bread and I had read the portions were large. 

I ordered the Lobster Ravioli without looking as the rest of the menu, my date ordered the triple cheese pasta and we ordered a bottle of Cabernet. Everything on the menu was priced reasonably as were the bottles of wine. 

I'm almost out tryping room, so I'll wrap it up.  I agree with Karlie G-The food was an excellent 4 stars-but the service was 5! -the ambiance a& atmosphere-outstanding. I'd tell you more about the night... but we finished the second bottle...and its a lil fuzzy-aint gonna lie. Never ending Bread basket, 2 Caeser Salads and 2 Entrees and a bottle of wine with tip about $100-not too shabby at all- Everything else melted away staring into the eyes of my companion...and it's the perfect place to do so- Ill be back for sure. ; ) Thanks Casa!

Service is always great! Staff is super friendly and quick! Food is amazing and you get what you pay for and more! Plus the live music! Very traditional Italian style! Totally feels like a scene out of Goodfellas! I love this place, can never go wrong here!

Two words: Osso Buco.  I didn't even order this dish, my husband did, and the little bites I had were heavenly.  This is your place for delicious, homestyle Italian comfort food. Portions are deceivingly large, I suggest trying to share something.  I was so sad to leave half my entree because I had no fridge or micro in my hotel room.  I should mention that this place is noisy, even when the musicians are not singing, so don't expect to have any quiet conversation here.

. Of course many Italian restaurants clown Casa Di Amore if you want to get hardcore or technical. It is not fine dining in any respect.  They are a little messy as far as menu's being dirty etc. very slow at seating even with reservation. the price point is about 5.00 too much for everything. However the good parts - For a neighborhood place you cant get better Italian than this.I have been 4 times now All the food minus the house salad is absolutely excellent. They do a killer Burrata cheese appetizer. The pork chop with peppers is exceptional! Amazing acid and great spice. cool ambiance old school style. The waiters are not top notch by any means but friendly and they try. So far there is not a better quasi - budget Italian place in town.

Whatb a great little Italian restaurant.  Had dinner there last night and there was a live band playing Xmas music.  The restaurant is a old time vegas  feel to it.  The food is excellent.  Most italian restaurants cook northern italian, this one has a Sicillian flair.  Since I am from NY and Italian, giving this restaurant 5 stars says a lot!

AMAZING food!!! We had a wonderful time here. Our server Tony and was the best, he recommend some of the most delicious dishes on the menu.. 

My ribeye steak fiorentine was so tender a juicy so was the steak flambé. We also shared a dish of homemade fettuccine alfredo.

The cannoli was the best ended to the dinner, you also get a t-shirt when you order it.

Call ahead for the free limo ride to and from your hotel.

The food was delicious, once we got it. Unfortunately we waited so long we had to get our food to go. The lack of organization and service soured our experience enough that we won't be returning. We waited 90 minutes for our food due to another party's food coming up around the same time. For a business that has been around this long I would've thought they'd have figured out how to handle that.  That was a poor excuse for letting us wait 30 minutes past when they were "plating" our food for us to actually get it, without giving us the courtesy of checking in to let us know some mistake had been made. The place was swarming with servers, if ours had been overloaded we'd be able to be a little more understanding. 

By the way the crispy salmon is a solid choice. The Alfredo with sausage was good as well. Our sons ravioli seemed like it used the gypsy sauce instead of a standard marinara and our little guy couldn't quite take it.

While looking for Italian on Yelp we had Casa de Amore on our short list. What a great experience - felt like we stepped back in time to what Vegas was like (before we were of legal age to experience). Stephen (our server) was excellent and engaged us in conversation from the get go which is so key to experiencing great customer service today. The food was incredible. Music was amazing and made us feel like dancing - terrific singer/musicians playing old Vegas tunes. We started with calamari with the marina sauce (yummy) and an Opollo Zin wine together with the bread/evoo-vinegar. The Pasta allo Fordo was amazing, penne arbiatta the best spicy ness, and the kids has homemade chicken soup (Gma's recipe to die for), spaghetti/meatballs and fettuccine which were all great. The cannoli - lets just say this rivals a a famous baker who's jersey roots has a shop here in LV. Direct your orders here vs there!! Thanks Stephen.

So refreshing to get away from the strip. And much cheaper!!! The live music, the ambiance and the food transports you back to when Vegas was such a cool place. Had a great meal and the service was awesome. 

I'll recommend this place to all of my friends & hope to be back soon!

Okay so me and my husband dine out a lot and when we dine out  we expect a nice experience.  I was very excited to try this place since it had such great reviews however my excitement went to pure disappointment when I walked in and they sat us at a small tiny ass table right in the middle of the walkway with people bumping into me  and every staff member walking right past us for 15 minutes not even asking us if we want anything to drink,  this table was obviously on the pay no mind list Now normally I'm a nice person I try not to get to diva but this table was actually really ridiculous,   ok enough about that so I went up to the manager and I said to him do you have a different tableabd within I want to say 10 minutes 15 minutes he had a different table for us which was great he was also taken care of also at the end of the night.   Other than the whole table issue everything else was pretty much okay the atmosphere was really nice the food was okay not the best I've ever had but it was good.  I think this place is more interested in catering to larger parties  then a small bill for two people which is understandable that they going to make more money on a larger party then they are two people I get it but still we are paying customers so we should be just as important.  Um I'm not sure I'll come back maybe I will but at least I can scratch this one off my bucket list.  Oh and by the way I never got my free t-shirt with my cannoli purchase so for that reason I'm taking another star off.

My meal was delicious! We got the antipasta appetizer with fried ravioli, calamari, and mozzarella. Amazing! Super friendly people and waiters as well! The live music is very enjoyable to listen to while eating.

Super spot!  Old time Italian/American food.  Generous portions and our waiter Tony was a blast.  Loved the live entertainment with music from Sinatra, Dion, and a variety of 50's and 60's groups!  Lots of locals so you know they're doing something right.

Poker machines at the bar and generous pours make this a great place to enjoy drinks and dinner before hitting the casinos; or make a night of it - their hours are 5 PM to 5 AM (not a typo).

Brought back memories from the Vagas of my youth.

To start my review, this will be the nice version I bet my mother will write one too and she is much harsher than me. So... good or bad news first? I'll do bad (maybe the good will make up for the negative). We made reservations 2 months in advanced at the time they had a limo service they offered to pick you up from your hotel to the resturant. (Hello bonus!) I loved this thought because it is quite difficult to get from one place to another one block in Vegas is very different from a normal city block. Anyway, we waited and limo never came (7:00) we called and they told us the limo broke down (a while ago) and that we will just have to catch a cab and they will pay for it (I was very understanding). Oh little side note we have been in Vegas a week now and this is the third place we've booked in Vegas that has called telling us their car or bus has broken down. So we got to the resturant around 7:20 they said they would sit us immediately (they didn't) we didn't get seated until 8:10 (reservations were at 7:10). Now this is we're I will stop and say that there was a huge factor in this they had a 46 (or some ridiculous number) of singing women (annoying as crap they were all drunk old women who claimed they sing in a group which I personally thought that was just a college sorority thing) party. Their reservation was 7:30 (we overheard). They got seated right away. Now I also learned the bus (they lost their limo a while back) had to pick some of these women up. Myself I have never worked in a resturant but I do have many many friends that do or have. I decided to text these friends while there (during my very long wait) and they all agreed that the party of 46 should've reserved the entire resturant (it was a pretty small place maybe 8 or 10 tables not taken over by these women) or the manger/boss/whoever should've personally reserved the resturant just for this party and not allowed any other parties in that night. Now the good news the food was great the service was amazing and I say this not because they had us wait so long and didn't pick us up but because I truly believe they have amazing service every other night. Personally if the party of 46 was not there that night it would've been a perfect night with great food and my review would be a tad shorter and five stars. The staff was very nice and wonderful people so I do not really blame anyone for what has happened tonight except for the group of 46. So in conclusion (cause I've basically wrote an essay hahaha) it was a terrific resturant very good atmosphere but for any groups of 46 please request the place to yourself for the night and for any mangers please allow them. Overall I would recommend to a friend and this review got good stars for the fact that tonight was not the restaurants fault (fully) but just bad timing and planning.
My second favorite Italian place in LV. Great good, good service, and "old Vegas" atmosphere. Try it, you will like it.

Place was really nice and food is great. The hostess is not very bright. Be careful because she will seat you and not assign you a waiter or waitress. Bird for brains! Hostess has very poor customer service skills for such a nice place!

The best kept secret in Vegas, if not the entire western region!!  Amazing service, live band playing ole favorites that everyone sings to, homemade grandmas marinara sauce, garlic bread, the best drinks, it is like being back in the 1940s!!!!  Oh & you HAVE TO get the garlic bread, I can't even describe this one, it's indescribable!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!! 
BEST RESTAURANT EVER!!!!!!!!!!!!!

I got the Penne Vodka with a side of meatballs. The Pasta was nothing special, and not worth the $26 price tag for sure. Meatballs were very good. My boyfriend got the Chicken Parm which was delicious. Good atmosphere and very nice staff.

Food was excellent as was the service and the environment. Live music,  nostalgic environment what more could you want oh yeah the food it was over the top I had the rigatoni broccoli which was really good only thing is it was such a large portion I had to leave 1/2 of it behind as my hotel didn't have a refrigerator. I highly recommend you try this place out I'm glad I did
Amazing food! The live entertainment was incredible. . Not a cheap place but worth it for date night!

What a great time.  Great staff, great music, and Fantastic Food and drink all the way thru from the calamari to the cannoli and creme brûlée.  Ribeye flambé was perfect with a great peppercorn sauce.  The gnocchi and spaget with meatballs were both exceptional.  Yelp did not disappoint on this place.   If I wasn't on a gluten free thing I'd have even been more impressed - did sample a corner of the house bread with oil/balsamic and that ended up the only part of the meal I regret.  In the past I would have ordered a side of the house-made marinara and gone to town.

I will definitely be coming here more often mainly late night because I'm tired of driving to the strip after a night of drinking just to get some good food. I never  realized they closed at 5am! The entrance is in the back and so is the parking. I always thought it looked dead but after driving behind, this place had a nice little  crowd going for midweek 2am! The full menu is also  offered throughout entire business hours.
To start off they bring you a nice warm loaf of bread with olive oil and balsamic. Yum!
The fettucine alla papasito had a delicious, rich, creamy sauce with little sausage meatballs. Very homey, cozy taste. Some people might say it has a little spicyness due to the sausage so if you order a -5 on the 1-10 spicy scale, this one isn't for you lol.
My boyfriend got the chicken parmigiana. He replaced the typical spaghetti w/ marinara for spaghetti w/ alfredo sauce just because that's what he was craving. I was actually really surprised. Their chicken parmigiana is on point! And it's not a thin, flattened out half a chicken breast either. It looked like a full chicken breast butterflied and lightly breaded. Really good! On the picture I took it looks smaller than it actually was. He was even a little surprised and said it was better than Magianno's (he works there).  
It's a little on the pricier side for what they offer, a little more than cheesecake factory but I don't mind. I just love that they're opened so late! Our server, who was also the bartender made sure to keep checking up on us even though the bar was full of people. Good customer service and really friendly also. He didn't make us feel uncomfortable for ordering food or anything that late at night. Will definitely be back!

Memories of evenings here with MoM and DaD early 90's.  Here for my birthday and had an amazing time listening to Sinatra n contemps.  Caesar like olde days.  V parm was large and tender w crispy crust.  Complimentary birthday cannoli is from Brooklyn, literally.  Such attentive service from Tony...tyvm!

I have been coming here for years. Honestly, I thought I already reviewed this place, and I am confident I have tried half the menu. I have a favorite server (Brad), although, they are all great. The ambiance, live music, and old school vibe makes you feel like you are dining with mobsters in the 1970's. They use to rep the NY Giants during football season, but I don't remember seeing the flag out this past year. 
When people ask me my favorite Italian food in Vegas, unless I know they are looking for a fancy strip environment, I recommend Casa Di Amore. Once you walk through the doors, you forget you just walked in a small restaurant off Tropicana. Dim lighting, attentive staff, and classic Italian food that reminds me of my grandmother on the east coast. 
Some of my favorite dishes include linguine and clams, eggplant di amore, chicken picatta, and the appetizer of a mini osso bucco with risotto. The risotto is always cooked to perfection. I always add a house salad because their home made dressing is to die for. If I can't make up my mind, I stick with a basic spaghetti and meatballs. Perfect, classic comfort dish. 
They have a bar, but right now it is under construction so they are only serving beer and wine. I can't wait to come see the newly remodeled lounge area once they are done. 
I love the feeling I get when I am here. Everything is exactly how an Italian restaurant should be. Welcoming and comfortable with amazing food.

Stephan was our server and he was amazing! Super friendly! My niece was getting cold in the restaurant and Maria came over and gave her a blanket of some sort, so nice! The food was very good. We ordered the "1 lb pasta" spaghetti and meatballs and 2 large pizzas, a Margarita and a Hawaiian. We had 5 adults and 2 children, we had pizza leftover. Everything was perfect! Will definitely come back again!

Very romantic place. It's very old Vegas feel for sure. We went by chance on a Saturday and they had a small band playing. The lights are very dim and the food tasted great. I had the mushroom gnocchi and lasagna. Yummy. Will come back even though it's a far drive.

excellent local italian restaurant off the strip.
food very good and reasonably priced .
staff are terrific.  very friendly, never an attitude.
highly recommend.
mike s
henderson

This place offers a free complimentary limo ride from the Strip with reservations to the restaurant! What an inexpensive way to experience a limo ride in Vegas. Service was prompt and the menu included many choices from chicken, steak, pasta, and veal. I wish I had room for dessert--also tons to choose from.

I ordered the gnocchi, which was tasty. The place reminds me of an old-fashioned Italian restaurant from the 60s. Live music starts around 6:30pm. This would be a great place to bring a date.

I was looking for an authentic Italian restaurant and this has been the most genuine place. We came when there was a live band playing old school music that I felt like I was Henry hill on his first date. 
The vibe was real good and the food was better. This place will see me again.

I've been wanting to go to this place and the wait was worth it.  Very friendly staff and the food was pretty amazing.  Not your usual Italian food.  I was impressed.  I had the stuffed pork chops and it was amazing! A must try for anyone who visits this establishment.  The only thing I would say is that the price is a bit steep for a neighborhood place, but I guess you can't put a price on a hidden gem like this place.  I will definitely come back.

Went for our anniversary dinner and we loved it! The atmosphere & staff were both amazing ! The food was also fabulous ! We both got the chicken parm with a garlic loaf & a side of meatballs.
