Everything was amazing. Next time I would get extra sauce on the pasta that comes with the chicken parm. Overall great place. We will be back!

Great atmosphere and great service! Highly recommend making a reservation if you have a party larger than 2. They have great live music playing the best oldies. Food is traditional italian style, their homemade marinara sauce is so good!

The food was great (best fettucini alfredo in town) but don't bother making a reservation.  If they can't seat you at the reserved time, they send you to a crowded bar to wait for an undefined amount of time.  

The hostess just says oh it won't be long.  People are wrapping up now.  She wouldn't tell us how many people were in front of us either so we could gauge our own wait time either.  She was pretty useless. 

Always clean and delicious food but the reservation thing happens every time.  Plan to wait 20-30 minutes with or without a reservation.

Nothing but good things to say about this place. Everything was perfect! From the food to the service ( Brad was our server and he was awesome), to the live misc and old Vegas feel. I'm pretty sure we will be back every time were in Vegas. We started with the Calamari and Bruschetta. I recommend both. For our main courses we had the Veal Parm (based on our servers recommendation)... Great choice! And we had the Cioppino.. Loaded with goodness, it was delicious!

Bread & the olive oil / balsamic vinegar sauce is amazing.
Calamari - mmmmm! i love the tenticle fried calamari!!
Bruchetta - there's a sweet kick to it that I absolutely love

Pizzas / Pastas are great! and the atmospher is awesome!

Gotta love the female bartender there...obviously cause it's my homegirl! LoL!

A LV Local took me here for dinner and everything start to finish was amazing! The hostess and server were incredibly sweet and the food was wonderful. If you're staying on the strip, I highly recommend grabbing Uber to this place. Very old school Italian, dimly lit and a live band. Portions are large so you will leave satisfied! Enjoy!

This is a family favorite of ours. Everything about Casa Di Amore is great from the second you walk in. The walls are lined with old Rat Pack photos and there's live music in the evenings. If I want Italian food, this is where I'm going almost every time. The staff is all very friendly and remembers my family even though they don't live here. 

I recommend making a reservation. When you arrive you can hang out in the back where the bar is. They've redone the bar to add more booths so it's a little harder to do this but the whole restaurant is small so there's not much of an option. For starters I've had the bruschetta, calamari, and arancini. We've tried to order the clams a few times but our waiter didn't recommend them because they were apparently small at the time. The calamari is a good choice for a group and the arancini was crispy and creamy. The bruschetta is alright, but they give you a big basket of bread for dinner so it's a little redundant. They'll ask if you want to add any soup or salad to your dinner for a charge but their portions are pretty big so it's certainly not necessary. 

For dinner I pretty much always go for the pasta. I've had the gnocci alla prosciutto, fettucini alla pappasito, and pasta alla forno. The fettucini alla pappasito is one of my favorite pasta dishes ever. It's a creamy fettucini dish with chunks of sausage in it. I add a good amount of pepper flakes and everyone that tries it thinks it's the best dish of the night. The pasta alla forno is a close second. 

Other than taking family here for a nice dinner, I go to Casa di Amore sometimes as a late night option. It's a lot more casual and we usually sit at the bar. After I think 11pm they have 1/2 off pizzas so we'll usually do that or order a 1 lb pasta bowl to share (penne alla vodka). It's a great  option for late night food where usually your only options are smoky bars or chain restaurants. Casa di Amore is actually open until 5am so you can get there pretty late. 

One interesting thing that may be happening is we saw some tiki decorations out in back of the restaurant recently. Rumor has it they'll be opening a tiki bar soon so that will be awesome and add some more room for people waiting for a table or wanting to hang out in a tiki bar. Casa di Amore is easily the coolest part of this part of town.

We had a rehearsal dinner here for my sons's wedding. The food was great. The entertainment was great and the service was great. It is a wonderful restaurant even if you don't have a special occasion. I have never had better meatballs!

This place has old school Italian charm and ambiance, from the decor and band music to the service and the home cooked meals.  Nothing fancy which suits us fine - because this is what an Italian restaurant should be, non-pretentious.  if you've been to Little Italy in NYC, you know what I'm talking about.  We were seated at a table in front of the band that plays soft, easy listening music.  There was a large table near us and they looked like they are from The Sopranos -- awesome!  The waiter was friendly and attentive.  We ordered the calamari to start - The waiter gave us bruschetta on the house because we waited slightly longer for our calamari but the wait was worth it. Calamari cooked perfectly and was lightly battered ..we have not had it like this since we lived in NYC.  The home-made marinara sauce was perfect!  I had the shrimp fra diavolo - delish!  My bf had spaghetti with meatballs and the marinara sauce - he finished it dry with the bread.  Hey, if you can't find good Italian on the strip, or can't stand waiting on line for dinner, this IS the place to go!!  We will be returning on our next trip to Vegas.
This place is just fun. The music is entertaining,  the service is attentive and the food is authentic.

So I just left this place and I must say for starters I wasn't impressed at all. I usually don't go off the previous negative reviews but in this case I should've listened. Upon arrival we were greeted promptly which was a plus and seated right away! So far so good right? Even our waiter was very professional and customer friendly! So let's get to the food. Ordered the chicken Parmagina and Lobster ravioli dish(tonight's special) I wasn't impressed with my food by far and neither was my friend with his dish. I really have had much better Italian at places like Buca Di Peppo and Lavo inside the Palazzo has the best Italian dishes and service hands down! If it wasn't for the good service I may have rated lower but for those of you wondering about the limo? It's a JOKE! An old style limo with a driver in a cheap suit! Please.. Will not be retiring good thing open table awarded 1,000 dining points tonight :-/
Cioppino was delicious. Our waiter, Tony, was so genuine and kind. The bomba dessert is great, I preferred the mango one. Live music is a nice touch. There's a bar with those gambling machines.

This is our second trip to Casa Di Amore within a year. Consistently amazing! Service is excellent! Good is excellent!! Live music makes the evening complete. All four of us had different meals and they were all perfect! Nobody had a pasta hangover because the portions were perfect!!!

I've eaten here a couple of times. Great food! Friendly staff! Excellent ambiance.

Can't wait to visit here again.

Good Food, Good Service, and Good Time for All! 

Being a tourist, but long time visitor to Las Vegas I wanted to get away from "The Strip"
for an Italian dinner for my wife and me. We got a tip from a shoe salesman at the Outlet Mall. He suggested Casa Di Amore on Tropicana. 

It was beyond our expectations! The place was full of Old School ambiance and charm. Yet it was a place that was comfortable for families with young children and other people  "dressed to the nines." Oh, did I mention that there was a musical combo there, too? George, who played the key board, to me favored Sinatra when he sang, and Paul who played the drums and also sang added a real personal touch by making friends with all guests in attendance during the breaks. At the end of the first set, we were all friends.

But let's not forget the food and service. Tony was our waiter and helped us navigate the menu and drinks list. There was nothing rote about his service. He allowed my wife to sample two wines so she could decide what to order (she is not a drinker) and modify her dinner salad as she does not like certain lettuce types. The entrees we fantastic. I had the Linguini and Clams, and my wife had the special Lobster Ravioli. Both I recommend. We had coffee drinks instead of deserts.

I can understand why there were a number of "regulars" there this Sunday night not just enjoying the food and music, but engage the whole restaurant staff as well. If I lived in Las Vegas I'd be a regular, too.

I went here tonight with my husband for our weekly date, and I have to say this place was DELICIOUS! Amazing staff, very friendly and accommodating. The food was beautifully presented, and even better, it was very yummy.  The portions are generous, so expect to take more than enough leftovers home. 
They also have live music and an extensive alcohol list, and many specials for happy hour and different days of the week, in case you're looking for a fun place with great food and drinks to let your hair down. It's also really nice, because the menu is a little pricey, and during happy hour the bar menu is 50% off. 

Definitely come here! You won't regret it.

Very cute Italian place off the Vegas strip! It's a small place so you cannot be afraid of small spaces or eating close to your neighbors. It also was quite loud because there was a large party in there of about 25 people and they also have live music playing through dinner. I loved the music I thought it was a nice touch to have some entertainment so you could take your time and eat dinner. The pasta was very good but the bread that most yelpers recommended was not anything to rave about. It actually reminded me of breadsticks from Pizza Hut so I guess if you're in to those..then try it. I actually did not take any pictures because I was too excited to eat that the pics were an after thought! Sorry :) but I would recommend the fettuccine Alfredo and a side of the meatballs! I didn't have room for dessert because I started with a house salad which was also very good. One of the best things about this place is they have a shuttle that will transport you to and from your local hotel but you have to book in advance because it fills up quick! The prices were not much cheaper than anything you can get on the strip but it was still nice to venture out and check out what the rest of Vegas has to offer.

A staple anytime I'm in Las Vegas. Forget the strip and head here. Always fantastic food, a great bar, live entertainment with crooner singing the staples from old Las Vegas, and deserts that are made fresh and  make you wish you hadn't eaten so much of the fantastic Italian cuisine prior.
If there's a wait, no worries, just walk next door and shoot at the range for a while.

All in all the best Italian in Las Vegas.

Found this place on Yelp with a ton a of great reviews! I was not disappointed. The service we had was just as amazing as the food. I also enjoyed the decor, old Italian mafia feeling...great place 5 stars! Brad was our server and he KICKED ASS. Ask for him. Cheers!

What can I say.... they pick you up from your hotel in a limo... entertain you while serving really great food. Service was excellent and they take you back to your hotel when ready... a must go when in Vegas....

I have to say we totally were looking forward to this and overjoyed ourselves. Don't get me wrong the place is very beautiful and the entertainers are amazing the singer was awesome. The food was just ok though.I wanted authentic Italian but it didn't have all the flavor. I think once was good enough for us not to mention is was insanely crowded and very loud.

I have eaten at this restaurant two times. So I'm not listing it as a five-star even though I have experience five star service there. One and the first time I ate there it was absolutely excellent. No problems whatsoever. The second time I ate there ...there were problems with the waiter bringing the incorrect food and also charging us the wrong amount of money. So hopefully since time has past this type of an issue has resolved itself. I ordered clams. The first time they were absolutely perfect the second time they had sand in it which made it uncomfortable to eat.

I had fried calamari and fettuccine, both of which were well prepared. Our waiter Joanne, was very professional and made a great recommendation for desert. The manager, greeted just about everyone who walked in, so I felt welcomed.

Great service, great staff!! and the food was good. Our calamari was chewier than we thought, like it had been frozen then fried.  The canolie at the end of our meal was fermented. It tasted old and not sweet but very bitter. Very big choice of Amazing White Wines. This family friendly place, has a live band to keep you occupied in your seats while you wait a while for your meal. The price is a little high, for not getting fresh food. Two days after eating here, my husband and I can't stop going to the bathroom. I'm assuming the food that we thought was okay, wasn't. Go for the wine and the music. My opinion.
Great baked clams, desserts are good, fresh ravioli awesome. Service was terrific. This place reminds me of the Italian restaurants in NY

AHH Casa Di Amore...randomly a great time. The first time I walked in was really akward as it is a small little entrancein the front, always locked and you have to go around to the back for entry and push a button. I felt like I was going into a speakeasy. The owner is always out and about talking to people, because he is wasted. funny. There is "live entertainment" which is a guy or  2 on a small stage playing keyboard and eye fucking every woman under 65. Thats right ladies, he's lookin for love! Funny thing is, he has groupies...sad sad groupies throwing back wine like nobody's business. The pizza is good, the bartenders are cuties, you can get pretty crazy there and it's cool.  I like it there and will be back, as soon as this hangover wears off..

You go here for the ambiance. The old Vegas vibes are alive and well. the music was excellent, and our server was nice. But, we had good ordered that was not entered into the system. The bruschetta was good, but no other dish was worthy of enough interest to come back for it. I would take someone here for a drink and to listen to the great band.

Came here with a  wedding party.  Not a place to go if you want a QUIET romantic dinner. It has a nice atmosphere. Live band and friendly staff. Food is good. Huge portions that is enough to share with several people. My only complaint was that it needed a tad bit more sauce. 

We ordered the appetizer sampler and everything on the plate was delicious. I ordered the spaghetti and meatballs. Took couple bites and boxes it up because we had to drive 8 hours home. Warmed it up the next day and it was good but hardly any sauce. Felt like all I was eating was the noodles.

Our first visit and will not be our last. Husband and I were both impressed with each bite. The marinara was obviously simmered for long hours. You can tell things were roasted, sautéed, and detailed with thought and emotion. He had an chicken parm and I had shrimp scampi; to be safe for our first visit.  We also took a successful chance on Calamari fritti. 
  The staff wonderfully hospitable and entertainment unobtrusive to conversation but so sweet to the lover of crooning nostalgia. It was like having your Mama's dinner on Sunday night, no matter your ethnicity. No fluff: mouth and tummies very happy; AND we have leftovers for tomorrow!!!

Went here for my wedding as the last time I had reservations I ended up leaving because the host didn't know what she was doing. Party of 15 great live music great wait staff. They made it real easy on us. Normally I come here for the food. It's normally very good. They changed a lot of the items to cut corners. The clams that people rave about are now 1/3 of the size. The portions are half of what they are normally and seems like the quality is down. Bad food good service and atmosphere. I most likely won't go back as the last 2 times were pretty bad.
If you like the movie Goodfellas & you enjoy authentic Italian food, you have to come here. I absolutely love this place.

Casa Di Amore is a long standing Las Vegas Italian restaurant. Decor is vintage Las Vegas with photos of the original hotel/casinos. Lots of history!  We had reservations and were seated promptly. Lucky to get the last booth. Shortly after we were seated the room began filling up. Two nearby tables were being set for a party of 16 and party of 8.
On this evening the two piece band provided a variety of easy listening music. 

The menu has a wide variety, meats, seafood and pasta's. Also a nice selection of wines by the glass and bottle.

After a few minutes our server Robert appeared and offered us a selection of water. That was followed by a basket of crusty bread and butter. We also received some olive oil and balsamic which was a wonderful complement for the bread.

Our starter this evening was Baked Clams. Ten nice size clams stuffed with bread crumbs, garlic, parmigiano  reggiano, oregano and parsley all nestled in a tasty broth. An excellent appetizer and delicious broth that was soaked up with crusty bread.

Entrees included Chicken Piccata and Cioppino. Two large boneless chicken breasts sauteed with butter, lemon, mushrooms, white wine and capers. The chicken was fork tender with the sauce having a rich butter and lemon flavor. The chicken is generally served with a side of pasta but was swapped for a double baked potato. Plenty of chicken was left over to take home. 

The Ciopinno is served in a large bowl that contained a large portion of seafood including lobster, clams, mussels, scallops, crab, cod and shrimp. All floating a savory broth. Plenty of broth to be soaked up with more of the crusty bread. The Cioppino was excellent, served the way I prefer, without calamari.
Amazing ambience and feels like old Vegas...live band, great specials, good service.  I just wish Sinatra would show!

Absolutely delicious! My boyfriend and I got picked up by a limo and taken to the restaurant. The limo driver even asked if we would like to come earlier and was waiting outside the hotel for us. When we arrived, the place was packed, there was a singer and a Sax player, both very good. Our waiter was the best and even took our picture for us. I ordered the mojito, super good and not overpowering. I had the penne a la vodka in a giant bowl. I couldn't eat even half of it. Halfway into our dinner, everyone was singing "That's Amore" with the singer. I love this place because it isn't pretentious like the restaurants you find on the strip. I even got a shirt that says "We have medical marinara" I'm really happy we chose this place for our anniversary dinner!

After driving by for ages, we finally tried it. It rocks in it's own way. This is your parents ( or grand parents) Italian restaurant. It has an old school, casual feel. It is loud and fun. The room is lined with pics of old Vegas. They have comfy booths, a bar in back, live music and all the usual red sauce type food along with a few unexpected items on a good sized menu. I had the Eggplant Di Amore which is similar to Lasagna and a side of meat balls. My partner had the Chicken Marsala. the food was very good. The Meatballs were fantastic. Casa Di Amore is going to be my new meatball fix spot. Our waitress was excellent, very friendly and helpful with all of our questions. All in all it was a fun lively night with good food and service. I will return soon.

Superb,  classic Italian food. If you are visiting Las Vegas you must try the pasta and meatballs as they were excellent.  Our server Brad gave us the best service I have ever experienced in a restaurant.  Highly recommended Casa di Amore for great food, fine live entertainment and excellent service.

We called last Friday at 7 to make a reservation for 7:30. They say fine, we can make that. So we drive in. We find out that there are numerous parties ahead of us, waiting for a table. After waiting in the crowded bar area for 15 minutes, the host tells us that there are still 3 parties ahead of us. Called up yelp on the iPhone, made a reservation at Strings (a few blocks away) and left the place. 

This is just unacceptable. It's obvious they do that just to attract the customers from the strip (and they are located WAAAY, WAAAY off the strip). If you don't have a table, just be honest and tell us so.  Don't make us come in and wait for one hour.

I wanted to be impressed. I took friends that wanted Italian to this location. It was loud. The service was poor.  The food was decent - but I wasn't wowed. If the service had been better it would have meant a lot.

This was our third visit.  I highly recommend the place.  Yes, it is situated next to a gun shop in a very off-strip location, but once you are in the door, you are captivated by the retro vibe, the good Italian food and the live music.  We have always enjoyed our meals here.  Worth a visit.  Half price wine bottles on Sunday and Monday are a bonus.

I wanted to give them 5 stars so badly!! 

The atmosphere is awesome. Small restaurant, old school Las Vegas. You can't beat it. 

The service is simply amazing!! The bartenders are super friendly and our server was top notch!

But the food is overpriced and pretty average. There just wasn't anything special about any of the meals we ordered. For the price we were paying, we expected better. I've had tastier meals at Carabbas and Maggiano's (and paid a lot less). 

Like I said, the atmosphere and service is unbeatable. But I feel like they are taking advantage of tourists with their prices (and I live here).
My favorite place for pasta there customer service there foood the place it's all good quality to me you would have to try to find out n I fought anyone can be in satisfied so delicious here
Haven't been here in a while, and finally went today! AMAZING! They had live music, GREAT food and awesome service! A little on the pricey side, but worth every penny! Great for date night!

Continues to remain my absolute favorite restaurant in Vegas!!! I wish there was a way to give this place more than five stars because they deserve an extra five . Have yet to have a mediocre dish. :) MMMM

My absolute favorite Italian style restaurant. I've enjoyed the Canteloni, salads and bread! The shrimp cocktail was a old Vegas favorite, too. 

So I stop in on a Wednesday after a long trade show at 9:30. Barely found a spot to park and the place was packed! Only in Vegas. Brad still hamming it up at each of his tables as I ate at the bar - no option! 

The menu has changed, but the same flavors and presentation. I'll miss my old favorites, but grow up fat boy and suck it up! Try something different. This trip I ordered the Chicken Parmesan....this partially due to Peyton Manning and all of the "hammered in your head" commercials on Sunday football. Dang Nationwide Insurance. Class's was no slouch - full of flavor and worth every bite. 

Service is fantastic and I'm sure they make a huge tip base as when people are happy - many go 25%+. Brad is that type of server. 

Anyways - this is just another one of their huge base of Yelp reviews. A true 5 star rating - Enjoy and always win big.

This Was A Great Restaurant It Looked Elegant And It Had Live Music Came Here To Celebrate My 6 Month Anniversary With My Girl And We Loved It. The Waiter We Got Was Really Nice With Us Ad Helped Us Pick Out What To Eat.

This review is for 4.5 stars.

Really good food that is priced accordingly.  It's not cheap by nay means, but on par with any other good Italian restaurant off the strip.  You begin with free bread and a nice side salad for $3 more to any entree.  I had the gnocchi with prosciutto and coupled that with some drinks.  The gnocchi was exceptional but I wish it had more prosciutto and spinach to make it more a formidable dish.  The salad was fine, especially for $3 add on, but nothing more than a house salad.  The house wines were actually quite good and large portion.  Draft beers didn't have a large selection but they had a few IPAs and a few high ABV which I always appreciate. The greatest part was the bar area with plenty of TVs and good service from the bartender.  Overall I very much enjoyed my meal and would recommend Casa to anyone in the area or for someone looking for a romantic Italian not overly priced as if it were on the strip.  Half priced wine bottles on Monday and live music almost nonstop are always a plus as well.

Such a gem. This place has an amazing old fashioned vibe, some of the best service I've ever encountered, and amazing food! This place is a little loud with the live music, but they played some pretty classic songs that had the whole place singing along. 

Although it is off the strip, I would say this place is a must. They have a complimentary limo service that will pick you up and drop you back off if you're are staying on the strip, so there's no excuse not to go!

Horrid from beginning to the end....Service or rather lack of from the beginning Horrid Apps Horrid. Greasy and tasteless and than the Main Course was even brought burnt........but EXITING the door was rewarding to never look back  if i could rate this at less than a star I would.....
This is the best italian resturant i have ever went too.  The drinks are good and the food is even better

Awesome Italian restaurant not too far from the strip. Crowded but the wait wasn't unbearable and the live musicians created a nice ambiance. The cocktail was average (lemon drop martini) but the food was definitely the highlight. 

Tip: ask for a side of hot marinara sauce (which does cost extra) to go with the complimentary bread - it's amazing! Super flavorful. Same goes for the baked lasagna with meat sauce. Hearty, filling and bursting with flavor! Consider this place to be one of Vegas' better kept secrets!
A trip back into Las Vegas history. Wonderful food, great music and a fun teeshirt that comes with the dessert.

This place is a little gem! It's a really nice place to bring a date. Cozy feeling with good live music and an old school Italian vibe. 

The service was great here. Came in yesterday for my bday and they made sure to take care of me. The manager, Smith, was very friendly and it seems like it rubs off on the whole crew there. Michael was our server and he was awesome. He was very knowledgable about the whole food and drink menu and I felt I could ask anything and get an answer (I can be picky and confusing at times lol). It really baffles me when you go to a restaurant and the servers are clueless about the joint. 

The food was delicious and I am excited to come back and try more!!!

Wow! Great food, great vibe, had a really nice time here. Only issue was that we had a reservation at 730 but still didn't get seated til about 8, other than that the service was great, very friendly staff. The band was entertaining but could be kinda loud so it was hard to have a conversation. But I'd go here again and again!

This place was awesome! The portions are huge! The service is gigantic! The kids got cannoli's for dessert which came with a free t-shirt. I would definitely come back to this place. The manager came to our table after dinner to check on us. I am stuffed to the hilt!

I'm new in town, noticed this place out on Tropicana, then saw the Yelp reviews and decided to try it. I love the atmosphere, love that the walls pay homage to the Rat Pack, love the very square yet cool lounge act performing in the restaurant. The host and waiters treat customers like VIPs, reminding me of Vegas when I came here 25 years ago. Nice wine list too. And they serve food until 5am!
The biggest surprise was the food! I ordered spaghetti and meatballs and a caesar salad. I don't know what they do differently, but that caesar salad was amazing. Really, really great! I'm pretty sure I tasted more parmesan than I usually do, but there were some other seasonings in there too subtle for me to identify. Fantastic!
The single serving of spaghetti and meatballs was enough to feed a family of four, unnecessarily large. But despite that, and I can't believe I'm saying this, this was truly the best spaghetti and meatballs I've ever tasted in my life! And I've had some of the best. I used to live i NY & NJ and I've travelled all over Italy. I certainly never expected I'd one day say the best spaghetti and meatballs I ever tasted was in Las Vegas.
I wish I could afford to eat here often. That's the downside, it's just too expensive for me. But for a special occasion, or if you're rich, I totally recommend this place.
oh how I miss going to you every night after partying, I miss your warm Calamari and oh music and old Frank and Dean bar scene .....

I love this place.  Very traditional home cooked like Italian food.   

I had a friend try the steak and oh it was incredible and tender with a demiglaze.  I will have to order that for myself sometime, but I get distracted by the baked Mostaccioli frequently.

I tried the baked lasagna, but it was not a solid lasagna slice like you would expect.  It was loose, disappointing.

I tried my friends vegetarian meatball dish and the vegi meatballs were actually quite good.  I am a meat eater and I may order some for my meal next time.  Basil flavored.

Cocktails are really good here.  All sorts of flavors.

My favorite part:
I love the 60's feel with lounge musicians.   The night gets better the later it gets.
They will even pick your group up at hotels, but not residences.  Too bad for me.  At least the walk isn't too far.  I hope this place never changes.  It just feels so good to be here.

The staff is super friendly and I will be coming back here for a long time.

If you are looking for a quiet place to go, this is not it.  It is fine for children to come if they can handle noise and people.

Good place overall, good food.  I bring all my friends here when they visit, or just when I need somewhere fun to go with my husband after a long work day.

Great place to take a first date.  It looks like a hole in the wall from the outside, but the inside is very classy.  If you're visiting, they offer complimentary limo service!  Lighting is dim and every now and then somebody is singing or playing the piano on their mini stage.  This place has the best shrimp scampi.  You get a free t-shirt if you order the cannoli.

This was my and my boyfriend's first time here and our server Robert made it an excellent experience! There was really good live music, delicious drinks, and great food, and Robert made sure we were taken care of. He answered any questions we had and explained what the best dishes were. The bruschetta tasted fresh and had plenty of topping on each crostini. We weren't too excited about the baked clams appetizer, I don't think I would order it again. My boyfriend got the steak flambe and I got the scallops Florentine, and both dishes were delicious! We had to end our meal with dessert, and both the cheesecake and creme brûlée definitely hit the spot. While we ate, the drummer of the band came and played on the tables and glasses, which was so fun to watch! Overall it was a great experience. We will definitely be making a trip back (but not on Tuesdays!) and hopefully Robert will be able to help us again.

We took our friends to this wonderful place last night and had a great time.  Randy and Paul were there playing some great music and took our requests which made the wives happy.  Great food, great music, life is good!

A little gem in Vegas. We called around 5-6pm for an 8pm reservation. They made no guarantees but promised to accommodate us if we showed up. After a hefty wait at the bar we were seated and the evening could not have gone any better. Service was top shelf. Food was WOW awesome. Drinks and recommendations from our server top notch. The place was full of locals who came for dinner and the house band which was incredible. Hence the reason nobody leaves and the wait was a little long. I don't give 5 but this one was definitely worth it. Next time we will take advantage of free limo service. Too bad five stars is max!

LOVE this restaurant ... delicious food! I would like to say I have tried several dishes but every time I go I am compelled to order the gargonzola gnocchi with state bits ... it is absolutely to die for but they don't have it every night so schedule accordingly!  The ambience with live music after 6 PM is delightful and I always feel taken back to the 60s. The complementary transportation with Craig to and from the restaurant from the strip was an added bonus. Tip Craig generously as he has 17 grandchildren!

Everything about this place was great. I don't think the prices are as bad as other reviewers mentioned. I absolutely loved the the inside of it, my boyfriend kept saying he felt like we were in the movie Goodfellas. All the food we ordered was great and very flavorful, our server was helpful and quick with everything. I will absolutely be coming here more often.

This place is a must see in Vegas! The food is phenomenal and the service is out of this world. This is true Italian how it should be. The bartenders are great and the band plays great music for you to get a real feel of old school vegas. You have to check it out! And they have a tiki bar out back that has half priced drinks and half priced pizzas.

I am a vegas local born an raised and I was driving by this place a few years back.  Their are a few other Italian restaurants in town that have gotten rave reviews but as far as I am concerned, this is one of if not the best places for Italian food in Las Vegas.  The food is always cooked fresh and is very good.  They also bake their own bread.
  
  I almost always sit at the bar in the back and gamble and drink.  Service at the bar, or if you decide to dine in, is always phenominal.  Keep in mind it is a small dining area and bar, however, it is well worth the wait.  I honestly have no bad reviews on anything.  Food, service, gaming, etc.  

  I will be trying a few places around town to compare and will write a follow up about a week or two from now.  If you are from out of town I would highly suggest this place for your Italian fix.

I wasn't that impressed unfortunately with the food I've tried a couple of things off the menu and it's just not to my liking. The scenery is pretty cool and laid back a fun place to hang out. And the waiters and waitresses are every friendly
I love this place and their cannoli are the best in Las Vegas!  They also have live music and a separate bar area. #bestcannolieverrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrrr

I asked my limo driver for a recommendation for a place to eat off of the strip and he recommended Casa Di Amore.  I had high hopes because there isn't any good Italian in Dallas, where I'm from. It was the best dining experience I have ever had in Vegas.  The ambiance is fantastic with the live jazz band and everything we had was delicious.  The scampi, linguine clam and the tiramisu.  Not your usually Vegas tourist destination, seemed like a lot of regulars, but a must try the next time you visit the strip.

My man surprised me with an impromptu dinner here. I was still in my work clothes covered in liquor and muddled fruit (I'm a bartender) but I decided to leap at the chance for some tasty old school Italian food. 

So yummy to the tummy! Brad (I think that was his name) was our server and just a delight to talk to (its amazing how nice people are when you smile and are polite...a lesson to the inexperienced diners and all-around rude people out there). He led us to the best dishes on their vast menu (I had the osso buco and garlic cheese bread). He also was very helpful in picking out the ideal glass of Super Tuscan wine. 

The night couldn't have been better. It was a much needed break from my kids and work. I loved the music, the lighting, the food and the service. Will definitely be back.
their pizza is the closest thing to east coast pizza. mmmm. the feel is old school vegas and they have a guy that sings frank sinatra and dean martin song. so cute for a nice date night.

so my lady on her quest of the best chicken parm in vegas has taken us to  casa di amore.. let me begin with what vegas used to be is a understatment because im sure old vegas wasnt decorated in swapmeeet renderings of old school vegas pics..

on to the food the bread stale not even warm the butter kept in the fridge so to hard to spread.. i had the baked something or other  which was a penne pasta ricotta cheese meat sauce and mozzarella i wont brag about it especially for $20.. her chicken parm now a decent size and well seasoned but definetly not worth $24..

now the service was horrible we seen our waiter 2x once to take our order and once to fill our water since that was all he offered us to drink.. then when we attempted to use  our restaurants.com app gift certificate he said we cant accept the app u need to print it out we have never had this problem before and we use these all the time ..when we  asked to speak to the manager he said hes gonna tell u the same thing wrong answer buddy just go get the boss.. now the african boss runnin the italian spot kinda odd i dont mean african as in a black guy i mean like from africa african.. im not being racist bcuz i am black myself..anyway he was kind enough to allow my lady to go to there office and print the gift cert but was rude to her the whole time i didntgo back there bcuz i was already irritated at this point.. so after all said and done my meal was as still $35 and i woulda rather ate macaroni grill 

ill never go here again!!!!!!!

Casa Di Amore is a small, quaint, romantic Italian restaurant with pretty good food.  It can be a little pricey, but it's worth it for the ambiance.  I ordered the Lobster Ravioli which was quite nice and my friend ordered a steak, which he raved about.  The live music adds just the right mood, with the swooning sounds of Sinatra and a couple bottles of Chianti, who wouldn't feel amorous at the House of Love?

Old world Italian with good service, great food & charming entertainment. Been there twice with big groups & Casa di Amore did not disappoint! Take the drive away from the strip to get here--you'll be glad you did!

We have been to Vegas, many many times. This is hands down the best experience and food you will have while staying here. 
Located about two miles off the strip and just around the corner from our place sits this little whole in the wall.

When you pull up, the first impression you will get is  "this is what all the rave is about?" It literally looks like a run down bar with an old door out front that your not sure you want to walk through. The parking can be a bit off putting, but I'll get back to that in a minute. Just find a spot and go in (reservations our highly encouraged) we did not make any and later found out we were very lucky that we even found seats. 


So... you walk through this door and are immediately taken aback by the intimate atmosphere.  The waitress asks if we have reservations and we tell her emberaasingly "no" she takes our name and say "go back to the bar, I'll find you when more seats open" no question or hesitation, we do so. When we arrive to the bar there were no two seats available, a waiter kindly asked a couple to move down one so. My husband and I could sit together (the couple ended up being regulars who we sat and talked with our whole visit at the bar, which was nothing more then 20mins) I actually wished we could have stayed their longer. The bar tender was awesome, she was making a drink that intrigued me, told me it was a mudslide and I said I would take one as well "she replied with, you can have this one, the floor can wait" and she gave me a big wink. My kind of gal. My husband had a manhattan, of course. 
And we chatted away with the locals who gave us some insight on the the place. The restaurant is open from 5pm-5am, they recommend reservations and too come early for a drink at the bar and play virtual poker or black jack (my cup of tea) there's live music all night long and if your there during late late hours you may see some celebs walking in after their shows. 

Moving on to dinner.... our waiter... we never did catch his name, but if you have a chance to encounter him, consider that you'll never have a more wonderful evening. He had us cracking up all night and was wonderful to watch interact with all his other tables. The other servers seemed just as nice, but he stood out the most. One thing we learned is that most of this group have worked at this place for years and it's amazing to see them work together.



Ok ok food: I ordered the Veal Marsala "delicate and prefecto my husband had the chicken parm, which was rich and amazing. Their red sauce is like no other. I had angel hair with my Veal, perfectly cooked and brought on the side, couldn't have asked for it served any other way. Prior to dinner we had a loaf of bread that were small pieces with garlic butter (my arteries are screaming at me with all the cholesterol) but it was worth it. Between the two of us we couldn't decide if the Cesar or Italian house salad was best, they were both that good! 
We need the night with the Spumoni ice cream dipped in chocolate, enough said. Over we had 4 drinks 3 courses and we were out of there with a bill of $131 (tip included) 
I would recommend this to any couple and family, great experience. 
One last thing we did learn is that they have ride service. They want you to be able to enjoy their amazing wine/drinks and not have to worry about transportation- underutilized but there as an option


Not enough can be said about this place, from the time you walk out there door, they are wonderful, every dang one of them.

Didnt expect a nice restaurant to be in a location like that.

When we walked in we were greeted by a very friendly staff. The atmosphere kinda reminded me of a nice italian places where a mafia family might have a meeting in the corner table while listening to some amazing live jazz music. (did that make sense?)

The appetizer/entree were both great and the owner/manager even stopped by to say hello and chatted with us for a bit to make sure we were enjoying our dinner.

We were too full to try the dessert so maybe we'll get a chance to try it out next time.
All in all, a great dinner experience and will be back here the next time in town.

Great to take a date. Also good to take family, friends, coworkers, and customers.

Recommend making a reservation b/c it started getting pretty busy after 6:30pm when we were there.

The Mrs & I were lost looking for the Sam Boyd Stadium(Supercross)& ended up by the UNLV main Campus.....Duh...
Hungry,rolled by this place ,clicked on my Yelp app & saw a lot of good reviews,so we pulled in.
Just as decribed,an old school mobster hang out.
My rib eye steak,suggested by our waiter Tony(figures),was cooked & seasoned spot on.
The Mrs had the Chicken Floretine,also excellent.
Served with sauteed veggies,twice baked potatoes all good.
They serve fresh made French bread,with a garlic butter,that I had to stop myself from eating the whole basket.Soooo good.
Appears to be a local hangout,as we were at the retiree dining time of 4:30 & were the only couple ,other then the bar flys ,chatting up the staff.
An intersting alternative to the masses on the strip...
I will be back...

Wanted to like this place. Took the family here for dinner. The entertainment was the best part of the night. Food was average @ best. Super expensive for what it was and compare both the quality and $ to the strip. It was loud which was not quite what we were expecting. If this is old Vegas I'm happy to keep it in the past.

We went here last night and ordered the lasagna and vodka penne pasta also the cannoli and got a free shirt! The wine is half off on Mondays on full bottles and we ordered our favorite type of Italian wine sangovase. Tony was our server and he was one of the best servers I've ever had. We loved the experience so much I can't get over it!... We will be back ASAP!!!!!!!! Total the night was 100$ which was great for a bottle of wine, dessert and 2 entries

Loved  is a great and romantic full energy , life music just make really good place , I went to many fancy places around the are , but here was friendly tony , thank you for you great service , and randy and his music loved .

My boyfriend & I went here last night & it was packed! So I immediately thought there would be a wait to be seated but surprisingly there wasn't, we were seated right away. Very small inside but they did have a live band of 3 and full bar.

I give a 3 for the atmosphere & the customer service. I love that it's old Vegas themed & our waitress was very friendly & attentive. For the food, I wasn't thrilled. I got the lasagna & my boyfriend got the chicken alfredo both being a little bland. We've both had better of the dishes. Little pricey but that's expected for an Italian restaurant. Overall, descent.

Amo la Casa di Amore! (in english: I love "house of love")

Honestly we ended up here because of the free limo rides they offer.  

Best. Marketing. Idea. Ever.  

Ok.. in a long time at least... and I'm sure they are cheaper to operate to draw the tourists in than it would be to have built that place on the strip and pay the strip rent premiums.  Pretty genius...   I still scoped reviews  to make sure I wouldn't regret giving up my holiday time to a restaurant with a limo if it wasn't worth it.  Needless to say the reviews were glowing and we booked our limo/reservation.

Limo ride was fun.  Obviously retired by a regular limo company and bought by the restaurant as it's a little run down and not the height of luxury anymore... but it's still a sweet ride and we felt quiet VIP on a trip over the to restaurant.   Obviously the limo isn't REALLY free - you'll have to tip but it's still got to be less than a cab and way more awesome and a cheap way to have the limo experience in vegas. 

The restaurant has some great atmosphere to it - very mobster and old vegas.  There was live music playing and it felt very romantic.  Everyone is very nice and service was top notch. 

I settled on garlic bread and the 1lb spagetti with meatless balls (yes... a whole pound... you'll need to share or take a doggie bag).  ZOMG - it was delicious!   I eat a lot of pasta and frankly the food is usually consumed and as quickly forgotten but this stuff was so good and completely stands out as great pasta.  Meatless balls were great - even my meat loving sweetie enjoyed them.  I wished I could have teleported the contents of my stomach out (or subsequently gone back in time 30 minutes while maintaining my memories) just to eat a second helping of both the bread and pasta. I ate way more than I should have and I'm not sure how I found room for dessert but I'm glad I did.   The cannoli was to die for (maybe not literally... can't tempt a mobster right?).  I've since read you get a t-shirt for ordering the cannoli but that wasn't offered to me that night so i'm not sure what the deal with that is :(.  The night we were there they had 50% off bottles of wine which was very good since the bottles were all reasonably priced to begin with and needless to say we left a little giddy for a couple reasons.   

Prices are decent but not inexpensive and more than worth it.  You'll be able to find a couple promos and coupons around for these guys but you can't stack those on top of special pricing like discounted bottles of wine so I'd find a couple coupons and do some math to figure out the best promo for you on the day you go as sometimes the in restaurant deal might trump the coupons available.   With tips we still did better cost wise than a couple dinner buffets and drinks on the strip and had more fun and enjoyed the food much more. 

The limo was ready almost immediately after we paid... everything was amazing and I can't wait to return next trip down there and tell all my vegas bound friends back home about this little gem.

We have been coming in here for over 12 years and it never disappoints. Great atmosphere and great food. It's always hopping and busy so expect a lively experience. Be prepared for a great meal and a great time. We will be coming back here forever.

This is the second time that I have been to this restaurant and it was a great experience both times. I love the fact that they send a limo to pick you up at your hotel which is a big help if you do not have a rental car. You have to set it up in advance, but it is worth it since all you do is tip limo driver and saves you from paying cab both ways. I definitely recommend doing this. Upon arriving at the restaurant, we were shown promptly to our seats.

We went on Monday night which is 1/2 price bottles of wine. We chose a Risota Muscat d' Asti which was a great wine. We decided to try the garlic loaf on this visit as appetizer and it was great. Good Italian bread with rich buttery garlic sauce and melted cheese. Very tasty and something I would get again. The wife and I both added a Caesar salad to our entree which is only a $3 addition. What a steal. They make a very good Caesar here and you must get it when you dine. For entree I chose the linguine and clams with red sauce and my wife had the eggplant Parmesan. Both were really good and generous portions. For dessert we shared a creme brulee and it was pretty good. Nothing terrific, but tasty. Good thing is you get a free T-Shirt when you order a creme brulee or cannoli for dessert. 

Service here is top notch. Waiters are very courteous and come by often to check on you. They pour the wine and fill you glass as needed. This is an old school place that is classy. There is a lounge singer and saxophone player there that provide entertainment while you dine. The place looks and feels like an old classy location.
We love coming here and it will probably be on our list to visit every time we come to town. If you are able to come and check it out, you will not be disappointed.

One of the best chicken Marsala dishes I have ever eaten!  Service was phenomenal, special thanks to our waiter, Stefan, he was amazing.  I highly recommend this restaurant and We will definitely be coming back on our next trip to Vegas.

The food here was delicious. I ordered the chicken parm and it was probably the best I've ever had. It was a good portion and so tender and juicy. The service was great and the atmosphere was awesome. There was a live band playing. The prices were a little more on the expensive side. I am use to paying 15-17 dollars for my chicken parm and it was 22 here. After taking a bite into it, it did not bother me one bit. 

This place is located off the strip and you will need to make a fairly decent drive to get there. Thank goodness that Uber is so cheap out there in Vegas.

I definitely would recommend that you come here, you won't be disappointed.
We popped in for dinner midweek on a trip to Sin City in February after being told about this place for years. Good food, good wine, and unique atmosphere of Old Vegas made it a dinner to remember.

Ever feel like you want to experience old school Vegas? Walk into Casa Di Amore and its like walking into a time warp. Classic pictures on the walls, dark leather and warm brick, ambient lighting. Live music every night, impeccable service, fantastic menu. Our server Robert was on top of things! Wine glasses were never empty, his menu selections were spot on, and we felt like we were family. The bus boy was like a thief in the night.... We never knew he was there but somehow our water was always filled and our empty plates mysteriously disappeared from the table. Food was delicious. Calamari was lightly breaded and crispy. My eggplant was stuffed with cheese and spinach and still managed to stay firm. Hubby had cannelloni with ground veal that melted in your mouth. A word to the wise, they are closed on Tuesdays and MAKE A RESERVATION! We happened to walk in on a Monday night and there was one open table. ONE! There is a small bar area with a few open  2 person booths. Just goes to show how amazing this place is that a Monday is standing room only.
My wife and I eat here often with friends and family. I really like the live music and the food is great.

When the moon hits the sky like a big pizza pie that's amore...
This restaurant is definitely an old Vegas experience you have to try at least once.

We were sat at a table very close to the front and had an up close view of the entertainment. We enjoyed listening to some old love songs some Sinatra and felt like we had stepped back in time.

We ordered the antipasti salad, and it was delicious and huge!! Salami, marinated veggies, large pieces of cheese and a great vinaigrette. We looked like we barely made a dent in it and had to take some home. The waiter offered to store it in the fridge for us and I thought that was a very nice touch. 

My partner ordered the steak flambé, which has a delicious Demi glaze and was cooked to a perfect medium. 

I ordered the lobster ravioli which was served in a red cream sauce. The ravioli had perfect pieces of lobster in them and the cream sauce was flavorful without being overpowering to the pasta.

The bread was fresh and warm and our server made sure we had fresh bread for our entrees.

We finished off the evening with a cannoli and it was one of the best I've ever had! We even got a "leave the gun take the cannoli" t-shirt! 

A great time with great service! Definitely a check off the restaurant bucket list for Las Vegas.

Somewhere, between the days when the Italian mob used to run this town and today, Italian restaurants in Vegas started acting like the coward bully who only starts picking on people and acting like a big shot when he thinks the teacher is not coming back. Most of them have great food and many of them try to show off their connections to the days of old, pretending to be something they never were and never could be.

Casa di Amore is one of those establishments that has a real connection to Vegas' past, but lacks the pretention of those other joints. Everyone here, from staff to management to the customers who make Casa di Amore their regular stop, is genuinely low key and laid back. They're far more interested in making sure you enjoy yourself with some old-time Vegas than trying to pretend they are some big shot from the glory days.

The food is exactly as good as you expect and never let's you down. The price point is extremely reasonable, especially on half price wine bottle night. 

Stop in and you'll be made to fell at home - with a great meal and a fabulous experience.

What a bizarre little restaurant. Friend and I were driving down Trop and craving Italian. Saw this place out of the corner of my eye and decided to swing in. Didn't have high hopes because of the name (seemed a little cheesy), but figured it was worth a shot. There is some sort of inner-dimensional time shifting porthole just outside the front door, because as soon as you step in the restaurant you transported to Brooklyn circa 1978. 

The place was packed, and I mean wall to wall. Grabbed a seat in the bar and just fell in "like" with the place. I can only describe the whole event as surreal. There was even a guy at the bar that looks like he was cast out of "Goodfellas." I still think he was paid by the restaurant to be there. 

Service was good, ambiance was outstanding, food was 4/5 stars. Had stuffed ravioli, the cheese was great, but pasta was not great. Salad was very good with a house made dressing. Also ordered spaghetti with Gypsy sauce. They will warn you that it is spicy. Let me warn you, IT IS SPICY. I had to dilute it with marinara. Very good though, and the meat balls were great. 

Would have given 5 stars but I thought it was a little pricey for both location and quality of food. Also, I am pretty sure my Johnny Walker Black was a Red. Might have been a mistake on the order from the noise of the festivities, but I got charged for a Black. 

I would go back, mostly for the ambiance and that Gypsy sauce. I recommend it, but stay away from drinks or your bill will be high, high, high. And make sure you stroll through the bar to see if they have the "Goodfellas" guy there, he made my night just by his presence alone.

I've eaten here several times now and this restaurant is constantly producing good food.  They have decent live music and if you go on Tuesdays selected bottles wine are half off.  It is a great reminder of what old Vegas use to be.

Experience, food, nostalgia, and tradition. The way Vegas used to be and hopefully, this will always be the piece that stays.  The live music and ambience puts you in a trance of what life should feel like. Thank you, George, Paul, Bryan, Rebecca, and Roshy for making this place magical.
I loved the food. It's everything you'd imagine a good old school Italian spot to be.

Food was awesome. Not your basic steak potatoes and veggies. Flavor for miles. Service was great. Todd was a great help with suggestions and wrapped my meal to go. It was a new experience and we'll delivered. Thanks guys

This place is somewhere to go if you want to get away from the busy vegas life style. Fine Italian food and soft atmosphere. You truly feel you're in Europe, or a classic old Las Vegas. Beautiful. Live music that is always on point. The only thing I'd say is the service is slow. Not sure if it's the atmosphere or the pace you should be at. I enjoyed the slow pace though.

We stopped for a couple of nights in Vegas on our way to Scottsdale AZ for Spring Training.  After checking around for dinner places to celebrate our 25th anniversary, we decided on Casa di Amore based on other Yelpers' reviews.  We wanted someplace off the Strip that locals might go to.  And boy, did Casa di Amore deliver! It looked & felt like old Vegas, during the Rat Pack days.  The décor, the entertainment, the 'feel'; it has it all.  An added bonus was it was half-price wine Monday.  ALL bottled wines are half price!  

The service was above & beyond from our waitress, Lynn.  She let us taste a couple of wines before buying. (She also let me try the gnocchi before I ordered but asked me not to tell so this is our little secret.)  Hubby had the rib eye with cabernet demi-glaze & peppercorn sauce. It was cooked to perfection. I had the gnocchi florentine with prosciutto in a white wine cream sauce. Lynn said we can request any ingredients be added or removed so I added sautéed mushrooms.  M-M-M!  Desert was a wonderful tiramisu.

The live entertainment was a two-man combo, keyboard & drums. They looked like they could have played the Sands or the Stardust way back when. The dinner music just adds that little 'something' to make the night special.

Thanks to Vegas yelpers, they led me to this place.  I made previous reservations and told the girlfriend we were going out but didn't tell her the details.  She was really surprised when the limo showed up and took us to the restaurant.  

This place is great.  Very old school.  Wine bottles are 1/2 off on Sundays and Mondays. 

So we started with the special appetizer.  Crostinis with buffalo mozz and prosciutto topped with roasted red peppers... MMMMM!!! 

For my dinner I ordered the Osso Buco.  Holy crap.  I had never had it before.  The best meal that I have ever eaten.  And I eat a lot!

This was the best experience I've ever had in Vegas.  If I ever go back out, I'll definitely be hitting this place again. 

With appetizer, 2 dinners, dessert and a half price bottle of wine it was about $110 without the tip. Little pricey, but definately worth it.  Plus the limo ride to and from was free! (I did tip the driver though)

Highly dissappointed. Restaurant was too busy so we ate at the bar because staff said there is a "bar menu that has some items from the regular menu." Fine by me. I ordered a build your own pasta for 20 bucks which was basically a scam dish. For 20 bucks the bowl was the size of a appetizer bowl really. It had probably about 1.5 cups of noodles and 2 meatballs. This was absolutely ridiculous for the price!!! Needless to say we left mad and hungry. I looked at the menu for regular dining and prices are way higher...im sure the dish may be a Little bigger -Hopefully! Couldnt even get bread at an italian bar for the price! Sadly wont be back to even try the full on restaurant. This dish needs to be lower in price especially for the bar.

This place is wonderful. Very romantic setting. They do have a live band and it can get loud at times. From our appetizer of crustini to the fresh baked bread garlic butter and the spicy gypsy sauce to dip your bread into. It's wonderful all around. With an extensive wine menu. And there staff if very knowledgeable on all of there wines and menu items. I recommend this for a date night!!

After driving past this place about a million times (and admiring the bright red, white & green neon sign,) I was finally brought here by my boyfriend for an early Valentine's Day dinner last week. I've heard so many great things about the place, so I was super excited!

We were seated & served immediately by a super charming man (whose name currently slips my mind, sorry!) and the food was fantastic! I highly recommend their calamari & the jumbo ravioli entree.
Delicious food, live music, and very friendly service.  Laid back, casual delicious broccoli rigatoni dish.
Great food, atmosphere & service. The fried calamari is the best in Vegas. Don't forget to have a cannoli and get a t-shirt on the house.
Loooved it! Went for my birthday and it was perfect! Jazz music and dim lighting, very nice place. Free cannoli for birthdays with a candle and song
Amazing service and even better food! Great atmosphere! Definitely a new favorite for date night!

Place is so solid. Sunday nights 50% off all wine. Good mood music. Great food. Fun staff. Just a really good spot off the strip. You cannot go wrong here. You will leave in a GREAT mood....especially if you get the Veal Osso Bucco. Enjoy.

Late night hole in the wall find for us. We met up with some people here around 2 in the morning. Friendly crew there, mixed bag of patrons which was cool Met some nice people there.

Ordered the meatballs (didn't try them but those who did, raved) I had a chicken breast and green pepper pizza and it was damn good. Thin crust, just the right amount of sauce and not over cheesy and greasy. Good stuff!

Went on a Sunday night and was pretty busy. I was shocked at how LOUD a place called Casa Di Amore was. You will literally have to SCREAM at the person next to you in order to have a chat. I'm good with locals places, not every nice restaurant has to be in a casino or be stuffy but if I am going to pay roughly 100.00 for a dinner for 2 I'd like to not sit 2.5 feet away from a white guy with dreadlocks and his date + hear them scream at each other trying to converse for an hour. Sorry, I'm not cool with sitting in the middle of a loud room in a small 2 seater table for these prices (8 bucks for a beer!!!?? in a restaurant off Trop and Mcloud???). Now if it was 3 bucks a beer and slash about 40% of food prices I can roll with it.

The service was rushed and not great, we saw the waitress twice the whole time (she was busy in her defense). Again for these prices and a spot that calls itself the house of love I was really surprised at the lack of attentiveness. 

The food was not great, the calamari was squishy, mealy, flavorless and the kind you are bummed out when you get (anybody who orders it often knows what I mean). The dishes were very average and not large in portion. I had the linguine and clams and like I said it was ok. Can't recommend it though.

 I'm going to take Piero's over this place 100 times out of a 100. At least I get great service and a nice atmosphere for my expensive meal. 

In a nutshell:
 not a place I would take a date because its loud as f and not really intimate (small but not intimate)
Expensive as a strip casino for drinks so that rules out swinging by and hanging at bar to listen to the band (which you can barley hear with all the diners yelling at each other)
Food on my visit is average at best and the portions were smallish. (in fact a few hours later we went up to Metro Pizza to share some food since we were still hungry).
I'd venture to say many people that give overwhelmingly positive reviews did not pay the bill. 
In addition I see a lot of reviews that say this spot is "so old school Vegas", I mean I guess if by old school means they threw up a bunch of vintage Vegas pictures they found online and blew up. This place hasn't been around THAT long and WTH is old school Vegas about charging 10+ for a cocktail in a local restaurant? The more correct term would be it's Old School/Rat Pack (whatever) Vegas for those that have no clue what that actually means.

First of all let me preface this review by stating I have lived in Vegas for over 20 years and have my favorites in town for Italian food and this is not one of them.  I loved the warm cozy atmosphere and the music was a nice touch however it was drafty in the restaurant and very busy.  The food is over priced and the drinks were very expensive.  I got sick after eating the chicken parm.  I am from the east coast and I that's what I was expecting however sadly disappointed.  Chicago joes is better food and less expensive
Very good and authentic Italian food, great staff and atmosphere. Hidden gem and great local spot

We were lucky to have gotten in without a reservation on a Tuesday night! Did not feel touristy, but it seemed that most people in the place were not from the area. Loved all the canvases on the wall of Old Vegas--definitely more history than you'll get anywhere on the strip.

The food was good--we split the alfredo and it was a perfect split size. Not very many wines by the glass, and cheaper to order the bottle anyway. Soup and salad does not come with the entree, and I would not recommend spending the extra money--the entree itself was very filling and we had split it! Plus it was nothing that special--chicken noodle "spin off" as some others have said. 

A few complaints: Our server was sort of kissing up to us, but when it came time to get our bill he was nowhere to be found. They also don't seem to have serving sections, so it would have been hard to grab his attention. Luckily the manager(?) walked by and heard us talking about it so he ran the check for us. Also unsure whether bread comes with the meal--we were not offered any and ordered the garlic loaf instead, but the table next to ours got bread with olive oil and vinegar. 

I will give it another chance, but there are other places I'd recommend to out-of-towners.
Went there on superbowl weekend..loved it definitely a regular place to visit when I go to vegas again. And the free limo ride was a huge brownie point winner.

Food was fantastic! 

We waited at the bar for our table. Ordered a Luigi's lemonade and a mojito, both were great. Once seated we ordered sautéed mushrooms to start. Chicken masala with a side of fettuccine alfredo & cheese ravioli with a side of vegetarian meatballs. We finished it off with a cannoli, they're freshly made and tasted divine! 

Our waiter was super friendly and nice, everything was just fantastic, both food & service! The only negative thing is that the food was slow to come out of the kitchen. They have really good fresh made bread with herbed butter though, it made the wait much better.

Valentines Day Hideaway....I almost hesitate writing this review because my husband and I consider this our secret  rendezvous. Some things just have to be yelped about and this restaurant definitely qualifies.  
From the appetizer (BAKED CLAMS ARREGANATA $14.00 my favorite),
The Salads( Caesar 3.00w/entree- is our Favorite),
GARLIC LOAF $5.00 (Must Try This)
VEAL DI AMORE $29.00 (My husbands doesn't sway)Tender pieces of veal, pounded thin, sauteed with mushrooms and peas in a creamy veal flavored sauce over capellini.(my husband substituted the pasta for GNOCCHI for 5.00+) 
FRUTTI DI MARE $28.00(My NEW fav. I try something different everytime, but I might not anymore!) variety of seafoods including shrimp, scallops,muscles,clams and calamari in choice of red or white sauce traditionally served over linguini.(Substituted the pasta for GNOCCHI for 5.00+) 
We didn't order dessert but if you do you also get a FREE Casa di Amore t-shirt (with specific desserts)
They also offer FREE limo-rides. Might have to take them up on this offer soon.
 PLUS amazing entertainment (Frank Sinatra and Dean Martin our Favorties!) 
and top notch service will keep us coming back. 
DON'T FORGET THEY TAKE RESERVATIONS that are required on special occasions.

New Vegas tradition. My wife,sister,and brother in law dined here a few weeks ago and it was great. 
Had limo pick us up at strip hotel ( only us four in limo) and took short ride to restaurant . Slow night so we were seated as soon as we arrived. Small place but great decor and the live music during dinner is just great ambiance. 
Great server
Great drinks
Excellent food ( had the veal )
Free ride 
Pricing is normal for Vegas, but I expect to pay 30-50 a piece for dinner. The difference here was the service if you treat people with respect in turn great service. We all loved it will be back every time in Vegas.
Best marinara sauce ever and the food portion is a lot as well! Hidden gem on Tropicana for real.

Last night was my first experience of many to come at this restaurant! The Calamari was delicious, the garlic bread to die for, my husband had fettuccine with chicken and shrimp,  it was awesome and more than enough food for him. I had salmon, veggies,  and twice baked potatoe, yummy! The service was delightful and the drinks were great! The 2 man band added a nice ambiance to the restaurant! Thanks for the delicous meal and welcoming ambiance! We will definitely be back!

Went there last night and ended up with food poisoning couple hours later. The place was great I love the dim lights and the candles on the table. It was a little too loud for me everyone was yelling at each other just to hear each other. Staff was great. My husband had the Frutti De Mare and that's what made us sick.
We were recommended to this place by some friends who told us to get the Steak Sinatra. We had it and think it's the best steaks in town.

Love this place! Came to Vegas to celebrate my birthday and I had to try the best in Italian food. Many people raved about this place and it's live music..

I set-up a reservation and had a car pick us up! The place was undergoing reservation but it was still very quaint. The food was really good. I'm glad I asked for extra sauce because they don't give a lot. Overall, I had a good night with great tasting food.

The singers were great!
Delicious food, fantastic drinks, live music, incredible service... A must when you visit Vegas!!!

Being going there for years when in town just there yesterday again, always consistently good.

Bar - Good bartenders, make drinks well, video porker acceptable get a key so you spin.
Wait Staff - Always professional, know the menu well good with recommendations food & wine.
Food - Excellent.
Entertainment/music - Nice.

My opinion reasonably priced and cant go wrong having a meal here.

Love this place... The food is terrific, the staff is super friendly! Feels like an old local Italian restaurant in Chicago! Love the live music on weekends and the old world feel... Again, the food is terrific!!!!
Absolutely delicious, authentic, Italian cuisine. Relaxed, family style atmosphere... definitely worth a visit.

The perfect date night place, hands down!
The atmosphere is beautiful and everyone is very friendly. Our server Tony was awesome. 
I had the Fettucine Alla Pappasito. It was perfect, just perfect! The Caesar salad was the best I've ever had. Their wine selection left a little to be desired, but other than that, this place is great. The live entertainment was a perfect compliment to our meal.  I cant get over what a wonderful experience this place was. I'll definitely be back!

The restaurant is small and cozy with a very nice musician/vocalist on a Wednesday night. The menu has all the classics you would expect for an old world Italian place. The wine list is varied with a decent amount of choices. 
The stuffed peppers appetizer was phenomenal. Cooked to perfection with the pepper soft enough but not over cooked. The stuffing was delicious and the sauce on it matched perfectly. 
The osso bucco entree was also excellent with the risotto side to match. 
My wife had eggplant parmigiana that was bitter and had a dark marinara that made it more bitter. The homemade pasta was over cooked with the same sauce. She didn't like either. 
None of the deserts are homemade, we didn't even look at the menu for it.

Holy cow!! This place was amazing. We took advantage of the limo service from our hotel. The limo driver was extremely courteous and professional. This place is classic Vegas. Old school charm, delicious food...even a lounge singer. Our waiter Brad was great, made great recommendations and got everything perfect and timed just right.  I highly recommend a visit to this place whether you are a local or a tourist.
One word. Incredible. The food is the best. I grew up on this food. The capizzoli's are the reason I need a diet, but damn, it's worth it.

I'm sorry , but the cheesiness of this place ruined my experience. Their only saving grace was that at least they say that their Italian-American cuisine. The old school Chicago Italian blah blah style is so overplayed that honestly nothing was exciting or new about it I.e., Italian American club, buca di beppos etc... I'm from milan, and the food was like olive gardens. Thank god I was invited otherwise I wouldn't step foot I'm the place. Fail.

I can't say enough about the good vibes, good service, good entertainment and good food over at Casa Di Amore. I've been in several times over the years and it's always a great experience. I dined there with out of towner family and none of them had been there before. The common thought was that it reminded them of old school Las Vegas. I arrived a few minutes early and our table was put together even before our actual reservation time. Our server was accommodating and helpful guiding us through the menu and he even put up with an indecisive 9 year old. Whether it's a date night or an upscale old Vegas family outing, I highly recommend checking this hidden Las Vegas gem out.
I savored every damn bite. Old school Italian. We stuck with the simple dishes and each was 'slow down mouth this is the good stuff' damn damn damn with a side of hot damn.

I went with a friend who said i hadn't lived until i got here. I stepped inside and i immediately felt like i was under dressed. It's old school, that's why. 
Regardless, the owner i was told was belting out Italian classics. And was good too. The Chianti was great and I had the chicken parmigiana which was excellent.

But here is where I was impressed. My papa was the best Italian cook, well in the family. He came from a long line of Italian cooks. So my test is to see how good the meatballs are. And for three bucks they were great!
love this place!

The wife and I heard great things about the place and so decided to check it out. We stopped by on a Monday because we heard about large crowds on the weekend. The place inside is a bit dark and reminds one of being back in the 50's and maybe catching Dino and Frank sitting in a corner enjoying a meal together. They had a singer who sang some great tunes. Our waiter was very pleasant and he walked us through the menu and we ordered several dishes and a bottle of sparkling spumante wine. All in all it was a great place to eat and recommend that anyone headed to Vegas should stop by and enjoy a great Italian meal. Don't forget to order a cannoli for desert too....

Long long wait.  Estimated times are not accurate.  Reservations are not honored or respected.

I called at 6:25pm asking for the wait time because if it is long then I'll find somewhere else to go.  Las Vegas has many places for dinner.  The woman on the telephone offered a reservation at 8pm --Ok, that's good because the initial reviews read are good.  We arrived at 7:50pm for our 8pm reservation.  I don't mind waiting sometime because we are early.  I check in with the hostess and was told that they are getting the table ready and it will be a "short" time.  Cut to FIFTY MINUTES LATER at 8:40pm, we are still waiting.  After checking in with the hostess a couple times, they keep telling us, "short" time, 10-15 minutes.  It is after 9pm now, more than 1 hour after we arrived and more than 1 hour after our reservation time, and definitely NOT a short time, or NOT after 10-15 minutes.  We left to In-N-Out a couple blocks away.

Throughout this entire time, we were told, they cater to locals and the people are not leaving, their checks are paid, but they are not leaving.  Well, I can understand that, but please do not tell me it will be a short time, or it will be 10-15 minutes, or promise me reservations at 8pm.  Just tell me the truth. Do not waste my time, especially on a vacation in a city that has so many other options.  If I knew about the 1+ hour wait (with reservations) I would have decided differently.  Do not tell me something that is not true.  The restaurant knows the estimated wait time and do not tell me it will be a short time.  This is what happened, my party of 5 and I lost  1+ hours waiting because this restaurant kept telling us the wait is a short time, promised a 8pm dining time, and kept telling us 10-15 minutes.

The best! THE nicest people work here and shared their restaurant with us. 

Joanne makes an amazing cold, dirty martini with blue cheese stuffed olives. She couldn't be sweeter. 

Paul is the entertainment director and plays the drums while they belt out Sinatra and Deano hits. He's dapper and quick with a smile. 

If you're looking for classic, old school Las Vegas this is it.

We went here after reading great reviews and we honestly couldn't understand why they are rated so high.  They had live music which was great, but way to loud.  We had to almost yell to hear each other over the music.  

Upon entering we were met by a server who ended up being our waitress who was anything but hospitable and service oriented.  

Food arrived and it was as if it came from a box.  Nothing was fresh as the menu stated. 

This place only received three stars because of an amazing employee named Cisco.  Had it not been for his amazing service and friendly attitude this would have been one star at best.
Great fresh Italian food. Awesome entertainment. The place feels like an old school joint Las Vegas forgot! Love it. We always visit.

This is a must go place in Las Vegas for a great traditional Italian meal.  I just love that this place brings you the memories of Vegas in the 1950's.   I got the veal parmesan which comes with a side of pasta and consisted of 4 pieces of veal and almost too much for me to eat.  I had to take a break half way through the meal to rest before I could complete the meal.
