The waiter was wonderful and personable; a joy to be served and gave great suggestions tailored to our tastes.  Along with the meal you get live music singing Sinatra songs and such from that era.  When we got close to the end of our meal we asked to call for a cab and he arranged for us to be driven back in there limo.  Really nice touch.

Makes you feel special, offered us complementary limo service on our next trip, (we were staying at Sam's town, and they still offered the limo.) The lounge act harkens back to an earlier vegas style, and the food had great prices for proper portion sizes.

Dissappointed heard great things regarding the food. To start the waitress said you two guys sit here, my daughter and myself.    After confusion about the menus she did manage to bring them my daughter ordered alfredo overcooked watery sauce with no taste not even salt. I had ordered osso buco which consisted of two bones without meat from the fringe it was not veal with a rice substance with a unnatural yellow color no taste and overcooked. I must mention the bread had a great crust. Training the new staff  should be priority. The prices do not reflect for this food or service.
You cant turn down a free limo ride! I went here for my birthday, and everything was excellent. Service was top notch, great food, and live music. I would highly recommend eating here.

I'm very glad that I found this place on yelp. It's a gem! I will definitely come back when I'm in Vegas.  The old School Vegas style and entertainment were enough for me to really like it, but the food and service were  amazing.

Drinks were well served - no skimping.  Food was delicious and server was friendly and very helpful.  Live music and ambience reminiscent.of Vegas in the 60's.  Loved it!  Will definitely recommend to friends and will return.  Extra benefit:. they provide round trip transport from your hotel.

Came lastnight and it was packed! We didnt make a reservation but got sat in the bar area quickly. The oil vinegar and cheese sauce wasnt what I expected. It was full of minced garlic and parsley instead? Bartenders were awesome with our orders. I def recommend making a reservation. The food was okay for very pricey menu

This restaurant is pure old Vegas. You walk in and are engulfed in vintage burgundy and gold. There is a lounge singer who sings the classics loud enough to hear, but soft enough to not intrude. We came hear with two out of town friends. We got the bruschetta and calamari for appetizers. The bruschetta was delicious, with sweet, ripe tomatoes. The calamari though was the star, very lightly breaded and flash fried, it was the best calamari I've ever had. We all shared  a bottle of wine, which was reasonably prices and tasty, a Malbec. For our entrees we ordered fettuccine with shrimp, linguini with clams in white sauce, chicken Parmesan, and gnocchi with prosciutto and spinach is a four cheese sauce. Everyone raved about their entrees. I had the gnocchi and the gnocchi were pillow soft. The sauce was rich and elegant. We ordered molten lava chocolate cake and passion fruit bomb for dessert. The cake was good, exactly what you would expect. The passion fruit bomb was divine, the sorbet inside tart mixing well with the outside, sweet chocolate shell. Altogether the meal was $208, a fair price for an exquisite dinner with excellent service.

A tip for the next time we go... Bottles of wine are 1/2 off on Mondays.
I really enjoyed this restaurant.  It was very quaint and had a small jazz lounge appeal.  The food was good, the staff was friendly and the live music was awesome!

Never have we had an experience like the one we had here...  We arrived and were asked if we had reservations which we did not, as this wasn't a planned stop.  After being seated at a table which was clearly an afterthought  (it was half a table and half booth seating  you had to sit side by side) which was fine with us as we aren't particular and it faced a small stage but didn't face the rest of the restaurant.  We placed our order for house salad and a build your own pizza.  We asked for all veggies and no cheese.  (We don't eat dairy or meat.) After waiting for a bit, a manager came to our table and stated that the chef would not accommodate our order.  He will in no way deviate from the menu and basically told us he has standards to uphold and obviously we were below them...  We were taken aback as we have never been treated like that before.  We have never had a restaurant not accommodate our diet in some way.  Needless to say we sat in the parking lot for a bit in disbelief.  I wouldn't recommend this establishment to my worst enemy.  Would of given zero stars if it were an option!
Old school Italian restaurant in Las Vegas off of the strip.  Think Rat Pack meets Elvis. Great good, wonderful service and 3 piece band keeps this place as a must do while visiting Las Vegas !!!

First let me start out with saying we love this place and it has never disappointed. With it being only about ten minutes from the strip and they have complimentary shuttle service it makes it a great option for people looking to dine off the strip. It is a predominately a locals spot, however, a great place for anyone. The decor here reminds of a place straight out of the rat pack era/ old Vegas era which is an awesome sight to see, as Vegas has changed so much since then. We generally choose to sit at the bar as they have video poker games. The bartenders and the rest of the staff are friendly we especially like Roshy. Our most recent time there were shared the mini osso bucco which was served on top of risotto. This dish was absolutely fantastic, and loved every single bite. We waited a little bit before ordering our entrees but when we did we split the veal francaise which was served with a side of pasta. This dish was one of the best plates of Italian food I have ever had. The veal was perfect and tender the lemon butter was delicious. The pasta was perfectly cooked and the sauce that we chose for our pasta which was Alfredo was amazing. After gambling and drinking a couple more drinks they arranged for a shuttle to take us back to the hotel, and the driver was friendly and talkative. This is a must go place for great Italian food whether you reside in Vegas or just visiting make sure this place is on your list.

A group of 10 of us had a fantastic time here!  A live musical duo performed fantastic standards and provided great entertainment.  Our service was fantastic even though they were busy.  The food was solid, garlic bread strong, cioppino was decent with a fantastic broth and the wine was enjoyable!  Not my first time here and not my last.

Old Vegas charm with delicious food.  The dining room was filled to capacity. The staff was both friendly and helpful..  We were asked iff we were celebrating anything. The waiter would request a song from the musical duo . I  ordered the scallops in a cheese and mushroom sauce served with twice baked potato and broccoli.  The other entree shrimp spicy tomato linguine.  The bread is served warm and with herb butter.  The waiter took care of the  dessert, cannoli and cheesecake.  Perfect
Horrible stay clear they do not know the meaning of a reservation waited more than an hour to sit after our time, order was wrong than was cold and undercooked.

KiiFood... EXCELLENT
Service..... EXCELLENT
Ambience.....9 out of 10 very loud
Overall experience was very good can't wait to go back. I've lived in Vegas almost 50 years why have I not discovered this gem a bit earlier. My only complaint was the noise level but it was crowded and had tile floors

My husband is a big Buca Di Beppo fan and sometimes it's just too much for me. There is too much noise, very cheesy design and honestly as one who cooks at home, I have a hard time justifying the prices. I wanted him to be able to have that experience but on a more intimate, low key and mature level. So I chose Casa Di Amore. Just like most people I looked all over yelp for photos, menu prices and ambiance. This restaurant had a great selection of food at a more reasonable price with a more romantic atmosphere. It's dim lit and has large booths, which is always a plus and live music. I am a total sucker for live music at any capacity really. 

 I ordered the Penne & Greens and my husband ordered the Baked Mostaccioli. We shared a side of Garlic Bread because why not?! Both dishes were very tasty and quite large for the price which averaged $20-$23 a plate. Still a bit expensive considering I can make pasta at home for under $10, BUT we're paying for an experience. 

Our waiter was very kind and attentive. There was not a long wait to be seated or to receive our food. Was it the best Italian food I have ever had? No, but it was still really good and the experience was very pleasant. I will definitely come back and as a side note they did have a few other vegetarian dishes on the menu which I am looking forward to eating in the future.
Amazing food, friendly staff, entertainment band. I recommend this to visitors and locals alike.

We recently returned to Casa Di Amore after having moved to the other side of town.  Prior to our move we frequented this restaurant often when it was opened 24/7.  Currently it no longer operates 24/7.

Since returning and then checking yelp for reviews, I was stunned that nobody mentioned the table situation since the renovations, because it is bad enough to ruin your dining experience.  One of the unique features about this restaurant is that it has booths to accommodate up to 6 people.  Since the renovation, the owner opted not to replace the tables that fit the booth!  Instead he opted to put TWO  2-top tables together turned sideways!  So these spacious booths now have two very narrow tables, side by side resulting with two people  eating where the two tables meet.  What was he thinking!  In addition, these tables have huge cafe stands which limit your leg and foot room.  The tables also are not balanced to the floor which means you need to be very aware of your plates at all times because they  tilt and swerve.  Who does this?  All the booths in this restaurant now have this impractical table setup.  Michael get the correct tables for your booths.

Another annoying feature about the renovations would be the extremely bright (pink) spot lights on each table.  It is like being in a room with over the top  pink fluorescent lighting in your face.  There is nothing warm about the lighting anymore in this restaurant unless you sit in the bar.  A lighting designer would never use this configuration.  

The food.  The beauty of Casa Di Amore in its day was the quality and value.  The current prices at Casa Di Amore are very  inflated for the quality.  As in Sinatra pricing at the Encore minus the high quality food.  The food presentations are what my Sicilian grandmother would call "half-hearted".  Their signature wedding soup is now loaded with salt, missing the greens (that it use to have) and the broth that years ago you could tell took hours to make fresh, now tastes like it is out of a carton.    Our pasta dishes were delivered to the table unfinished.  As in, someone dumped penne into a bowl and then poured a tiny bit of sauce in the dead center.  Naked pasta is better left for a buffet line.  It was also grossly over cooked.  

One good thing is that Casa Di Amore still has really good entertainment.   Sadly, we won't be returning to this restaurant again.  We will drive the extra few miles to get better quality food, correct tables and elegant dining atmosphere at Allegro, Sinatra or Capos.

Came here for a last minute Valentines Day Dinner celebration.  We agreed to take the available 545p seating, when we arrived, we were asked to wait at the bar until our table was ready which is never a problem for us.  As soon as we took a seat at the bar, a young girl approached me and handed me a rose and small box of chocolate which was a nice, cute little touch.  Before we could even order a drink our table was ready.  We were seated in front of the stage where live music was playing classic lounge tunes.  Our server, Robert came by and asked us if it was our first time visiting.  We told him it was and he responded with, "this will be your new favorite restaurant"  He told us about some of the specialties and took our drink orders.  While we were waiting for our appetizer, fresh sourdough bread came to the table served with butter and a shaker of parmesean cheese.  The bread was warm and delicious.  Our calamari came next and the calamari was good but what really made it was the marinara sauce that it came with, we could've eaten the marinara by the spoonful.  I ordered a cup of pasta fagioli which was full of flavor and so comforting :)  Entrees came out soon afterwards, I ordered the frutti de mare pasta with red sauce and my boyfriend ordered the lobster/shrimp ravioli special.  I finished every last bite of my dish.  We saved room for dessert and ordered the cannoli (with complimentary t shirt) and had a vodka martini and baileys coffee while we waited for dessert.  The vodka martini was so good, nice and dirty, I would've ordered another but was starting to get a little tipsy so decided to make martini's at home instead.  What we got out of this dinner, was a great Valentines Day Dinner date, a feeling of old Las Vegas, great ambience, excellent food and service and a new favorite restaurant, I guess that's why their motto is, "Vegas, the way it used to be!  Leave the gun...take the cannoli"
We will come here everytime we come to Vegas or pass through. We loved everything! The food...the ambiance...TONY! Ask for his section...he's awesome!
Good garlic bread and lobster
Came here while visiting Vegas was looking for a good Italian restaurant ended finding a great Italian Restaurant! Everything from service to food to drinks was excellent a must try!
New favorite Vegas spot. Great food, great people and great music. Worth the drive. They treat you like family. Chicken parm is the way to go.

The food is amazing. Which is what keeps me coming back. However, I brought my fiancé to dinner tonight for his birthday and we were seated at a booth by the bar. The service was less than pleasing. After our main course, we were going to order dessert, but ended up not. We sat for 30 mins with empty glasses and no one even acknowledged we were still sitting there. We finally get asked if we want a dessert menu and at this point I am so annoyed, all I want is to leave. I don't think I will be coming back again no matter how good the food is. If you do come here, the food is not disappointing at all! It is truly delicious, but I don't recommend sitting in the booths by the bars if you want service.

This little jem is a classic!!! If you are in Vegas and want The Best Italian food search no more!!! This place is awesome! If you like spice the Gypsy sauce is what you want to add to any of your dishes. But the alfredo sauce and garlic loaf omg!!! AWESOME SAUCE!!! The service is 5 stars all the way. Very friendly staff!! Cheese ravioli's come 3 to a plate and are huge!!! I recommended getting them with alfredo sauce!!! Save room for coffee after as they are neighbors with the best Oregon coffee there is "Dutch Bros"!!! LoVe this place and will be back when I'm back in town. It's a must try while in Vegas!!!

I loved this place. If you want to try authentic Italian food, this is the place to go. They have live music which is so awesome. The place is really busy so it is a good idea to make the reservations in advance. I tried their specials, the seafood combo including lobster, crab, shrimp, and clams. It was really good.

Loved loved loved it here! The ambiance, the food, the people, everything!  It is very old school Italian, people even get up and sing along to the choruses of various popular songs when the singing duo comes out! The pasta was homemade and fresh. It was super busy but the waitress I had (Rochelle? Rebecca?) and the manager do everything they can to make you feel special and like you're the only one there! I truly loved the old school Italian ambiance however and all the Italian spirits and liquors. It's a great singles scene too, especially for the ladies as for once the men outnumbered the ladies by far!! My only regret is that I came here on the last night of my trip instead of the first!! Will be back again on my next trip to Vegas!!

I absolutely adore this place!!  I've visited this establishment with three different loved ones and have yet to have a single disappointment!  I took my mom here about a week ago for a dinner date and she said multiple times that the chicken parmigiana has to be the best she's ever had.  I definitely agree!  The price point is a little high, but comparable to other unique Italian dining experiences.  The portions are very big, and the food tastes just as good the next day after being heated up at home..  Whatever you do, have dessert!  I had this chocolate molten cake and my mom had the spumoni, both were equally amazing!

This is the real deal! Old Vegas. Wonderful homemade Italian cuisine. The live music is wonderful (thanks George!) with the sounds of the 50's. But if there is a request, they will do their best. We were celebrating my granddaughters 21st birthday and I was afraid that this place wasn't to her liking but she said she loved it! Not a big restaurant so be sure to make a reservation. A bit noisy but lively. The service was incredible. A little pricy but for the experience, it was well worth it. They also will pick you up in a limo and take you back to your hotel, complementary. I was told they are closing down next week for remodeling but will reopen with wonderful changes. I can't wait to go back. The only reason I'm not giving it 5 stars is because they picked us up in a new red van rather than a limo. When I told my waiter I was disappointed, he made sure we went back in the limo. The food.....amazing!

This place was recommended by our concierge when we stayed in Vegas and he was kind enough to get us a reservation (which I would definitely recommend doing).  Great off strip location and not hard to find.  It is a little on the loud side and very intimate.  No complaints on the food-it was incredible!  I hope to visit again if we get the chance.
Apparently the meatballs have pork in them now and we waited 40 minutes for our table so taking back stars.

Probably the best hometown Italian restaurant I've ever had! (And it's in Vegas!!!)

When you first find the place, it's sandwiched between a Dutch Bro's coffee house and a gun shop/range (very quaint location). Then when you walk in, you are transformed back in time, probably in New York around the 1960s or 1970s. A time where live music was happening, and the service was very personable. 

I went there with my boyfriend and his stepmom. We arrived around 6:30 pm or so and was seated immediately. Our waiter did some small talk with us, then got our drink order. I couldn't decide what to order so I did some more chatting with the waiter and asked for his recommendations. 

My bf stepmom ordered the Shrimp Scampi which she enjoyed very much. My boyfriend ordered their famous Baked Lasagna which was really delicious. The plus side of ordering the lasagna was that they gave more meat marinara sauce if you wanted more of it. (So all you meat marinara lovers have at it!) As for me, I got the Linguine Luciano which was so delicious! Their portion was huge! and I wanted to finish every bite of it but didn't have enough room in my stomach for it. I guess I shouldn't have gotten a cup of their Grandma's Famous Chicken Soup prior to my meal. However the soup was so good how could you not want to finish that???

Since it was my boyfriend's birthday weekend, the band played Happy Birthday for him and we got a Cannoli! Which was really good! 

Overall experience: service, setting, and food... 5 stars!!!
Totally will come back when I'm in Vegas and recommend anyone to come and eat there. Oh yeah... if you happen to be in town and you wanted to get to this place but don't have a car or don't want to drive. You could make a reservation prior to your visit and get complimentary limo service from them. (Something to think about.)

Happy Eating Everybody!

Okay, I'm gonna give them four, but there is a story behind this and its up and down. I planned a very romantic surprise weekend for the wifey in Vegas. I found this place and thought it would be fun with the live music, limo ride, and an escape from the touristy strip. Well, about 30 mins before we were supposed to be picked up I get a phone call indicating that the limo had broken down and we would have to catch a cab for which we would be reimbursed when we got there. This ruined the surprise and was barely apologized for and, if it wasn't already 8:45 on a friday night, I would've tried to get in somewhere else. After a very long and roundabout cab ride, we arrived and were told our table was not ready yet. 15 minutes later we were still waiting and very unhappy, so we told them we were leaving and they called a cab that they would be paying for. 

While sitting outside, the manager walked up and apologized for the inconvenience and the unapologetic rudeness of the extremely unprofessional hostess. He told us, "I don't want you to leave...not like this" in his best Pauly Cicero voice. He offered to take half off of our bill if we stayed, so we did. 

We ordered the hot antipasto sampler ($18) for two which was huge. There was plenty of fried mozarella, ravioli, shrimp and calamari. all of which were good, especially the ravioli! and the marinara, was like nothing I've had since being back in NY. I got the Dei Frutti Di Mare ($26) which was very good. The broth was pretty thin, as it should be, but had great flavor. I really enjoyed this one, lots of seafood. The wifey got the Pasta al Forno ($26), which I bitterly admitted was a little better than my dish, but whatever, they were both very good. 

The atmosphere is kind of old, Italian American, somewhat of a stale, used-to-be-filled-with-cigarette-smoke kinda smell. But, honestly if it was really bad, the wifey would not have stayed as she is very, very picky. It was very dark and the music was alright. It was old, Sinatra/rat packish covers from a mildly entertaining fellow that seemed to enjoy his job. It was alright. 

The best part was that the manager also slipped us a free entree gift card for a future visit and then they managed to get the limo up and running for our ride back. We did have to share with another couple, but only for the first half of the trip and they were very nice and friendly. the limo was very small and seemed like somewhat of a party limo type of thing, but it was still a nice touch. We might go back, but would make back-up plans in case the limos breaks down again. It is kinda off in the cut in a shadier area.

Casa Di Amore: Super Fun, Fantastic Food: "Old School Vegas"

Casa Di Amore: "Old School All The Way, Authentic Italian Pasta, 1950's style eatery" Even though this restaurant is off the strip and out of the way the food, friendly staff and old school atmosphere make it worth the trip. If you call well in advance they will pick you up from the strip and bring you back. The pasta dishes are better than anything I've ever had on the strip. I would prefer to spend an evening at Casa Di Amore than any restaurant on the Vegas strip, hands down the very best authentic Italian food and friendliest staff. The restaurant is recently renovated but none of the 1950's flair was lost, actually, it was enhanced. Can't say enough about the fun, relaxed atmosphere.

Last Visited June 2017
Great food and great atmosphere.  True Italian Chicago vibe. Already been there twice!

Someone pinch me because this was the BEST italian food I have ever had! Such an old school place and I can't believe how  many times I drove by it and never stopped in. It looks unsuspecting on the outside but goodness...the food is to die for! The marinara sauce is the stuff dreams are made of and the Eggplant di Amore? OH LAWD! I've gone to this place twice already and I will definitely be going again in the future.  Oh...and make sure you try the garlic loaf. AMAZEBALLS!

If you want something different in Vegas, try Casa di Amore. It's as authentic to Old Las Vegas as it gets. You can tell mobsters use to dine here. 

Here's my quick notes:

Osso Bucco - this is a very rich dish and it came with the bone marrow. Quite impressive.  

Cioppino - best fisherman stew ever. The only thing missing was pasta. 

Gnocchi - soft pillow but a bit salty with the prosciutto. 

Bruchetta - has a very fresh tomato taste to it. 

Bellisima Bellini - best I've ever had. 

Live music - Frank Sinatra reincarnated. No joke. 

Bottom line -  very cool place.

This was easily the best restaurant we ate at in Las Vegas. It was recommended to us by a couple that we met at breakfast one morning and I am so glad we tried it out. It was easy to get a reservation and they even provided transportation for us! You can't beat that. 
The service was phenomenal. Our waiter, Paul, really made the night special for us. There is live music there and you can even request songs to play, and of course our wonderful waiter made sure they played a song for us. Now, about the food.... wow is all I can say. I ordered the gnocchi special which came with beef tips, gorgonzola sauce and basil. It was exceptional. My husband ordered the Veal Parmesan and ate every bit of it. We also couldn't resist getting dessert so we had the cannoli and creme brûlée because they are both made in house (and you get a free t-shirt if you order one of these). Talk about melt in your mouth perfection! Needless to say, if you are in Las Vegas make sure you come here!!
I took my girlfriend there for our anniversary everything was great the service most importantly the food was amazing! My girlfriend is a picky eater and she loved it

Amazing atmosphere. The live musician was incredible, sounded just like frank Sinatra. The food was outstanding. We ordered most of the appetizers on the menu and I had chicken for my main entree and everything was outstanding!

They even have a complimentary limo service that can pick you up and take you anywhere you'd like afterwards.

I wish I would have knew about this place earlier!  I'm absolutely in love. It's such a great atmosphere as soon as you walk in. There's a cool tiki bar in back and the restaurant floor is so classic. There's live music, and the musicians are fantastic. Our server Blake was such a good host, treated us like a friend. It was our first time there and he gave us a detailed informative tour of the menu. Ordered the mini osso bucco and the spaghetti and meatballs. I highly suggest both and if it's only 2 of you you only need one pasta bowl, it's about a pound of pasta!!  Oh and the garlic loaf is a must. The osso bucco is over risotto and the spaghetti and meatballs were to die for. So much flavor in the meatballs. Definitely will be returning!  I love it here.

WOW. Thank you Yelper friends for referring us to such a gem. Absolutely a new favorite for us.
Came in this Friday evening to a full house complete with live performers. Being Vegas natives we really appreciated the atmosphere- odes to old Vegas Strip scenery and pop culture/entertainers. The noise level is a little on the loud side, but we actually enjoyed being able to carry on a conversation without worrying about being overheard or being too noisy. Everybody is too busy having a great time. And as busy as they were tonight, we were still seated within 10 minutes. Score.
No need for us to order any appetizers, as gratis fresh hot baked bread and butter was provided. Oh my yum. Who doesn't love a hot bread roll fresh out of the oven? So tasty, nonetheless. We helped ourself to another as soon as the first quickly disappeared from the table.
The gnocchi alla prosciutto was to die for. The cheesy sauce was light didn't overpower the taste of the prosciutto. A delicate touch of spinach was a perfect inclusion. And a perfectly sized portion for a hungry tummy! Boyfriend had the chicken parm with a side of meatballs, which were wonderfully tender and juicy. We finished our meal with a cannoli. It was baked just the way a cannoli should be done- toasted outside (not soft!), rich and thick cream on the inside. 
Staff was all incredibly friendly. Our meal was concluded with a visit from the manager who made sure our experience was to our liking and shook both our hands. I wish we could remember our server's name, he was awesome! Thank you all for such a great evening! We will definitely be back soon!

Totally nailed it! Took a shot in the dark with good reviews and being close to my hotel (way off the strip) 
Old school italian as advertised. This is a small free standing restaurant near the airport and when you walk in, you know its a long time joint. 

I ordered the baked clams as an appetizer and was blown away as to how fresh, hot and exactly like home they tasted. They were prepared perfectly and tasted fantastic. Yum.

Next up was linguine luciano, which was linguine and sauteed calamari in a fra diavlo marinara. I was in the mood for fried calamari, so i asked my server / bartender if they could do it fried. She checked and the answer was yes. Food came and it was a steaming hot, generous portion of fresh fried calamari and linguine in the perfect balance of fra diavlo sauce that was not sitting in a bed of liquid. Again, so perfect and tasted so east coast, i was in heaven.

Sat at the bar for my meal, listened to the nightly house jazz / sinatra band which was the perfect atmosphere for this place. I will be back!!!

Made a reservation for 8:15 for 2 and still wasn't sat til 10:30. By then we no longer wanted to stay. Loud and obnoxious atmosphere. Live music was awful. Osso buco sucked and so did the inattentive host Lisa. We left immediately after we were sat and went to CAPO'S on Sahara where the food was phenomenal and the (live) music was beautiful. Real Chicago Italian in a romantic setting, it was a perfect ending to my birthday dinner. I do not recommend casa di amore.

This is one of my favorite Italian restaurants. It has an old school mobster feel and great live music that plays all the old school favorites. We love the Pesto Pasta, chicken parmigiana and my sons favorite is the New York steak. Service is always great. We usually come for birthdays and they bring you a complimentary Canoli and sing Happy Birthday. Always a great time! Everyone should experience this place! I would highly suggest reservations because on the weekends they are packed and won't take walk-ins.

The worst meal that I ever had.
The bread was not fresh.
The baked macaroni was dry and tasteless.

Went here while on vacation, celebrating my husband's birthday and Valentines Day. It was wonderful. All the ladies got a rose and chocolates. The live music was so much fun and the food delicious. Service was perfect.

How do you alter the Yelp info on this restaurant that says "good for kids" because it needs to say "no" after we were turned away for having a baby. This place isn't called Casa Di Amore - it's called Casa Di Ashole. 

I came here with my parents, my husband, and my baby. The two hostesses working tonight (Friday 4/7) initially quoted us a 30 minute wait. In the 4 seconds it took us to decide that we would go for it, the bald burly black guy in a coat (general manager?) walked over and discreetly shook his head at the hostesses. 

Suddenly, the two girls were then telling us that they weren't taking walk ins. We were probably looking really confused because they back tracked and then said "well we would have to push two tables together because you have a baby". Literally being turned away because of my child. 

The manager stood there blankly staring at the hostesses making sure they do their job in sending us on our way. He did not even look at us. We turned around to walk out and one of the girls said "sorry! Try another night!" I think she felt bad but either way I'm highly annoyed and offended by our experience. 

We went to Sergio's down the street and it was AMAZING. Such great service and amazing Italian food.
Fantastic, authentic Italian cuisine.  The way Vegas used to be.

Went tonight for the first time for my daughters birthday. It was a party of 10. We were only allowed to pick one out of 4 entrees.
1. Spaghetti and meatballs 
2. Chicken Parmesan
3. Lasagna 
4. Fettuccine 
None were worth the $50 per person! Honestly, the Olive Garden is better! Pasta was bland ( marinara) and the chicken, although it was tender, there was so much mozzarella on it, that's all you could taste. The 20% gratuity was mandatory. I tip according to the food and server. I usually do tip that amount, but being told I had to really irks me! And spending $500 for mediocre food was ludicrous! Won't go back. Being of Italian descent I admit I'm picky, but even the others were not happy with their food.

Better than 4 stars, but definitely not 5.

Overall, I liked this place a lot.  Chicken parm was very good.  They have something called gypsy sauce which is a spicy marinara.  It was great.  Tasted the veal parm which was very good.  The shrimp phyllo appetizer was just OK.  Desert was a great cannoli!

Here we have another Las vegas classic, it's time to venture off the Las vegas Strip for that off beat hidden gem. I don't think you can go wrong with anything on the menu. The pork chops I will say were top notch. The service is also very good, and in Las Vegas that is not a given, there a couple of places that think that just because they have been here fora while that they can treat you like dirt (I think we all know who i am talking about.) Skip them and their bellow average food and come to Cassa Di Amore. Live it up you are in Las Vegas for cryin' out loud!

The service and atmosphere was very nice, almost 5 stars I would say! The sad part was that we had a reservation at 8pm and did not get sat until almost 9:30pm. At least there was an area in the back we could wait in, but we did not understand why there would be an outdoor tiki themed bar at an old-school Italian restaurant. Did not make much sense. I was so excited to take my family from out of town here as I heard many locals rave over it. The loud vibe was really fun and nice. The wait staff was not the best, as I had to check many times on our table and once it was already ready and they had not came to get us. The live music was really old school, but kinda crappy. I was so excited about the food as I heard amazing things. The appetizers were good, bruschetta and calamari. We then proceeded to order and our waiter told my sister that the Gypsy pasta was a 12/10 for deliciousness, not spiciness. We all eat very spicy food regularly, but the pasta she was given was not edible whatsoever and posed a risk. We asked for marinara sauce to help make it less spicy, but even with 3 cups of sauce, it was still too spicy to eat and not enjoyable whatsoever. The lasagna and cioppino were solid, not amazing. What was most disappointing was my Steak Flambe. The waiter recommended it to me and said it was his favorite dish and described it as a Steak Diane sauce, so I proceeded to order it. Everyone's food came out before mine, so I was waiting for the table side flambe service as a Steak Flambe is generally prepared. A few minutes later, I got a plate of food that looked like something a rookie eater would be served when ordering a steak at a crappy breakfast diner. The steak was cooked to my liking, but it was extremely rubbery and had no flavor. The sauce was no Diane at all, it was almost worse than a Salisbury steak sauce. Absolutely horrible for $35. The twice baked potato was horrendous, and I could have had a better one at a fast food restaurant. Same with the veggies, nothing impressive. All in all, I was extremely disappointed which really sucks because I was sooooo excited to try this place after recently moving into the area. Probably will not be back. Hopefully you have a better experience!

DELICIOUS. Honestly, some of the best food I've ever tasted. My friend got the Steak Sinatra, the BEST sauteed mushrooms and steak next to Mon Ami Gabi in the Paris. The martinis---go for the Italian Gatorade, don't get a Manhattan--up. Just DONT do it, tastes like bootyhole. 

As far as service, everyone was more than friendly, the band noticed each and every customer. Ask for Michael, he took impeccable care of us and recommended each of our meals.

This is my favorite place to eat of all restaurants I have ever tried. The atmosphere is fun. Go with a date and it's romantic. Go with friends and it's fun. Host a group of people and it's even more fun! Can be snuggled in a booth or take over the center of the place with your group. Can sit up at the small bar too. The waiters have always been what seem to be handsome Italian men and the most fun servers. This place reminds me of a venue that would be in a mob movie. Has live talented music. 
The food is some of the best I have tasted. The Garlic Loaf is to die for! Alfredo is my favorite. And the limo ride to and from the restaurant is complimentary with a tip to the driver.
FOOD ALLERGY- I was planning a small party here and they offered to get special ingredients so all who had food allergies could enjoy the food.

Hands down the best dinner/ bang for your buck! We called and got a reservation and they cane and picked us up in a limo! The four was absolutely fabulous! The meatballs were melt in your mouth! The chicken parm was to die for! Service was outstanding! Can not say enough good things to say about the place! Make a reservation they are full every night. Price was spot on.

Everything we ate was amazing, the ambiance was very old Vegas. Has a 2 pc band playing lounge music and taking request. Not cheap but definitely get what you pay for. Service was impeccable. The eggplant lasagna was like nothing I had ever tasted, cheesy and crispy

The best Osso Bucco I have ever had. My wife had the Ciopino and said it was the best since 15 years ago in Conneticut. Our waiter Tony was great, Sam picked us up in the tips only limo.  Half price wine on Sunday.  Old Vegas style, I sure wish this place was back home. I will be back every time we return!

This place is packed and loud. Service was good but when I got the balsamic and oil, the oil was obviously cut with water by 50 percent. The lasagna was good however., but there's not much flavor. Everything is made with cheap produce.

I finally got to try this place out - after having wanting to have gone my past two trips to Vegas.

Res. at 8:30 on a Friday night and the limo was available for pickup at Mirage.  Dunno how we lucked out, but we did.

Well, we weren't seated til 9:15 or so.  This was a little ridiculous.  Fortunately we chatted up a few others around the bar.

Other than that, everything went well.  The vibe is nice, but the dude they had singing was a bit much.

Our waiter was outstanding.  This is what service should be like in the most expensive city in the US to eat in.  We (5 guys) did an order of mushrooms and calimari to start off with.  Mushrooms were great and the calimari was THE best i've had, to date.

Dinner comes and my veal parm is great.  a lil pricey at $30, but it was also the best I've had.  The cheese was melted perfectly - starting to turn brown to give that extra little crisp.

Our limo driver was ok at best.  He didn't really say much of anything even tho I tried shooting the shit with him when he picked us up.  But, for a free ($15 tip) cab ride I didn't complain.

Worth a stop if the limo is available.
The service was amazing I really recommend it for pizza with the special hot sauce that they provide  and the egg plant Parmesan

I've now been here 3 times and it's been awesome each time! A free limo ride to & from the strip, good service, great atmosphere and amazing Italian food...I look forward to visiting Casa di Amore every single time I'm in Vegas!!!
What a great little gem.  Wanted to find a place with live music and great food.  The musician they had was perfect, love the old Vegas vibe.

Great food and atmosphere. There was a terrific lounge bad who did some super songs from the 70s.
Chicken parm and Caesar were great!

Since we were planning to be in Vegas for the Rascal Flatts concert at Hard Rock, and having the idea of trying somewhere new for dinner, I made a reservation at this place for my BF and I after reading the good reviews. 

Firstly, they arranged to have their limo come pick us up from the hotel right at 4:45p for a 5:00p reservation - nice. The driver was right on time! The drive over to the restaurant was a little longer than anticipated (I had mapped it out at only 3 miles from the hotel) but apparently there was major construction underway on Trop so he had to go an alternative route to avoid that. He gave us a heads up before we arrived that they were in the process of remodeling the restaurant - oh ok. 

As we walked in, there were a few tables already occupied but, upon being seated for a few minutes, we realized it was DEAD quiet. Strangely no music (I had envisioned old Blue Eyes crooning in the background as we were sipping our wine and looking at the historic Vegas photos on the walls). Our server informed us that because of the construction, their music system was disconnected. That definitely reduced the "ambiance" factor, but about 15 or 20 minutes in, their live music duo started to play oldies. I enjoyed it, but my BF thought it was cheesy LOL.

Anyway, on to the menu - many choices from chicken to meat to pasta! We ended up ordering bruschetta and a simple salad to start, the mussels appetizer, and 1 lb. of spaghetti (yes a whole pound - we've never seen that anywhere!) with pomodoro. The bruschetta was awesome, the spaghetti was pretty decent, and the mussels dish was nice as well (mostly because of the yummy sauce) although they were the big green lip - I prefer the smaller ones.

We were pretty full so decided to pass on dessert (didn't want to be falling asleep at the concert). By the time we finished, we were right on time to get with our driver again for the drive back to Hard Rock. Smooth sailing, tipped driver and bid him farewell.

Overall, it was an enjoyable meal but we definitely came at an awkward time because of the remodeling. I think I'd like to return to this off-the-beaten-path restaurant after the expansion is complete to get a more accurate experience. I actually may return next month when my Mom and I will be there for a 2-night getaway. Saluti!

Came here with a group because they provide free limo service from the casino resorts.  Go back in time with old fashioned homestyle red sauce Italian cuisine in huge portions, with a crooner singing Frank Sinatra songs on a PA system, and pictures of the 1960's strip as atmosphere. This is not modern Italian cuisine. However, prices are not 1960's.  $11 for one small canole - but, as the waited points out, you get a free T-shirt with a quote from the Godfather on the back (even if you don't want it). I thought the prices were way too high for the mediocre quality. There are better Italian restaurants in LV - even ones of this type (like Bootleg Bistro).
Amazing restaurant. Amazing food. Amazing entertainment. Amazing ambiance. I would highly recommend anyone to visit casa di amore. It's so beautiful and intimate. Very old vegas

This place is top notch.  The food never disappoints, but what makes this place special is the staff.  The servers are absolutely outstanding!  The music made our night so enjoyable.  Randy Thomas is so talented and really engages with the crowd.  He played a lot of favorites.  The place was jumpin.'  It was like eating dinner with a huge italian family.  This is a must anytime you are in Vegas.

Where can you get a fabulous Italian dinner at 12am when in Vegas? At Casa Di Amore!  After a night on Fremont Street a group of six of us took a Lyft to this fantastic place.  Time has stood still in this place. The walls are decorated in pictures of Frank Sinatra,  Dean Martin, Sammy Davis Jr., Joey Bishop, Marilyn Monroe and many more. Lovely Italian music fills the room. It's funny how these song are so recognizable when you hear them. There was also a tiki bar out back that we all ventured out to see when we spotted the giant gorilla. We finally all got settled into our booth ready for our midnight feast. The menu is everything Italian you can imagine. We got garlic cheese bread, lasagna, giant raviolis, fettuccine and one pound pasta bowls!  We ate until we could eat no more. The food was fresh and tasty. The staff were so friendly and fun. I saw a small stage where the band plays nightly. Oh how fun that would be to see. I felt like I was in the Moonstruck movie eating dinner with the Castorini's.
Tony was amazing, the oso bucco is the best in Vegas hands down with a risotto that leaves you wanting more!
This place is awesome always was. always will be. it's a little taste of New York.       old-school. good food good waitresses and waiters.
Wonderful food. Great atmosphere.  Live music a plus.  The limo driver was THE BOMB.  Should advertise this place!
Its Always Great!  Especially the chippino.. My God!  DELICIOUS! osso Buco calamari bread basket  is also Delicious
First time visit tonight. Food was very good. Prices reasonable. Great live music. Service excellent.  Old school Vegas restaurant. Worth leaving the Strip for.

I had the baked mostaccoli and my girlfriend had the pasta al forno. I have to say pasta is my favorite food and it's tough to disappoint me, but we were disappointed. 

The noodles were slightly overcooked and the pasta al forno had no sauce in it. It was a pool of grease. 

After seeing the photos on Yelp I have decided to go back and try some other dishes before giving up on them. We also had the calamari which was also a mediocre 3 stars. For the price we definitely wouldn't relive this meal, but we'll try them again.

The live music bumped my review up to a 3, otherwise this would be a 2.

Called at 5pm to make a 830 reservation on a Friday night and was told it should not be a problem.  This place is awesome I was here on my 5th anniversary with my Lady and we ended up getting a table right in front of the musicians and it was amazing.  I wish they would have kept playing non stop but I understand that they need to pace themselves and give people time to chit chat.  Great service friendly place I wish I lived closer I would come at least once a month.  Thank You for a wonderful night!

My wife is a cookbook author and food critic / blogger - so we eat out at fancy restaurants at least once or twice a week, and are very critical of the places we go.  As we are always eating out and looking for another hidden gem for her to write about, we tend not to frequent any restaurant unless it is way better than average.

I proposed to my wife at this restaurant almost 5 years ago, and it is incredibly rare if we are at Casa less than once or twice in a month.  The drinks are good, the wine list is acceptable (with half price bottles on Sunday and Monday), the food is SPECTACULAR, and the service is impeccable.  We have never had a bad meal here.

We have dubbed this place "The Mob Joint," as the atmosphere is very "Old Vegas."  The decor is straight out of 1960's Vegas, and the brick walls are lined with pictures from the days of Frank and Sammy.  The booths and tables (lined in white linen) are dimly lit, with a romantic ambiance, and the place is just fabulous.  Their nightly entertainment is usually George, who sounds a lot like a young Frank Sinatra, and does a lot of fabulous old crooner tunes, interspersed with some comedy, some show tunes and some Billy Joel.  He is amazing.

The twice wrapped prawns that everyone here seems to be complaining about are great, wrapped in cheese and then baked in a puff pastry dough.  I think that the salty of the shrimp and cheese mixed with the slight tangy of the dough plays really, really well against the super-sweet of the caramel sauce.  (and we save the caramel sauce to drizzle over the ice cream at the end of the meal)  I like this dish quite a bit, though we don't order it every time.  What we DO order every time is their cheese garlic loaf and a side dish of Alfredo sauce for dipping.....Oh My GOD there is nothing quite so sinful.  You simply MUST try it.

Their steaks and stuffed pork chops are what we usually order, and they are beyond superb.  Their Osso Bucco is the best I've ever had.  It is so tender it literally falls from the bone.  The Vodka Shrimp is incredible as well.  Over the years, we've had most of the pasta dishes on the menu and have never been disappointed. 

Their prices are on the high side, but nothing that I wouldn't expect to pay at any of the restaurants of this caliber in Vegas.  For us, with a (half price) bottle of wine, the bread loaf, an appetizer to share, side Caesar salads, our meals, and a shared ice cream treat, our bill usually runs about $125 - $150, which is what we generally spend any time we go out for a really nice dinner - and with their portions, we always have some left over for lunch the following day.

My only minor complaint about this place is that their desserts are less than spectacular, as they are currently pre-made off-site. I do love that the waitstaff are all willing to be honest about the desserts they like, and which to avoid (my wife ordered a creme brulee once, and our waiter leaned down and said with a meaningful look, "I would really recommend the Chocolate-Peanut-Butter Bomba...The creme bruleee is, well, not what you would expect."). 

Fortunately, the last time we were there the Maitre D' mentioned that they were bringing on a pastry chef in the very near future, so now the only problem will be saving ROOM for dessert!

Overall, if you are looking for that perfect little hole in the wall, that will give you the true old Vegas kind of experience, Casa Di' Amore will deliver in a big way.  Oh, and if you call in advance, They even offer complimentary limo service from/to any of the hotels on The Strip!

Totally authentic Italian food!!  The limo driver was fantastic and the Frank Sinatra singer was great.  We had a group of ten and were taken care of like we were family.  I had the veal piccata and was pleasantly surprised.  The cannoli was fantastic and my husband's birthday was celebrated by all!!!
Every time I go here the place is packed.  Wonderfully decadent dishes, live music, good wine, and old school feel.

Not only was the food excellent, the atmosphere was great! The service was amazing!! I couldn't of asked for a better place to take to take an out of state guest for a great meal and casual entertainment!

I drove by this place so many times and I finally ate here! It's very cute and small. Inside the restaurant it's "old Vegas" decor with a live band. Attracts the older crowd, but I love enjoying authentic Italian food in a family owned kinda restaurant. The staff was very friendly, and the guy who performed had an amazing Frank Sinatra kinda voice...my kinda jam.  I got the Osso Buco (veal on a bed of risotto rice---very tasty) paired with an awesome glass of Chocolate Shop red wine--which was a sweeter kind of red wine. Great place if you want a little something nicer than Olive Garden with a twist of Vegas authenticity!

What an amazing atmosphere!! You feel like you're a mobster in a movie like Casino or Goodfellas. 
The food is amazing and the service was unbelievable!! Brad was our waiter and was awesome!! He made sure to explain all the dishes, recommendations and even took the initiative to take a picture of the group without us asking!  
The music was great with one singer sounding exactly like Frank Sinatra!!! 
The restaurant is great for everyone from young professionals to senior citizens!! 
This restaurant was such a great time that we didn't even know we were there for 3 hours!!
They also provide limo rides from the strip and back which makes you feel like a high ranking boss.
I'm from Vegas but whenever I have friends come in from out of town I'm making it my mission to have dinner at Casa Di Amore!!
Also, if you order the creme brûlée or cannolli they give you a tshirt that has the famous Godfather quote "leave the gun...take the cannolli" which is awesome.
My wife and I can't wait to come back!!!

We were in Vegas for 5 days. On the last night we decided to eat outside the strip, away from the hotels and malls. We found this lovely place on yelp. It was exactly as I read in the reviews, great ambience, and tasty food. The service was fabulous! Don't hesitate to oh there but book ahead.

We took customers to Casa Di Amore tonight for dinner. Tony was our waiter and he was amazing. The food was on point and more importantly our customers had a good time..... However do not take the Limo.... The driver was RUDE... There was apparently a mix up of some kind and we were suppose to share the limo... Taking customers out we declined to "share" being late and not wanting to be a shuttle with multiple drop off's... The driver was rude and lectured us on our decision not to share... He argued with us... I still tipped him well for a 5min drive but in hindsight I would not have tipped him at all.

Wonderful food, music, ambiance, and great service! Our waitress welcomed us, especially after hearing this was our first visit. She checked on us several times to ensure we had everything we needed and our drinks were refilled. The musician singing the classics sounded Ike Sinatra. We WILL be back!  

Started with the Arancini (rice and cheese balls) with a nice, big, gooey, cheesy center, and ossobuco over risotto. The ossobuco was flavorful and smooth.  The garlic cheese bread had cheese in the center and was delicious with the spaghetti sauce from the Arancini. 

The chicken Parmesan was tasty with a nice melty layer of cheese. Couldn't finish it all but really wanted to. The fettuccine alla Pappasito (2 kinds of sausage) was smooth and satisfying. Now, it's time to roll home and go to sleep with a happy and full stomach.

Only gave it 4 stars because they used to be open for lunch, and this was our favorite lunch spot -- but no more.

Dinner is great, and I agree with other reviewers that the music can be overbearingly loud at times to the point that you have to yell at the people you're dining with for them to be able to hear you.

The Fettuccine Alfredo with Lobster is out of this world good, and so is the Linguine with clams.

Small Italian restaurant with a big heart.  Full bar with plenty of seated waiting area. Call ahead for reservations and for free pick-up/drop off limo service.  We went on a Sunday nite (packed) which had live music playing rat pack inspired songs. The chicken dishes were phenomenal, especially the Chicken Florentine and Chicken Marsala.  I had the Linguine with clams (white)....AWESOME!  We were too full to have dessert but the next table over ordered what looked like a chocolate/vanilla delectible...shoulda moved over to take a spoonful. Downside? had to wait just a bit for our table but it was worth it.  The environment is much what you would want a small, dark, hole-in-the-wall type of place to be, serving great food, great drinks, and having a manager care about the service you're receiving.  I would definitely go again!

My husband and I went because we wanted to get off the strip (i.e. lower prices for a 4 day trip!) and enjoy some delish Italian food. 

Casa di Amore is your spot - they offer to pick you up in a limo and then you take a step back in time. 

We ordered the chicken parm & it was amazing - must order whenever you go to this restaurant! It is the perfect combo of chicken, cheese and sauce. yummm :)

Also, their drinks are very reasonable at about $8 each. If you are a bit of a wine snob, you may want to bring your own bottle and pay the super reasonable corkage. :)

All in all, great experience & would highly recommend!
Classic old style Las Vegas. Very good food and very good service. This is off the strip and not the easiest to get to, but well worth the trip.

Geez I so want to give these guys 5 stars but I just can't. Regardless of short comings, I do highly recommend this place. It pays homage to old Vegas in a very special way which makes it worth it. On the bad side, our limo to the restaurant had no AC, our waiter forgot about us after our entree was served and it was quite expensive for what it was BUT, the 2 man band made it totally worth while.
Great place nostalgic of old Vegas.  I should say the pasta much more tasty than the steak.  Great veal parmigiana .  Free limo..what else can I say?

Went here the other night with three others after finding it on Yelp, we all loved it!  We were picked up by the free limo service, on time, and taken to the restaurant.  Great vibe and energy in the restaurant, and the chicken parmasean was one of the best I've ever had.  This place is so much better than just about all of the overpriced places on the strip.  Some of them are worth it, but if you're in town for a weekend, I'd definitely mix in this old school place one of the nights.  Only thing I didn't really care for was the canole; the creme brule was amazing though.

We really enjoyed this hidden gem. We took friends and were shocked at how classically Vegas it is once you enter! 
My friend had the Chicken Angelo, which was perfectly seasoned and tender. Her man had the ravioli which were fresh and tasty. 
I enjoyed the Gnocchi with four cheese sauce. I'm a huge cheese fan and this touched all of my buttons. The gnocchi was freshly made and the sauce complimented it perfectly!
My husband got the Fruite del Mare. It was perfectly prepared. The seafood was fresh and tender. It was incredibly tasty.
We topped off this feat with both the tiramisu and cannoli. The tiramisu was excellent. The cannoli was on par like the freshest I ate in Italy!

We last dined at this old style southern Italian restaurant in 2005.  We each ordered chicken angelo - mushrooms, olives, and artichokes in a lemon butter sauce plus complimentary cups of chicken pastina soup.  The soup was okay, but the chicken angelo fell a little south of mediocre
A surprisingly good "find" at a location where you wouldn't expect such a nice place.  The staff was very accommodating & efficient.  Food was good, a very upscale armosphere.

When Ruben and I get together with one of our group of friends (dubbed the "Eight-some"), someone else always plans the dinner, so we are just along for the ride. We came here last Friday night and definitely needed that reservation. The restaurant is small and there's practically no waiting area/lobby, so the hostess stand is very crowded. Our table was in the middle of the restaurant, right next to the bar, kitchen, and two-man band. Luckily, the booth seat is tall, so our view of the bar and kitchen were blocked.

Everyone enjoyed the complimentary bread and particularly the garlic butter that accompanied it. Ruben and I shared the Fried Calamari ($16) served with marinara and a side Caesar Salad ($3 with entree). Ruben ordered Pasta Alla Forno ($30) created with penne, chicken, shrimp, broccoli, and mushrooms in a light pink sauce, then baked in the oven with fresh mozzarella. While I had their Baked Lasagna ($21) filled with marinara, fresh ricotta, ground beef, Italian seasonings, and melted mozzarella. The calamari was good (didn't make my top 5 though) and I liked their marinara. The Pasta Alla Forno was very delicious! Great flavor and the shrimp was especially good. Although, very expensive for a dish of pasta. The lasagna was all right, borderline meh.  Way too much cheese and not enough sauce. It was really difficult for me to eat (I ate less than half). One of our friends ordered Tiramisu and I thought it was decent.

The band was really great! Very talented gentleman and I loved the music they played. The only thing was that with our big group, we couldn't talk to each other much since one end of the table was directly next to the band. Service was really great. Everyone was great, nice, and attentive. The restaurant has a really nice atmosphere and exemplifies "Old School Vegas." It's definitely a cool spot to check out. As far as Italian food goes, it was just okay and not worth the cost.

FYI: Great for families - we had an 8-month old with us and it wasn't too loud or rowdy for her. Also, the automatic gratuity is 20% for groups of 6 or more.
The way old Vegas used to be . Great service ! Great steak !! Come in and call for reservations it is busy !!

I came here on the recommendation of people I know that have said this place was awesome and a great date night place to go to...but sadly my experience sucked i made a reservation for 730 it took around 30-45 min to get seated even after making a reservation a week ahead, the place was super loud with the live
Music which made it hard to try and hold a conversation with my wife but I should of done my research on that part so that was on me. The food was okay my wife liked hers a lot, as for me the linguine with clams was ehhh..hopefully this was just a bad first experience and later if we ever go here again it mate turn into a great one but as for now it wasn't the romantic outing I hoped for or planned for

Went here this past Thursday night around 10pm. Reserved the limo to pick us up from the Strip. He was early and it was perfect because we were hungry, free limo ride was awesome.  The place is cute, decor was inviting and i liked the setup. Four of us came her to check out the place (first timer's) was thinking of maybe booking it for a dinner reception after our wedding next year. We all shared two entree's (cus it was pretty late to be eating Italian food) and two side salads and bread. The lasagna was really yummy, we ordered some chicken dish i cant remember the name but none of us cared for it the chicken was a little dry, but the pasta it was served with was good.  The entertainment was alright not as exiting as all the other yelp'ers made it come across. Maybe we came too late?? Anyways we will be back, but i don't think we will be booking our dinner reception here afterall, only because it is away from the Strip and i think i would prefer more of a banquet hall facility.
Our waiter Tony boy was great. He was super nice and informative. What an awesome guy! The food was amazing. The desert was delicious. I highly recommend this place. 5 stars easily
Classic Las Vegas at it's best! Experienced and friendly staff prepared to guid you and enhance your dining. The food is spot on and generous. A must for every visit to Vegas

With 8 guys our here on a golf trip we can always stay on the strip and eat in the hotels upper echelons type places but being adventurous we always try some local places with flavor.  Off we go to this highly reccomended place where locals go to feel old style Vegas with pictures of the rat pack everywhere and a two piece jazz combo play nightly songs from the days gone by.  

Arrive and don't know what I was expecting as far as ambiance but it is really nothing much as far as esthetics go here.   Seated a long table and can see this is a problem as the normal tables for 2 persons they have 3 tables for 8 of us having 1/2 the guys on table corners and all squished together.  After a little prodding and the fact we were ready to leave we are moved to a table / booth large enough to accommodate us. Not a good start.   A lot of Vegas locals and kids? At 8PM on a Thursday night.  From gym shorts to nice outfits is the motiff while the majority of the place looks like they just left LA Fitness.  Nice restaurant put on a pair of jeans and get rid of the cutoff sleeveless shirt for god sake. 

Wine list is in short Awful. No Value whatsoever, no variety of any substance, what is there has no vintages and anything worth wild is completely overpriced.  Order some wine which takes forever to arrive as hot fresh bread with garlic butter is provided. 

Menu is large, diverse and very good looking hope the food makes up for the other issues.  On we go to the food. 

Salads Cold Antipasto for 2 $20.00 good, with some meats and cheeses but no top shelf cold cuts here.  For $20.00 you some Procuitto would be nice. 

Cesar was pedestrian 

$11.00 Stuffed Pepper with meat and cheese, marinara and rice was absolutely Fantastic best meal on the table. 

$5.00 sausage and peppers side as an appetizer was delicious 

$14.00 shrimp wrapped in Procuitto then baked in filo dough was a don't order again appetizer. 

$18.00 Lobster Raviloli were good. 

$11.00 Spinach Salad with Honey dressing as good as it gets. 

Entrees: 

Veal Osso Bucco $43.00 over Risotto with sauce was truly a work of art. (3 of those were consumed) 

Basic Chicken Parm was good certainly better options on this menu. 

Veal Marsala was fresh tender and tasty as was the Veal Francais. 

Seafood Frutte di Marre in White sauce was fantastic, fresh and full of taste. 

Stuffed Pork Chops with Procuitto and mozerella were good but not great though the brandy cream Sauce on top was delicious. 

Note both bottles of wine were absolutely awful. 

Service was OK nothing spectacular while the little band did entertain us with music during our 2 hour meal. 

All and all not pricey and food was good to very good. Service was average and atmosphere in my opinion was a little lacking.   

All and all a good experience, and certainly may visit again if local, but for 8 guys used to the finer things in life, I certainly believe we can find better venues.

Tried the Gypsy pasta. Very spicy, but if you can take it, taste very good. Friendly service, complementary picture and live music. Baked lasagna was really good and cheesy, goes well with the bread. Excellent desserts, I recommend the exotic bomba and tiramisu cake.

We came here for the first time to celebrate our anniversary! It was exactly what we hoped for! Great atmosphere, live music, wonderful service and very delicious food. Small place with a locals feel. We went on a Wednesday and it was busy so make a reservation and try it! You won't be disappointed!!!!
Amazing environment,  great live music,  and delicious Italian food. A great date night cozy place for two or 15 people.
Can't say enough about this place.  Had dinner here on 5/11/13, and it was wonderful. Try the Cioppino, it is Excellent.

Over priced I was in shock to see the new menu prices the quality of food was ok but no cigar spaghetti and meatball $23 dollars cut me a break and everything is ala cart The restaurant parking is difficult and doesn't seem safe Will not go back

I had heard such positive things about this place, so I had to check it out. Let me just say that it was very good! The food was delicious and the wine our server recommended was perfect. The service and the ambience was even better than I expected. It's such a charming place! I would highly recommend going here for a 
nice Italian dinner.

8pm on a Saturday night and only had about a 5 minute wait for the table. Excellent old Vegas atmosphere complete with a singer/pianist and drummer. Our waiter was friendly and let us know he was in no hurry to rush us, so we had a leisurely 2 hour meal, one of the best I've had in town this year. The chianti was a great selection paired with our meals. We had a basket of fresh bread brought to our table. For an app we had the prosciutto crostini ... Delicious. I had lasagna and my date had gnocchi. We both loved out food, and I have to say my lasagna was like no other I've ever had. We took 2 cannoli to go, but haven't had yet.

I would absolutely come back. It was a pricey meal but the quality made it worth it for a special occasion or an "impress your date" night.

FYI Monday is 1/2 price bottle of wine night!

LOVE LOVE LOVE IT  if it's not right they will make it right and probably give you a free t-shirt too! I worked their AMAZING SUPERBOWL party this year. (not at the tiny resturant) and that too was awesome!!!
a place to laugh enjoy old school Vegas and some lounge style dinner music

We came here for my niece's 21st birthday on 2/28 and it was AMAZING! The atmosphere was perfect and the waiter went above and beyond to make sure we had a great experience. The live music during our dinner was awesome and they even sang happy birthday to my niece. The food was to die for and I'm already counting the days until I can make it back to Vegas to eat here again. They also offer free limo service to people staying on the strip which made it even more worth it. There's no excuse not  to go here while you're in Vegas. Make your reservation now!! You won't regret it.

Come for the live entertainment! Great singers while we visited late at night. They also offer a limo pick up from your hotel if you reserve in advance.

The food unfortunately was JUST ok. Ravioli is oversized and a little doughy, but tasty. Order in the blush/vodka sauce which is better than the Alfredo. We tried both.

Caprese was disappointing. The tomatoes looked like they were winter tomatoes (pale!!!) not summer tomatoes (red!!!). Not sure why since we came in the middle of June and this place is in Vegas.

The lasagna was 100% mushy in each layer and was unappetizing. We had to send this back sadly. Also disappointing since this is a very popular dish and we would expect for it to be spot on!

Atmosphere here is divey, dark, and a little tacky with colorful lights near the bar. It seemed like they have gimmicks to get you in and have a great time (wonderful music, limo ride) but the food is just ok.

Service was excellent. Our server took care of us and didn't hassle us about the lasagna. They were packed on a late weekday night and getting our food took a while.

My husband is a steak snob.  We have tried almost every steak from the strip and back.  He said his ribeye was the BEST that he had had since moving to Vegas!  Very lively crowd.  Great "OldVegas" style lounge singer.  Would recommend reservations if going on a Saturday night.  Wait staff ULTRA attentive!  All over a five star experience!!

Went to Casa di Amore for my pre-60th birthday dinner based on Yelp and Trip Advisor reviews.  We weren't disappointed.  Not in the best of neighborhoods, but well worth the trip.  They do provide limo service but I was too late to request  the service.  Highly recommend Gnoochi and Prosciutto.  Quite honestly, the main courses ordered at our table were all great!  If you want live entertainment, get there after 7pm. Otherwise they have CD's playing of old time Sinatra, Tony Bennett and others.  Would absolutely go back again!

came here last week around 330pm only to find out they have new hours..  'open 24 hours' on the huge sign outside.. but 'new hours 4pm...' on the paper on the door. booooo! i couldnt wait.. so i came back on friday. (thats why i knocked off a star).. anyway..

started off with bruschetta and fried ravioli. the tomato on the bruschetta was sooooo refreshing..juicy.. the italian bread was perfectly toasted.. and the cheese was fresh. fried ravioli was not too crispy and the cheese oozed out when you took a bite.. no cardboard tasting ravioli here.. it was good even without the marinara sauce!

i had the fettucine ala moro d'venezio. fettucine pasta with sliced and crumbled sausage with a four cheese sauce... need i say more? the pasta was tasty with all that cheese but the sausage left me speechless. i love sausage.. but not when its too salty. and this was the best sausage i've had in a while... *drool*... the leftovers were even better....

i love the atmosphere in here. friday night... there was a duo singing sinatra among other old vegas style icons.. my friend requested 'young at heart' and got lei'd! lol.. she was summoned to the stage as she sang along and got lei'd... how fun is that! you just gotta bere here to know what im talking about! dim lighting with cushiony booths and a bar in the middle so you dont feel too stuffy in the 'house of love'.. kind of throws it off a bit..but i like it =)

Decided to go here based on reviews on Trip Advisor (instead of my original choice of Batista's Hole In The Wall), plus the Restaurant.com certificate, plus the fact they pick you up in a limo if you make reservations over the phone far enough in advance was what helped us make the decision to eat at Casa Di Amore. 

I arranged to have the limo pick us up at the Rio after "The Rat Pack Is Back" show (after the meal, he returned us to the hotel we were staying at, the Flamingo). Neither my mom or I had ever had a limo ride, so this was a good treat. The driver was nice and very chatty.

When we got inside Casa Di Amore, the hostess took my name but acted like I hadn't made a reservation. Although it was Mother's Day, it was a Sunday night, at 10pm, and it was not busy, several tables were empty, but we still had to wait about 10 minutes. The entertainment was just packing up, so we missed that completely :-/

Our waiter (I think his name was Bradley) was not very nice, in fact, he was a bit of a jerk. He was really short with us the entire time, and made several rude remarks to me.I think he saw my Restaurant.com certificate, and every restaurant we went to on this trip and used one of these, we got poor service from the waitstaff (which is ironic since they are guaranteed a bigger tip with one of these certificates)

I have a lot of indigestion issues, and basil doesn't agree with me, so when at Italian restaurants I always order regular spaghetti w/ marinara sauce. I've never had an issue. But, this sauce had large strands of basil, as well as small chopped pieces of it. Also, the portion was puny, maybe about 1 cup of cooked noodles.

My mom got spaghetti w/ meat sauce and meatballs. Her plate had a HEAPING portion of food. I know she had meat sauce and meatballs, but there really shouldn't have been that big of a difference between our portion sizes. 

Anyway, I notice all the basil on my food and immediately start the long process of picking it out with my fork. I haven't even taken a bite when the waiter noticed and asks how our meal is, my mom asks him if they have a sauce w/o so much basil, even asks for the sauce from the kids menu, but he tells us this is their plainest sauce. He then tells me that he can swap it out for something else, but what else is there if this is their plainest sauce? 

I go on, and try to eat my spaghetti. I take a bite, and follow it with several gulps of water. My mouth HURTS. In the next 15 minutes I go on to take 3 more bites, but each one is more excruciating than the next. I feel like my lips are on fire. Waiter comes up to us again and asks how everything is, and I tell him I just cannot eat the food in front of me. 

He tells me, "you should have said something when I asked earlier." He pointed to my food, which originally was just about 1 cup of cooked noodles and I had only eat 4 small bites, and went on to say, "its obvious you ate most the meal. What do you expect me to do? I can get my manager out, and I KNOW what he will say."

I argue that I only ate 4 small bites, and my mom steps in asking if I could just get a small side order of plain noodles, then I chime in that I want no sauce that I'll just put a little parmesan on top. He says he can do that, but I'll be charged for it. What else can I do, I'm hungry. 

He brought it, and I ate it just the way I said I would. It was fine, but I was still hungry, so I ordered Creme Brulee (& which comes with a free t-shirt). The Creme Brulee was good, still warm so I waited a minute or two or else the top wouldn't break just right. 

When he brought the check he pointed out my original meal's costs, then the side of noodle's cost, then he pointed out that he took off the cost of the noodle side, saying "Because I'm just a nice guy". Listen, when someone -- especially a waiter -- tells me that he's a nice guy because he's doing something that just basic customer service, you know they are just another jerk. Then he goes on to say, again, "if I had told any of this to my manager, he would have charged you for that side. But, I'm saving you the trouble. I'm just nice like that."

The funny thing is, as I was paying the bill, my mom was outside smoking with the manager, and she said he was really nice. There's no way he would have charged me for that little side when I barely touched my meal.

The only time our waiter was truly nice to use was right before we left, when he saw me taking photos of the canvases of old Vegas, and he offered to take a couple of pictures of me & my mom. And when he brought my free t-shirt out, he brought several sizes so I could compare. That was the nicest he was the entire time we were there.

I would go there again, for the limo ride and the atmosphere -- but not the food -- I'd go there for drinks and dessert, and watch my friends or family enjoy their meal, then I'd grab a bite at my hotel afterwards...

We had eggplant lasagna, shrimp scampi, eggplant parnassian. All three were great. Waiter suggested a little extra marinara on the side, great idea. Tiramisu and cannoli very tasty, and we got a T-shirt with the cannoli! Decor was nice but aging, waiter said they're remodeling in May 2015.

Every time I come to Vegas,  I have to visit Casa Di Amore. The food is always amazing and the entertainment can't get any more entertaining. 
It's so Vegas!!

Place was packed and looked like a great neighborhood place to go. Very friendly for sure.  Wine by the glass was on tap.  Not a fan of tap wines.  We both ordered the specials. My husband loved his. Mine was lobster & asparagas, but almost non-existent; mostly cheese and pasta.  I think if we'd stuck with something like spaghetti or lasagna and ordered a bottle of wine, I would have thoroughly enjoyed our visit.

This place is the best! So far, it is hands down the best Italian restaurant I have been to.. Although I went with a group I would also say it's a great place to take your significant other! I loved how they had a live jazz band playing frank Sinatra and others of that genera. The service was also fantastic! They also offer a limo that will pick you up and drop you off at your hotel! My GF and I shared a 1lb pasta bowl that was perfect for 2. And the pasta (penne & greens) just melted in my mouth. Next time I'm in Vegas I will be back!!
Their new outside Tiki Bar just opened and it is fabulous~ great decor~  cozy atmosphere and you can even hear the live music coming from inside through their large open window. Nice!!!

Thank you Yelpers once again for leading us to another great restaurant based on reviews herein.  We had the distinct pleasure of dining at this hidden gem recently.  We had not planned nor did we have reservations to dine, yet, we were cheerfully greeted by a true gentleman, who did not condescend, but, asked us to "please" wait in their lounge.  We did as bid, and "won" our part of our dinner check at the video games in the lounge.  How much better can it get?  Much, much, better!!!  Once our attention was drawn to the actual restaurant, we discovered wonderful photos, melodious melodies by famous crooners, ie., ole Blue Eyes.  Wine selection: excellent, ceasar salad: excellent, chicken marsala;delicious, Sad, but, okay: pork chop ala Italiano: tough.  Service: more than excellent.  For a dining treat in between losing $, GO, feel, and fall in love all over again with a great and genuine restaurant.  Bravo Casa di Amore.
