A really nice place for traditional Southern Italian in a relaxed setting. This is an Intimate place to eat (with some dressed casually and some dressed up) with live music (old classics like Sinatra, Dean Martin, etc., and not being played loudly at all but at a comfortable decibel level). As ex-New Yorkers used to good quality Italian TRADITIONAL fare that's hard to find on the west coast, this place fits the bill. We will be back and often!

Okay, so first off, I'm an Italian from NY who has been in Vegas for 2 years and I'm still in search of an Italian restaurant that I can frequent.  My husband and I came here for our anniversary dinner and because we had $20 off with our new entertainment book that we just got recently.  

Normally I have no problem paying a little more for food, provided it is good.  SO, I'd have to say that I'm really glad we had a $20 off coupon to eat here.  

The food itself is deserving of 2 stars but I gave the place 3 stars because it's cute inside and Brad, our server, was really nice.  My hope for him is that he will someday wait tables at a place that actually serves decent food.

So, on to the actual food..

We started out with fried calamari, which was pretty good.  The sauce that came with was actually decent as well. No issues here.

I ordered Eggplant Parm and my husband is a Chicken Parm fan.. For the money they charge for the entrees, $19 and $24 respectively, I would have hoped for more food.  Italian food is all about portions, and of course flavor, but you won't get rave reviews from me unless you actually FEED ME... Casa di amore didn't do this well.

My husbands chicken came with a steak knife, which, most people eating chicken parm would need.. My dinner also came with a steak knife.. first thoughts were "Why the hell would I need a steak knife for eggplant? I should be able to eat this with just a fork, no problem." BOY WAS I WRONG. Holy crap I could barely cut with it the steak knife it was so hard. With the time it took for them to actually COOK the meal, it should have been mush on the plate. Definitely NOT impressed with this at all.

I'm starting to think that the reason why there are no good Italian places in Vegas is because all of the REAL Italians stayed in the Tri-State area.

Easily the worst meal I've had since living in Las Vegas for the last 13 years. Went there to celebrate my birthday. Really wished I hadn't. The food quality of this restaurant is marginal, at best. I ordered the lasagna tonight. It literally was so bland and flavorless, two bites was all I could stand, and I forced the second bite. Frozen lasagna from your local grocery store has more flavor. The garlic loaf didn't really taste like garlic. More like hot melted cheese and grease bread. 
After deciding I didn't want to try anything else. They brought out a cannoli and sang happy birthday. Truth be told, the birthday song was cheesy and the cannoli was even worse. The filling was gritty and frankly, really bad. It was like the fitting finish to a really really bad meal. The whole dining experience was poor. I had high hopes for this restaurant. I ended up getting a refund from the manager, but I more than likely won't be back nor will I recommend this spot to anyone else

Great Italian find off the strip. The staff treats you like old friends and even arranged for their limo bus to take us to our show. Best cosmopolitan I had in Vegas (without the crazy prices) and food was like eating at my Italian friends house. The live music transported you back to the Sinatra days. A great mix of people both young and older. We will definitely be back!!
best time ever !!! bartender Dina makes the best Lemon Drop !!food was great atmosphere was pleasant ... The best out of everything was Dinas lemon Drop martini!!

Found this place on Yelp....definitely a fun atmosphere..loved the staff and entertainment...we chose appetizers of sauteed mushrooms and their garlic cheese bread.. .very solid 10, then we ordered the chicken marsala and shrimp scampi....we so wanted to love this place but the main courses were mediocre at best.  I also tried the meat sauce....not impressed...While our visit was fun with the Sinatra sounding singer and drummer that reminded me of BB King....I would go for drinks and appetizers...but the place was packed so try it for yourself!

Definately a place that is a little cheesy and has the Cliche of what one would expect from Italian food in Las Vegas. However the food is very good and the service is very strong. A great date place for people that don't take themselves seriously and wan't to have fun. The Steak Flambe was very good and the Chicken Picatta my friend had was good as well.

Great waiters - Amazing Italian dishes...a restaurant that is like a friendly neighborhood of family and guests. Loved the singer and drummer, creating an ambience that was relaxing entertaining and full of good energy. Such a nice contrast to the glitter and artificial fluff on the strip...this restaurant is authentic with genuine Italian cuisine. Thank you Casa Di Amore!

this place is purely old school and a perfect choice if your on a late flight arriving in vegas (they stay open till 2 am). 

this restaurant is a favorite of the locals and was recommended to us by our cab driver, who was clearly on his game.  the decor is old vegas, so you are expecting frank, dean, sammy or even elvis at anytime. in the case of elvis, please note he would not leave the building until he finished his meal. that's how good the food is and at a reasonable price point!

our waiter michael, promptly introduced himself and was spot on throughout the meal. we had the meatballs for an appetizer which were a generous portion, very tasty and were accompanied by an excellent tomato sauce. apologies, i forgot what my wife had as i was too busy eating,wtf? however she was enamored with her entree as well. 

again, kudos to our waiter michael, who was informative, well spoken and makes you want to revisit as does the food and ambiance.

we shall return!

My wife and I and our group of 6 were looking forward to a meal off the strip for a change. I came across Casa Di Amore while reading some other reviews. 

It started out great with their limo picking us up at our hotel (Aria). If you call them far enough in advance, they may have their limo pick you up and take you back to a strip hotel. There is no charge but make sure you tip the diver. He was great and picked up and dropped us off in style. 

The atmosphere is fun in the style of "Old Vegas" meaning pictures of Sinatra on the wall and live music every night. It is very lively and loud. The dress is casual.
 
I am a New Yorker born, raised and currently living. Good Italian restaurants are the norm in NY but I couldn't wait to try some of their dishes after some of the rave reviews. Well, The 6 of us had some starters and 6 different mains. The chicken parm., chicken florentine and the other standards were all fine. But just fine-not more. 

The service also was fine-but not more. And yes-the desserts were fine-but not more.
I will say the wine list was above average.
 
It can also be a pricey evening depending upon what you order.

I would still recommend Casa Di Amore if you want to get off the strip for a meal and experience a little "Old Vegas." It's a good change from some of the more upscale restaurants on strip. If you are in Vegas for 3 nights or more, make this one of your dinner stops and enjoy the limo ride!

What a great place.  Just like all the other reviews said.  As soon as we walked on we felt like family.  The band was playing and there was a real buzz the place.  Our server Brad  was wonderful.  You could tell he really enjoyed his job.  The clientele was many locals but we felt at home.  It was classy Italian.  Food was good and drinks were strong.  I can't wait to go back and take my friends.
I love this place.....The food, the service and the entertainment always makes for a great family night.

We found this place by typing Italian Food. Yelp reviews looked promising and I'm looking forward to the food and dining experience. Toni Girl greeted us quickly and professionally making our group of 8 feel important and welcomed. 

The ample parking was a plus and the Resturant has a nice visual appeal from the outside. As we walked in, the decor and ambiance was spectacular. I felt transported to a time when the "Rat Pack" was the hit of Vegas and the patrons inside were part of some big event in town. We felt under dressed but they extended a warm welcome regardless. 

We ordered water and drinks and was amazed at how quickly it was served. Appetizers of lobster ravioli, calamari, prosciutto, and bread was plentiful and absolutely tasty- The music of the 50-60's was so appropriate and lighting perfect, creating an ambiance of calm and delight.

The food came out so quick as well and words just can't explain how delicious the dishes were. I really did enjoy my stuffed pork chops dish. The pork was tender and flavorful. My friend did enjoy their pasta and seafood dishes. 

Overall, my experience here was amazing with the staff being so pleasant and attentive to our needs. Foodies, this place is a must try- you won't be disappointed!
This place is a hidden gem!! Reasonable prices delicious food and awesome atmosphere!! Great live entertainment 1950's 60's cool vibe Rat Pack style old school Vegas with a modern twist.

I came here with my friend one night before we went to a show on the strip. It was ok, but nothing to write home about (just yelp about!). 

We started off with the bruschetta, and it was probably one of the best that I've ever had. It's not super hard to make this, but it was still delicious. For the main course I got the osso bucco which is supposed to be a favorite, but I wasn't thrilled. The risotto was overcooked and didn't have any flavor. Even adding salt did nothing for it. The meat wasn't even as tender as I've had before. The tomato sauce was good, but then again, it's tomato sauce. If you're messing that up, then you should be making Italian food. My friend got the eggplant parmesan, and she really enjoyed it. Again, she said it wasn't the best, but not bad either. 

The dessert was weird. We got the dream bomba, which was SUPPOSED to be peanut butter ice cream, with a caramel center. Well, there was no caramel center, so we just ended up with peanut butter ice cream. Again, it was fine, but it wasn't as described, and it was just ice cream, nothing special. I wouldn't come back here, and I probably would recommend this to a friend. I can think of 5 other Italian restaurants I'd rather spend my money at.

When it comes to old school Las Vegas, this is the real deal. It is not a place where you rate just the food...you rate AND enjoy the experience. It's off the strip and next to a gun range. Perfect. Forget the celebrity chefs for a night and do something you will want to tell all your friends about. Really. Do it.

This was our favorite dinner in Vegas!  We went based on Yelp and Tripadvisor reviews- so glad I did my research, or I NEVER would have found this spot.  We took a cab (didn't know about the complimentary limo service!) and I started to wonder where the hell we were going- it was a 20.00 cab ride from the strip.  When we finally got there, the cabbie said we shouldn't have a problem getting back because the machine gun range next door was very popular with the tourists...

We walked in and were promptly seated by the hostess, who told us that the musician was taking a break but would be back soon (singing keyboard player who interacted w/willing dinner guests). Our server was extremely helpful and luckily, we were there on 1/2 priced wine night (Sun and Mon) so we got an excellent Chianti.  

We started off w/the calamari, which was wonderful and there was a ton of it!  It was very crisp and had a lovely marinara sauce.  I had the 'grandma's' soup, which was delicious- chicken noodle-y and very flavorful.  I was in the mood for red sauce, so the server recommended a sausage pasta dish that was normally served w/a pink sauce, but said he'd make it w/red (amazing!!!)  My husband had a strip steak which was served w/a twice baked potato and veggie...all good. 

When it was time for desert, we declined- but our server said we had to try the cannoli and we'd get a t-shirt...I'm a sucker for a free t, so we got it to go.  
The server told us about the limo service and said that the driver was off because nothing had been scheduled- but that his manager was more than happy to take us to our hotel.  We took him up on the offer and rode back to the strip in style. 
 
I'd recommend this restaurant to anyone, in fact, I gave away the card our server gave us w/his name on it (Christopher?) to another trade show attendee.  Sorry that I can't give his name, because he was great!

Later, while walking down the strip, we passed a particularly hungry looking homeless guy.  I asked if he was hungry, he said he was starving...I offered him our leftovers.  He happily took them and was very grateful.  About 3 minutes later, I realized I'd given away my souvenir t-shirt, but I bet he needed it more than I did.

This is my most favorite restaurant here in Las Vegas. I love the ambiance and love the food! Staff is pretty good gets really crowded at night so I suggest making reservations.. I suggest stating with the Bruschetta and the caprice.. really delicious! And for the entree i would order their version of a spinach tortillini or their chicken parmesian.. their pizza arent bad either all very good. prices, may be a little pricey but well worth it.. They also have a live band in the evening you may want to call them and ask. I highly sugget this place if you want to relax and enjoy an italian style ambiance with good food. only downside is it is located in the horrible neighborhood just make sure you park your car in a well lighted area..
wonderful old vegas place.food,service and price the best,entertainment is top notch music from back in the good old days.wonderful bar and tenders are the best.waiters and host/hostess can't be beat

The food and service was excellent and very fairly priced! They have a live band playing which was a lovely ambience. A little off the strip, but apparently they have a free limo ride that brings you from your hotel to the restaurant and back! definitely worth the visit as compared to those horrible and overpriced food on the strip.
Everyone who orders a cannoli gets a free t-Shirt!  I didn't get one because I had the tiramisu....no regrets though, it was delish!

Free limo ride is great if it doesn't break down from the heat.  Got a call right when they were supposed to pick us up asking us to grab a cab & they'd reimburse us (took the $17 right off of our bill).

Kinda small inside so definitely make a reservation - but it's dark like those old school Hollywood club/restaurants - not sure what anyone means about the mobster feel.  

We ordered (2) sets of Osso Bucco & (1) stuffed pork chop.  Tony (our waiter) came back and said the chef didn't like the condition of the Osso Bucco & didn't want to serve it...so I ordered the flambed rib eye & my friend ordered the special of the day filet mignon w/ marsala sauce & mushrooms.

EVERYTHING WAS YUMMY, the filet literally didn't need a knife, rib eye was juicy & medium rare as requested, pork chop was stuffed w/ delicious goodness & all at great pricing.  

We even got a recommendation on wine from Tony & grabbed a bottle of 2008 Mac Murray Pinot Noir @ 1/2 price bottle (Sundays/Mondays) for $21 instead of $42.  

We had the Pistachio gelato dessert which was delicious too but kinda sweet for us.

We were serenaded most of the night by two men...but only remember the name of the 80+ years old violinist Bill...who's fiddler fingers just flew all over the strings.  AMAZING!

Definitely coming back here in  August on my next LV trip.

This classic Vegas throwback is always a safe bet. Pizzas and pastas are old school and always perfectly prepared. The live entertainment adds to the whole experience. They also host an outstanding Super Bowl party every year. Multiple, humongous 12 foot HD screens, everybody gets a seat, cheerleaders, drum line, all you can eat, all you can drink. Can this little party Casa Di Amore throws get any better. Yes it can! This year at Las Vegas Hotel which means you happen to be in the same building as one of Las Vegas' sport book. So yeah, place your bets if that's your thing too. Super crowd spanning all ages. Those 12 foot screens with a sound system to match makes this event as close to being there as possible. This is one Super bowl party that is hard to beat. It's their 7th year so they must be doing something right.

Another hidden gem in Vegas. What a blast with family and friends. Paul Stubblefield stole the show on stage. Great service and food!  Picked us up at hotel and drove us back....great deal with 1/2 price wine on Mondays!
Have never had a bad meal here... tonight was awesome had Roshy for our bartender and she was awesome... food was incredible and the atmosphere was even better

Casa Di Amore sets a tone right off the bat. The character and mood established is one of warmth and romance with the use of low lighting, dark wood paneling, classic decorations, and leather booths. This conveys the expectation that you're going to have a special meal and Casa Di Amore doesn't disappoint. 

The one of the foundations of any excellent Italian restaurant is their house sauce or gravy. Casa Di Amore's basic sauce is just awesome it's hearty, rich, and scrumptious without being overbearing and sharp.

We began our meal with the garlic loaf which was cheesy, and toasty warm.  Our friends had the Chicken Angelo and the ravioli. The Chicken Angelo with mushrooms, olives, and artichoke hearts was creamy, tasty, and tender. The ravioli were delicious and rich. We had the Gnocchi Alla Prosciutto and the Frutti Di Mare. The Gnocchi were made in house and complimented perfectly with a four cheese sauce. The Frutti Di Mare had shrimp, scallops, clams, mussels, and calamari in a rich, delicious red sauce/gravy. I've read yelp comments that have said the sauce was bland. The reason I decided to visit Casa Di Amore were the newspaper articles that cited the house sauce/gravy as one of the best in Vegas and comparable to the best on the east coast. I'm in full agreement, it was one of the best meals I've had in Vegas. The service was knowledgeable and responsive throughout our visit.

Really wonderful little Vintage Vegas place. Nice wait staff and good food. I am a hard nut to crack with Italian but this place passes my tests. Good stuff. The food was wonderful and authentic tasting. My only complaint is they aren't open for lunch (?)
 Very nice, but this place is on the small side so if you have a big party you might want to call ahead.

Our server was Tony which was absolutely fabulous, and very attentive. He offered menu suggestions that were great. I had the special filet mignon tips with gnocchi and gorgonzola sauce- it was amazing with fresh basil. The gnocchi was cooked perfectly which is hard to find, sauce wasn't to heavy and steak was cooked to medium. My husband had the flamade steak (may not be spelling this right) and he enjoyed it. Double espresso and tiramisu for dessert was good. The tiramisu had extra chocolate sauce on top which seemed to much/heavy for us. We had a nice dinning experience and definitely will come back.

I said this many times through the night, but Casa di Amore has to be everything I have ever wanted in an Italian restaurant. Upon approaching the building, a man dressed nicely in a suit opened the door for my boyfriend and I. The moment we stepped inside, we were transported into a world of live music, Italian food, and great company. 

The restaurant was definitely crowded, I mean come on it was a Friday night, luckily there was an empty table to we were seated right away. Our server Brad came right away to our table just to introduce himself and let us know he was already getting some bread ready for our table. Brad was very helpful through the night in helping us decide which meal would satisfy our taste buds.I opted to get the Frutti Di Mare with a cup of soup. My boyfriend chose the Veal Piccata with a cup of soup. 

The Breakdown:

The soup was an Italian take on chicken noodle. The noodles were tiny little pasta balls served in a hot chicken broth with chicken chunks, carrots, and celery. 

The Frutti Di Mare was the best I have had in a while. It came with huge mussels, clams, scallops, calamari,  and ginormous shrimp! The shrimp and mussels were definitely my favorite part of the dish. I have never eaten shrimp so tasty or huge before. All of this seafood goodness was served on a bed of linguine with your choice of red or white sauce. The server knew I wanted something a little spicy, so he offered to have the kitchen make the red sauce with some spice. My gosh that was the best decision of my life. It definitely made the dish perfect!

The Veal Piccata came served in a sauce with lemon, mushrooms, basil, and a hint of wine. In addition to that, it came with a small bowl of penne pasta in a marinara sauce. My boyfriend enjoyed the dish, but felt that it was a little too small for him (he eats A LOT, so it's perfect for those who want a normal sized portion). 

The night was wonderful and the atmosphere made me smile the whole night. Hearing the live music made me feel like I was transported back in time. This is definitely a great date spot, so definitely try it out! They offer a limo service as well, so if you give them a call earlier in the day they can pick you and your date up! Definitely a way to impress your significant other! It's free of charge, but obviously leave a good tip!

Where the Rat Pack must have held court

This is the real deal for good 'East Coast' Italian food.  No LV strip bling.  It's old school baby!  I've been here 3 times both with a group and just my teenage son.  Great Osso Buco, great service. The pictures of Bugsy's Vegas in the 50's that adorn the walls make it a throwback to a quiet place that the rat pack would hang out to avoid tha paparazzi.  Lots of locals, not a tourist stop.  Live piano and guess what? He channels Dino and Frankie.  Great evening and located not far from the strip.  It's next door to an indoor machine gun shooting range - go figure.  On the way in, you drive past the Liberace museum.  What a city: Gangsters, Guns and Glitter all in an evening's dinner.
Food is great. Intimate. Lounge singer sounds just like Sinatra. Did I say the food is great? It is. We took the complimentary limo to and from our hotel. Nice touch.
Wow! Brilliant old school Vegas experience. Free limo service to and from our hotel. Phenomenal service, delicious food and I have to recommend the buffalo mozzarella bruschetta.

Great food, great music.  Jeff the owner treated us like royalty! The tiki bar was fabulous! Thank you Tony for being an exceptional waiter.
Can't wait for the next time I am in Las Vegas!   Will certainly be stopping at Casa Di Amore for a delicious meal!

ATMOSPHERE:  Aside from the perimeter of booths, the tables are so close together in one big room it feels a little like a beer hall or cafeteria, so it feels a little crowded and loud.  However, the Love Shack gets props for being too dark to see the prices and very old school Vegas/Italian. I can't imagine going on a night without the live entertainment which made the experience.  

The night we went it was one older black guy and one older white guy singing mostly 70s easy rock and R&B covers. They should call themselves "Grey".  "Hi, I'm white" "And I'm black", "And together we're Grey".

SERVICE:  Great, but it's the kind of place that gets super busy, so we ordered drinks, appetizers, and entrees all at the same time just in case.  

DRINKS:  Not weak. And the bar has video poker/keno/blackjack. And if you want to eat in the bar, they will give you something that looks like a cutting board with high heel clogs.

LIMO/VAN:  You better reserve that in advance.  We missed the limo, but the manager hooked us up and sent us home in the shuttle as we stumbled out.

FOOD:  We shared the bruschetta.  The bread was kinda crouton-ish, but interesting and yummy.  The meatballs (a side for $4) were perfect.  I made the mistake of ordering the gypsy sauce even though I was told that on a scale from 1 to 10 in spiciness it was a 15.  It was like someone dumped a whole red pepper flake shaker into it.  I sweated throught it, and the server gave me some McDonald's coffee to cool my mouth down.

Pleasantly surprised.

No lie, I had some hesitation coming up to the east side not many great things are found here. This place however blew my mind! The vibe of live music, hospitable service and great food put a fat ass stamp of places I would forsure return back to.

I LOVE this place. The food is delicious, the service is fantastic, and the ambience is to die for. It's your italian family restaurant, with the Frank Sinatra singer that makes you feel all mushy inside ( in a good way!). I've been here for dinner, and My best friend's wedding reception was here too. It was divine. You don't HAVE to dress up here, but isn't always nice to get a tiny bit dressed up to feel fabulous at a good restaraunt? Also, you can get picked up by their limo is you call to make a reservation!
Casa Di Amore is wonderful, you won't regret going there!

The reviews on YELP had me most interested in trying this place when I was in Vegas during my vacation last week.  Everything you read on here is true...it is truly a good place to eat.  The service and food were great!  We even each got a drink for free just for checking in on foursquare.  I had the stuffed pork chopped which were really good, just too much to eat and my wife had the chicken angelo which she also really enjoyed.  We had a restaurant.com certificate that kept our bill under $60 for the meal.  Our waitress, host and gentleman who was singing on stage were all super friendly and superb at their jobs.  The only reason for leaving off one star was the seating was a bit uncomfortable and we both found the lack of lighting to be somewhat awkward.  These are just little concerns for a great meal though.
The only Italian place we eat at in Las Vegas. Food and service is amazing!
The food was awesome!!! The decore is of "old Vegas"  aka frank Sinatra you can definitely see some of the rat pack ratting here!! I had the stuffed chops two 8oz delicious

My wife and I had a great experience, they were able to get us a table even though we had no reservations and the place was packed! 

Our waiter Tony was very attentive and answered all your questions and provided us a few of his personal recommendations. 

I didn't realize that they are willing to pick you up from your Hotel in a limousine for free!  So next time were planning ahead and take advantage of the limo ride service so I can indulge in all the fine wines that they have available.

I love old Vegas establishments.  They are devoid of the glitz and forced atmosphere of many of the restaurants on the strip.  This is a small place, all wood and not very many tourists.  The food is decent and it's GREAT to hear jazz.  The only reason I didn't give 4 stars is the music is just too loud.  No matter where you sit.  Management really needs to instruct the band to turn it down.  I couldn't hear my guest without shouting

This is my boyfriend and I's favorite date spot! The ambiance is classic Las Vegas, and very fun & romantic. The food is delicious, and the service is always prompt and friendly. Every server we've had is the perfect mixture of professional but casual and fun; they make you feel like you're a regular, even if it's your first time dining. They have a live duo singing classic hits, and tons of cool vintage Vegas pictures that are neat to check out. The lobster ravioli is one of my favorites.

Went to Casa Di Amore on Saturday December 12, 2015. Great atmosphere in that it is great for groups or for a romantic date. There was great live music playing motown and a lot of Frank Sinatra. 

We initially had a bad experience with service here. I made a reservation for four for 8pm, and we were not seated until 8:30p.m. The manager did not really acknowledge the fact that we were waiting so long. After our meal, the manager asked us how our experience was and I complained about the wait at the beginning. The manager gave us free desert, which to me made up for our initial bad experienced.

I am coming from NYC so I know good Italian food and am used to NYC prices. The prices here are around $25-30 per plate which is the typical NYC mid-range restaurant price. I ordered the Veal marsala and it was delicious. My father ordered the Veal francese and he found it to be very good. My mother and girlfriend had different scallop dishes and really enjoyed them.

One cool thing I learned is you can be picked up and dropped off by a limo for free from anywhere on the strip (obviously tipping the driver though) but you have to book in advance. 

Overall I would say this is a very fun place to go, good food, good atmosphere and fair prices.

This is quintessential old Las Vegas!  It is an off strip location in a fantastic brick building (brick in Nevada-just sayin').  My favorite part of the experience, place a reservation in advance for free limo service! Whaaat?!  Does this place know their audience or what?!  How smart is that marketing?!

I adored it.  It was not fancy, it wasn't run down, it was perfect for celebrating and enjoying with loved ones.  There are lots of pictures and Godfather references throughout the restaurant.  I love the kitsch of the décor, it works.  

Their wine menu is lean, which is fine it offered enough for variety without being overwhelming.  We stuck with Prosecco.  It was good, one option, a little sweet for me, but fine for a special occasion.

They offer gluten free pasta which is great!  We swapped it for the greens pasta on the menu and it was delicious. We also shared salads (Caesar), chicken parmesan, and cioppino.  The only disappointing dish was the cioppino.  To be fair, SF is in my backyard and we are the ringers for that dish, so it is hard to compare.  It was a decent dish, but if going back I wouldn't order it again.  We should have known better.

I took a scandalous (for me) bite of the chicken parmesan since it used to be one of my favorite dishes and it was perfect! It was lightly breaded, crispy, with melty cheese and a delicious sauce.  My stomach is rumbling just thinking about it.

Our service was amazing for the whole experience; the restaurant brought dessert over to the birthday girl and a free t-shirt for her.  

I think if you are going to LV, take a chance and step off the strip for this little gem.  Live music, free limo rides, and good food - how can you go wrong?

I am sooo sorry, Casa di Amore. I didn't realize I never wrote you a review until my mother-in-law talked about how she's coming back and I had to look you guys up again.

On to my review...

I am anti-weddings or should I say I'm anti the weddings *I've* attended. The weddings I've been to in the last few years have been kinda mehh. The consistent theme that I've noticed is that the food is never really that wonderful, which sucks because that's the most costly part. When it came down to planning my whole shebang, I didn't want to throw a $20,000 wedding for 175 people with crappy food. Plus ever since Britney Spears got married in Vegas, I've always had this crazy idea in my head that I should get married there too. So, that's what we did. Our plan: to have a 15 minute ceremony that would have the best damn wedding food and greatest party you've ever experienced. Casa di Amore helped make my big night absolutely flawless. 

We had originally planned for a Brazilian steakhouse that our chapel could package with our overall wedding. The chapel screwed up and forgot to make the reservation with the steakhouse. By the time they noticed their error, they told me the place was booked up. The problem with having your wedding on a hella cool date like 9-10-11 is that everyone  ELSE wants that hella cool date too. We called a bunch of different places on the strip including Maggianos and no dice. My mom, of all people, actually found Casa di Amore and told me to call them. Immediately after speaking with Kathleen, I knew that this was going to be a perfect fit for my wedding. She was absolutely one of the best people that I dealt with throughout my wedding process. She gave me their traditional catering menus but said if we saw something else on the menu we liked, they could change it and edit it. 

The food: we had 30 guests and everyone raved about the food (my dad's review is even on here...look for Russ C.) My husband's family is all 100% Italian, so I was hoping this would live up to their expectation and it did. They all were so impressed by the antipasto platter that we had served as an appetizer and said "Wow, this place is authentic."

And yeah, I'm pretty darn competitive so to hear my dad and step-mom tell me the food was WAY better at our wedding than at my step-brothers, well that was one of my proudest moments of 2011. 

The service: our waiters were great, very attentive and personable. They were happy to make wine and champagne suggestions but didn't try to push anything extra on us.

The $$$: Kathleen only made us pay a small deposit of $100 to reserve the space for us. She followed up with us throughout the whole process but sent us another follow-up email the day before just to make sure we were still good to go and that we didn't want to change anything. We thought the prices were extremely fair in comparison to how much food and how amazing it was.

Ambiance: so fun! There was a lounge singer there that night and my guests loved it. We got a free show while we ate.

If anyone is thinking of doing a dinner here, I would highly recommend it. The process is easy and Kathleen will put your mind at ease. OR if you've been there, done that on the whole wedding thing and are just thinking about a nice date, doooo it! It's great to get away from the strip and experience a little old Vegas. They also have limos that will come pick you up as long as you make a reservation and call in advance.

this place is my favorite italian place to eat in vegas. i've lived in town for a while now and it took me some time but i found a place thats worth going to. i'm italian and i grew up in chicago. chicago has the best italian food in the country. this place comes as close as you can get out here. i also live about 40 mins from casa, but its worth the travel every time. consistent and fresh. very good.

Casa di Amore feels homie and comforting and that goes for both the decor and the food. I read that this was one of the best Italian restaurants in Las Vegas so we came here under that impression. Having the bar set as high as it can be, the men in my party ordered the chicken and veal parmesan while us girls asked for an antipasto salad, salmon and bruschetta. My date who's half Italian approved the chicken parm with penne pasta! I tried this dish as well and I thought the chicken was moist and tender; the pasta sauce was delicious - over all a great dish! 

My antipasto salad was good but a bit too acidic for my taste. Instead, I ate some of he bruschetta and I really enjoyed those. 

It can get really loud in here once the live music starts so if you want to eat and talk, perhaps you should show up before 6:30 pm.

At any moment, Sammy Davis Jr. and Frank Sinatra could walk through the doors. Okay, not really because they're dead, but Casa di Amore has nailed the old school Vegas vibe.

The servers were well-polished and unpretentious. Even the manager was extremely hospitable and treated us like family.

My family and I ordered the following: 

Lasagna    A
Chicken Marsala    A
Eggplant parmigiana   B
Fettuccine Alfredo   B

The pasta is made in house, which I love. Now if that weren't enough, you also get FREE entertainment. That's right, live music and the singer has a lot of soul. If you're fortunate enough to chat with him, he'll share fascinating stories about everybody who's anybody in the music industry.

This place stays crowded, so make reservations.

Great food, great service,  and great atmosphere!  We were told it would be a 30min-1hr wait so we went to the bar (bartenders were very nice) 
We had just left Annies gourmet Italian restaurant and had a horrible experience!  
We were only at the bar for about 10 minutes and my girlfriend had told the manager "Smitty" what had happened at the last restaurant, we were starving!  After hearing our story Smitty came right over and got us a table!  Awesome!!! Or server, i think his name was Bret or Brad, was great!  Eggplant was soooo good. As was the bruchetta and gypsy pasta with meatballs. ..can't wait to go back!

This place is TOO Cute!!! it SCREAMS...Vegas BABY Vegas! While driving to my kick ball game I saw this adorable place and decided it looked hopeful. When we walked in they asked us if we had a reservation and we did not. I laughed because the place was empty so why in the world would we need a reservation!? VERY soon the place was FULL!!!! The live singing was such a great added touch to the ambiance! The old Vegas feel and the waitstaff MAKE THIS PLACE! 

On to the food....
I had the chicken parm and it was not bad.. not the best I have ever had but it certainly wasn't bad! Their homemade bread and garlic butter was yummy!!! The best part of the entire meal was their chicken alfredo!!! To die for!  I recommend this place highly and to top it off they have a limo they will pick you up in! You can't get more vegas than that!

We went here for our anniversary last Sunday. Food was amazing. Definitely order the bruschetta. It's one of the most delicious things ever. Just do it. Our server Michael was so friendly and made our experience even better! He told the band it was our anniversary and they wished us a happy anniversary and played us a song. Very sweet. And he gave us a cannoli to celebrate! Great evening :)

I can't remember what this is called but the sausage is OUT OF THIS WORLD!!!  The sauce is creamy and has a little kick. I would recommend this place. Plus on Mondays they have 1/2 price bottles of wine. If you can get in. Live music Real old school vegas.

I come to Las Vegas probably twice a year and we try not to eat on the strip.  Casa Di Amore is one of the reasons you leave the strip.  If you are looking for great Italian with all the trimmings (atmosphere and all) this is the place!!!!

This place was amazing with the old school feel.  They had the singer that was amazing, singing the Sinatra classics and all, the booths and a family feel.  The food was great!!! You must get the garlic bread, I had the egg plant parm and it was great and I wasn't able to finish it and I finish everything!!!   My cousins had the classic spaghetti and meatballs, and lasagna they were both raving about it.

This is a place that I definitely return to.  I had a blast!!!  It was like a dinner and a show.  Well worth the trip off the strip.
You need to make reservations a half hour before you actually want to eat. Very loud, but great for parties. The food is absolutely amazing!

Yelp this place and it was open from 5p-5a, and it was 12am. Perfect! We had appetizers and took them home with us. The prawns wrapped are delish and the sampler appetizer was also very good. 
While we were sitting at the bar for our food, a server came up to us and started to compliment us on our attire and was very nice and kind. He asked if we seen the live band. He said that we need come back and check it out and was sad to see us take our food to go. 
Definitely going back to eat in the restaurant and enjoy the music and the FOOD!

Casa Di Amore is my favorite restaurant! Me and my boyfriend come here often and always get the best service. The people who work there already recognize us and we're always greeted with smiles. One of the servers already knows what we tend to get, drinks and food which surprises us each time. I love the Chicken Alfredo and the cup of homemade chicken soup. I've brought my family here, and even my picky nephew loved their spaghetti when he usually doesn't eat restaurant food. Since I've had food at Casa Di Amore, I have gone to other Italian restaurants and do not enjoy the food as much anymore because I end up missing the taste of Casa Di Amore's food. The music is also great! Come here, you won't regret it! (:

Definitely one of the highlights of my trip we had dinner there twice The food Is fantastic antipasto Fried shrimp With Linguine topped with a spicy red sauce some of the best I've ever had including NYC they call it gypsy sauce - The video machines at the bar free drinks actually won some money had dinner and drinks just a wonderful time. If you enjoy Italian this is a must go to. Argentine Cowboys Boston mass.

Had a great late night family dinner. The food was great, the services was amazing, and the place has a great atmosphere. We caught the tail end of the live music performance which was fantastic. I wish they would have played longer.

This place deserves every star.  If you are looking for a real Vegas experience, this is the place. Great food and great entertainment.  George Bugatti doesn't disappoint.  I will definitely make this place a "must visit" every time I go back to Vegas.

We chose this restaurant based on a restaurant.com certificate we had and read all the terrific reviews.  The food (dinner AND dessert) and the prices didn't put me over the moon, but the service and ambiance were awesome!  Old style Vegas with live music (we were there too early to enjoy the live entertainment; it started shortly before we left).  Our reservation was for 5pm and we walked up to the door to find it locked at 4:55pm.  They should open a little bit earlier for their first reservations.  We would have enjoyed a drink before going to our table.  Everyone raves about the free limo ride, which we passed up because we live in Henderson.  Overall it was a nice experience, but one that I'll only have once as a local.
Impeccable comes to mind. Old feel Vegas at its best! Service was amazing. Food was outstanding! Entertainment was classic! Great time!

Casa Di Amore is great! I loved the garlic loaf and the chicken angelo was to die for! The music on Friday and Saturday nights is nice too! They have a great old school atmosphere and good service. If something is not right they go out of their way to make sure they fix it which is cool. Their pizza is awesome too! I like that they are open late.

The food was very very good, the waiter attentive and friendly, and the manager came and spend a few minutes getting to know us. The chicken piccata was delicious.  

The entertainment was very nice, but not so loud as to ruin conversation. We enjoyed hearing the great music from the 50's so nicely performed. 

Casa Di Amore must be popular with the locals, as many people coming in were acknowledged by the entertainer and employees. All in all it was definitely worth finding it, thanks to Yelp!

I've gone now around four times as others seem to love Casa Di Amore and I just don't get the wow factor. Maybe being a vegetarian it's because I'm cutting my options down? Cost wise for me it's just not worth it.

I cant say enough positive things about this old school, authentic Italian restaurant!  It is off the strip...so you get the amazing quality without Las Vegas Strip prices.  It is a great place for any kind of date night, business lunch/dinner, or really anyone who just wants a relaxing dinner with a cozy atmosphere.  They have a nice bar towards the back with a few gaming machines for those who do not prefer a table.  The service was is second to none and with the cabaret style live music, excellent food and great location off the strip, Casa Di Amore is a restaurant I recommend to all locals and tourists for an amazing time!

This place was wonderful and a ton of fun!  Great atmosphere and the servers were cheerful and attentive.  The Frank Sinatra wanna be kept the mood light and provided great background music throughout our dinner.  I would definitely return on my next trip to Vegas.

I would like to say this was one of my favorite restaurants so far! I had called for a last minute reservation and the young lady did her best to fit us in at the time I had requested. The place was super busy but the moment we got seated our waiter came by took his time to go thru the menu with us and offered us some wine and bread. Service was amazing!!!!! I loved the live music and they way everyone was so into it by signing and having a good time ! The food was beyond amazing ! 
For desert we tried the cannoli best damn thing I have ever tasted in my life  ! Overall this place was amazing I recommend it to anyone !

We were looking for Italian on our last night in Vegas. Thank goodness for Yelp as the reviews brought us to this awesome restaurant. We had 24 total in our group. The place has a really cool old Vegas vibe, live music focusing on Frank Sinatra, Dean Martin type tunes and awesome food. Great customer service from our waiter, Tony. Cannot say a bad thing about this place. Will be a new favorite restaurant while here in the future. Cali approves and gives two thumbs up.
OMG. This place is delicious. Went around 10pm on Monday night and there was live music. Had the penne pesto. Superb. Yummy yummy

I really love this place.  Live music, old framed pics of Las Vegas, good service, great food.  Bread is hot and fresh and they have a free limo ride to and from the strip.  I am a local now but for really good Italian food, you gotta come here.  Tiramisu kicked ass by the way.

We were referred here by 2 friends who dine here frequently, friends that we share similar taste buds with! So of course we had to try. When we drove up it seemed to be another great hole in the wall restaurant. Nothing too fancy on the outside...but when we walked in it was like walking into Old Vegas...live band playing great tunes, Old Vegas pictures on the wall, dim lighting, wait staff dressed very nice. We were sat in a corner booth by the entrance. It was a great spot, overlooked everything. If you want a quiet, romantic spot...not the place to come during the busy hours! But we were not there for that. We were there for some great Italian food. Our waiter came over introduced himself, asked if we had been before and then proceeded to tell us about the menu and the specials. We ordered our drinks and were served yummy hot bread and butter. 
I ordered the special, gnocchi with filet tips in a gargonzola cream sauce and my man ordered the Fettucine Alla Pappasito
Fresh homemade egg noodles tossed with a combination of crumbled and sliced smoked sausage, mixed with sauteed sweet onions in a white wine four cheese sauce.
Our food came out fresh and hot and DELICIOUS! The sauces on both dishes were AMAZING...
Our 1st experience here was fantastic. Food 110% spot on, service as well and for the price was worth it 5 star experience .
Now for last night...we had such a great experience the 1st time we wanted to go back...I don't normally write a review unless I have been at least 2 times or if it was just terrible the 1st. I have to say I am very sad to report that this time we had about a 2 star experience which is why I am giving it a 3 star total. 
I called ahead to see how busy they were, it was late and I didn't know what time they stopped serving. The lady on the phone who is so very pleasant said they didn't stop til 3:30am ...it was about 10:30pm  so we were good.  We got there and the band was done, so it was very quiet, perfect time to come if you want that quiet atmosphere. We were seated at a booth. It was not busy inside. There were about 5 tables with people all together. We sat and looked thru the menu. Sat some more, sat even more...about 10 mins, no waiter, no water, no service. Then a waiter walked over, helped the couple sitting at the table next to us, turned around when he was done and apologized for the delay. Not sure why there was a delay since the place was dead. We ordered waters, he said that he would get that and have bread sent over to the table. He brought back our waters, told us about the specials, which sounded amazing, so we ordered one of each. Mine was penne pasta with a cream sauce, cheese and lobster, he suggested a side of marinara to counteract some of the cheese...and my man ordered the fettuccine with this steak a that had spinach and cheese rolled up inside with seasoning and marinated over night and slow roasted to perfection, the sauce was a butter garlic. 
The bread finally came out, but went to wrong table, so the waiter reached over, took it off their table and gave it to us. Was it warm? Yes...but didn't taste or feel fresh, not like our 1st visit. Waters were refilled regularly which is big for me...I don't like an empty glass. Our food came out and it looked delicious. Unfortunately, it was not a big hit. Man's dish had very little meat, surrounding a pile of spinach inside, no cheese, he said no flavor and like it had been broiled really quick...tough. not like the waiter described at all. Mine was good. Not great. I mixed it all up looking for the lobster...we paid  $32 for each plate. I had maybe 3 pieces of lobster that were SO small I had to rub off the sauce with my fork to see if it really was lobster....disappointed to say the least. For $32 there should have been some hefty chunks of lobster in there and my man's food should have been as described by the waiter. The marinara sauce was delicious. We did order cesar salad prior and those were fantastic as well. Our service,once we finally had some, was good. 
But I am truly disappointed with my $72 bill for what we had. I really wanted to be able to give this place 5 Stars since our 1st experience was so wonderful but am sadly giving it a 3. Had we not been prior I would have only given it a 2. :(

There were six of us. To be quite honest, this is a place for people who like Italian food, but don't know what their getting. It's a small place and it was packed. It has music and looks lovely and like it may have come out of the 50's. The people are nice and Toni our server from Brooklyn just wonderful. The food is mediocre at best. The ingredients that go into making up their food is lacking quality and are not the best. We ordered some appetizers, calamari was good, shrimp was doughy and the escarole tasted more like broccoli. The wife got the Osso Bucco, just ok, not a great flavor and the Risotto that came with it was rice-a-roni at best. I had the Veal Parmigiana, tender but again it lacked flavor, no taste because again the quality of the ingredients are not that good. My other friend got Moscatelli pasta and it was dry and something you would expect at an Olive Garden. All in all, this is probably equivalent to a Olive Garden or Macaroni Grill. I'm sorry, we had high hopes for this place, but it just didn't satisfy our palates. I would not return. There are to many other great places such as the Italian American Club, Trattoria Reggiano or Sicilliano's,

I could of sworn I reviewed Casa Di Amore last year... but nothing here so I am doing a combined reviewed of two visits.  First time I went last year, it was AMAZING.  I would have given it 5 stars for the food, the service, it was all top notch.  There were 3 of us, we were sat in a corner booth and ordered a bunch of appetizers and entrees to share.  Even had dessert.  It was all delicious and fabulous.  Service was on point and I enjoyed my wine to top it all off. 

Second visit was a few weeks ago.  
Unfortunately went with high expectations based on the first visit.  Oddly we were sat in the bar area, which I didn't really care for.  The only advantage to that was our bartender was our server and she was great.  

This visit had some highlights and low points.  

Highlight was the lobster ravioli.  Was as delicious as the first time. 

Low point was the meatballs that came out cold - AND when we asked it to be hot they literally just NUKED the meatballs in the microwave and brought it back out.  Didn't this that was this kind of restaurant.  

Highlight was the chicken parmesan hubby ordered.  Low point was my veal parmesan which seemed a bit tough... esp conidering it was veal.  Overcooked maybe?  I dunno.  

The old school Vegas feel was still there and we mostly enjoyed our dinner, but those were some odd things like microwaved meatballs.  
Lastly, we made our reservation through Open Table and the restaurant told Open Table we never showed up.  So I get some kind of note from Open Table in which I have to "explain" myself that we were there with the bill to show as proof if need be.  Yeah... just a little irritating to a dinner that was already just about 3 stars.  Hopefully they fix their little quirks.

First off the food is amazing. You will be happy here with whatever you order.  

My major gripe is being told I cannot sub a menu item without being charged extra.....or if I was here for swing shift they wouldn't even entertain the thought of a special order. 

My specific case was wanting a meatball sub with meatless meatballs. The chef (NOT the batender who was nice) said they will have to charge me an extra $3 for the substution. Mind you, they are the same price on the menu.

It just left a bad taste in my mouth, but the superb food has had me back since then and I enjoyed it immensely. 
Its unfortunate that one incident has left me hesitant to return and their policy of letting the chef run the show instead of paying customers sucks....but if you can stomach the 'no special orders' policy you will be just fine here. 

On a side note, the video poker there is quite stingy. All I do is lose, lose, lose. Not even in a fun, i win a little and give it all back sort of way. I straight up lose hard and fast.

We came here on a Saturday night.  I booked the limo expecting to have to share it.  Limo driver shows up on time.  No shared ride, he took us directly to the restaurant.  Nice limo too.  Bonus.

The place smells good when you come in.  We waited for our table at the bar.  My GF hit four of a kind on a VP machine and won over $200.00.  Nice way to start the evening. $$$

Really, this place is awesome.  From the drinks, the food, the live music, and service.  I had the Veal Parmesan.  It was terrific.  GF had the Lobster Ravioli, #2 Daughter had the Cioppino.  We shared the Fried Calamari and a Antipasto Salad.  There was so much food!

Perfect old Vegas style without being cheesy.  Take the one you love to Casa Di Amore.  It's a classy move.  We'd go back in a minute.  Loved this place!
Take a step back in time into this classic Vegas Italian restaurant. Absolutely excellent food,service, and ambiance. We go every year no matter what !

This is a great classic Italian restaurant. The food is AMAZING!!! I love that they have a true Italian atmosphere with the piano and singers, the authentic food, and it's pretty loud which reminds me of being in an Italian house! The only complaint I have which has nothing to do with the restaurant overall is I wish the people that are their dressed up a little more half of the place is dressed very nice the other half is in leggings and hoodies it just kind of brought the class of the place down a bit for me. But other then the atmosphere you can not go wrong with the food!

Had a coupon for buy one get one apps and Bryan was an amazing bartender and server ... The food was cooked perfect ...it was 3am and still amazing ... Thanks Bryan for a great night!!! :) I'll be back ASAP...

My first review.  We had 3 locals/bartenders on the strip recommend this place.  It's  10 minutes  off the strip but totally  worth the s $11 taxi ride.  Forget about the food on the strip.  This is the best Italian food in Vegas.  The waiting staff was friendly, from the bartender to the table server. Highly recommended.

We loved Casa Di Amore.  We started with drinks.  My companions had the express cocktail and loved it.  We started with calamari and bruschetta.  For my entree I had the Baked Mostaccioli.  It was delicious.  The server was great.  I'd say this was a 4.5 out of 5 stars.  My only disappointment was that there was no lemon cake on the menu :(.  Eat here!

I joined Susan and a few others for my first Yelp event : an evening (roundtrip) limo ride to Casa di Amore.  The restaurant sends its own branded red limo to pick up customers on the Strip- more fun than a plain old taxi ride. The limo isn't all that big but I'd never been in one before so it was kind of cool playing with the buttons for the "mood lighting" and the A/C (and laughing as Susan accidentally found one that suddenly separated us from the driver with a metal partition!). :-)   

The restaurant definitely has an old school Vegas feel.  Photographs of Vegas line the walls of the dining room in a chronology, starting with Old Vegas and ending with modern, color photos of the Vegas we see today: gaudy, colorful and sparking! A lounge singer plays the piano and sings old hits such as "Copacabana" (he even had backup singers for that one- don't know where the background sound came from!)  

Some in our group had a vested interest in a football game. A section towards the back of the restaurant sports lounge seating and widescreen TVs showing at least a couple of football games, so they could easily walk back there for a closer look at the game from time to time.  

As a vegetarian/vegan (depends on my mood right now) I was surprised at the paltry salad offerings- I had hoped for a nice big salad for my dinner. Instead, I opted for the small, plain house salad that comes with your order. I chose the penne with greens as my entree (escarole cooked in olive oil). It was very tasty and a bit rich- made me wonder if there was a touch of cheese in it, but I forgot to ask.

Anyway, I had a good time with the charming and funny Yelp crew  (Myke, you are a blast) and enjoyed a nice meal as well.

We like "old school" restaurants, especially in that old school town Las Vegas. The atmosphere here didn't disappoint, with the decor, the bar and the 2-piece music combo. The classic Italian food didn't disappoint either. It was excellent, hot and well-proportioned, just like everything in Vegas should be. However, we were within seconds of walking out at the beginning. Although we had a reservation, our table wasn't ready. We were asked to wait at the bar, where we were ignored for a long time. When I went up front to ask about our table, the hostess played dumb & said she thought we sat down to eat at the bar (we stood the whole time, are tall, and could easily be seen across the room). We were then told that a big birthday party was taking up a lot of tables and resources. Well too bad. You don't overbook your restaurant & shut out people with reservations. 

I was literally waving my car key in front of the hostess when we were finally seated. The Maitre d' then proceeded to shake my hand about 10 times to apologize, which I don't love if I plan to eat bread. He did give us free drinks & dessert as I recall. Still, it's better to get it right than to have to apologize for getting it wrong.

The house of love is the best Italian restaurant I have been to in this city!! Came here for my birthday on Thursday and had the pleasure of sitting right next to the stage with live music. Had a salad and chicken parmigiana. So bomb! Two pomegranate cosmos, as well. Dinner for two came to about $140. Would def recommend for a nice off the strip upscale eat!

Hubby & I came to Vegas to meet my family and I really wanted to take them out to a nice family dinner.  My mom, sister, hubby and I really LOVE pasta.  This cute little place was highly ranked among the rest.  It's located in a neighborhood a few minutes away from the strip.  My first impression of the restaurant was that it was very charming and the fact that it was away from the strip was great because it was a small venue but they were still able to accommodate is with no reservation.  The wait time was less than three minutes and everyone from the hostess, to the waiter, to the live band was amazing.  Everyone asked where we were from and they loved the fact that we were representing Hawaii.  The band even played a special song for us to help bring a little island comfort to the scene.

I ordered the Pasta Alla Forno which is penne pasta tossed with chicken, shrimp, broccoli and mushrooms in a light pink sauce baked in the oven with fresh mozzarella, this dish was very delicious.  It's something that the waiter and I have never seen in any Italian Restaurant, I finished the entire plate! My hubby had his all time favorite, the Chicken Parmigiana.  He thought it was descent but felt it wasn't up to par with the other versions he's had.  He honestly felt that Olive Garden mastered that fish better than this place... My little sister had the Spaghetti with Meatballs.  It was amazing! The meatballs were so soft and juicy.  Both the Chicken Parmigiana and Spaghetti with Meatballs were both one pound plates! The two couldn't finish it... lol.  My mom had the Linguini & Clams which was fresh clams, both chopped and whole in your choice of either a red or white sauce over linguini.  She enjoyed this dish as well with no complaints.  My dad got one of the Specials that they were featuring that night, a Trio Sampler which had the Lobster Ravioli (GREAT dish), Shrimp (It was okay), and the Gnocchi which was homemade potato dumplings served with your choice of meat sauce (he ate every bite).  For dessert I had one cannoli, which was the first cannoli I've ever had in my life! IT WAS DELICIOUS! It even comes with a free shirt :) 

All in all I have to say I would give this place five stars but because not everyone enjoyed there food as much as I did, I gave the overall venue four stars.  I definitely recommend this place to anyone that LOVES PASTA and isn't afraid to try something new.  I love trying different things and if you're one, this place is a MUST GO TO!!!

We had a great time.  We got picked up promptly by the limo, the driver was nice and fun to talk to, we were seated quickly, the food was really good, the portions were good, the vibe was fun, the entertainment was great and we had a nice conversation with the drummer, and we really enjoyed ourselves.

For the price, I would not go often, but for a special treat, it was pretty perfect.

I went to Casa di Amore, or as I like to call it, "Casa di A... MORE PLEASE!" with my friends Pat, Kohl, Nick, Gilburt, Yabo, Mensah, Shawn, and Masoli. Our waitress was a quick-wristed, Italian woman called Guiseppe. Masoli organized the dinner, so he put a lot of pressure on everyone at the table to order foods that rhyme with his name. Unfortunately, this limited us to ravioli and cannolis. The live music was incredible, although some of the lyrics were a little bit different from what I remembered (e.g. "when the moon hits your eye like a big pizza pie that's Masoli"). The women there were much nicer than most women. Instead of getting angry when I asked them questions on their way to the bathroom, they just ignored me. Guiseppe gave me a cannoli even though I didn't order one. In Italy, this means a woman is in love with you. "Cannoli" literally translates to "little tube". The suggestion was obvious; she wanted a little tube in return. I decided I couldn't reciprocate the gesture when I saw Guiseppe offering cannolis to literally everyone. Casa di Amore:  Masoli, ravioli, cannoli

Great food, wonderful atmosphere, service and music.  Perfect spot before or after the airport. Eggplant di Amore was delicious and huge portions.  Stuffed garlic bread is amazing and the wine selections and prices are fair.  We will definitely be back. *I heard they offer half portions of entrees if you ask so this would be a good idea unless you are splitting.  It's a little loud with the music so not ideal for a quiet dinner but you can get a table further away from the stage if you make a reservation.

It took friends visiting from out of town to get me back in here but the food and service hasn't changed. We had a reservation and were directed to the bar for a few minutes while they set up our table and by the time we got our drinks, our table was ready. There was live jazz playing which was a nice touch. The servers were very attentive to our needs.
Food was very good.  The waitress (Toni) sucked I think she forgot to put our  food order in.

This was my 5th time here and my friends 1st and we both love it!!! Everything we ordered was fresh and delicious. 
The gypsy pasta was perfectly spiced 
The Cioppino seafood stew was the best we ever had 
The pork chops were cooked to perfection 

Pizza and Alfredo was also spectacular 
With a friendly and classic environment and the staff on top of everything this place is a must go

best italian restaurant i've ever eaten at in my life !!!!!! i was a server/bartender in my 20's & 30's, and i have worked for a number of italian restaurants, some actually great places.. nothing holds a candle to casa de amore', it is the italian restaurant that you must make time for when you visit vegas.. they are closed tuesdays, but when they are open, you will find the service, decor, dishes, salads, & drinks absolutely too notch and unforgettable.. the bread is amazing, the salads are delicious, and the pastas, well, let me tell you it's the best italian i have ever had, ever.. they have live music most nights, and the waiters i met there i will never forget their kindness and thoughtfulness till the day i die.. i absolutely love this place, and will be sad when i leave vegas for not being close to them anymore.. get there as soon as you can, you won't regret it .. !!!

This place is a hidden gem and one of the best kept secrets in Vegas for authentic, delicious Italian food with a great atmosphere to match! Just walked in randomly one day with a couple friends bc we were in the mood to try a new place. Right when you walk in, the atmosphere is so inviting and you immediately get that old school Italian vibe. Their table side manner and service is impeccable. We lucked out bc they had a live band that night and it was like getting dinner AND a show; so cute to watch the older couples dance while you enjoy your dinner and wine. Great spot for birthdays, dates, or just when you feel like getting that personalized service.
Wow. Cioppino and frutti de mare. Excellent. Calamari cooked perfectly, not rubbery. Flavor of the broth is superb.
classic italian red sauce restaurant. the chicken parm stood out. very las vegas. friday night was happening.

Old style vegas restaurant for sure. Dont let the outside of the building discourage going there. The food was great and the service even better. We got there early before they opened for dinner and there was several other parties waiting as well. That was a good sign!

We got seated immediately and our waiter greeted us and explained the specials. He took our drink orders while we glazed over the menu. From their bread, salads, pasta or steak everything we ordered was great. 

Live music and the bar in the back made the night.

Eating at this old school Italian restaurant comes with live renditions of Frank Sinatra and Dean Martin songs. We went on Monday night with no reservation however they put table for our five together quickly.  The highlights of what I tasted were warm bread, calamari app, half priced bottle of wine, fettuccine alfredo and stuffed pork chops all very good.  I wasn't a fan of arancini rice balls app and wish I had room for cannoli for desert.  Regardless, this is a must try LV Italian restaurant.

Spent two weeks in Las Vegas last year for my honeymoon and finding this little spot at 1am is still one of the greatest highlights of the entire trip.  I let everyone know who tell me that they're going to vacation in Vegas that they MUST try this place!!!! Go now!!! Why are you still reading this?!?

The food was very good. The service excellent. Very friendly staff.
Music was kept low but romantic
Awesome Frank Sinatra atmosphere. Love the live music playing when we went.
I looooved this place! I just moved to Las Vegas in June and my boyfriend took me for my birthday. The food didn't disappoint one bit it is a little pricey but so good!!

This place is really fun! Number one, the food is fantastic, and there's plenty of it. The motto of this place is "Vegas the way it used to be." We had a party of four that arrived around midnight; this place is open till five. I had cioppino which was really good, others in my party had different things but I was too engrossed in my cioppino to care! Wine on Monday is half-price and the place was packed. I think there were four or five birthday parties here, including one with little kids. They have a two piece band, both of whom sang and doubled on multiple instruments.thank Frank Sinatra meets funk and a little New Orleans thrown in. They rocked, the food rocked, the waiters were great, what a totally cool place. It is about two or 3 miles from the strip, so you see a mix of locals as well as well informed visitors. If you decide to come, be prepared to have a really good time.

Had Christmas Eve dinner at Casa di Amore and while things started a little rough, it ended up being a very good experience.

As for the starting out rough, I had a reservation and still had to wait about 20 minutes past my reservation time. I wasn't thrilled about that. Nor was I thrilled with the noise level. When I say it was loud, I mean it was LOUD! This is an old school restaurant in an even older building. The walls are solid brick and while that adds character, there is literally nothing to absorb any sound. The space is small and they cram a lot of people inside and all their talking just bounces back at you. Add to that a talented singer/keyboard player and you get one very loud restaurant. I would actually venture to say it was the loudest restaurant I have ever been in.

From here on though everything gets better. For an appetizer we ordered the twice wrapped prawns which were incredible. Shrimp wrapped with prosciutto and cheese and then baked in dough, served with a sweet sauce that complimented everything nicely. I loved them and will definitely get them again. We also ordered the "famous garlic loaf" which was so good after we finished it we had to order another!

After a nice house salad I received my entree of Chicken Marsala. Two good sized pieces of chicken sauteed with mushrooms and a Marsala wine sauce that was as good as I have ever had. It came with a side of pasta. I upgraded the regular marinara sauce to meat sauce and was glad I did.

For dessert if you order a canoli or creme brulee you get a free t-shirt. I wanted the t-shirt but I wanted the tiramisu more, and it was an excellent choice.

The service was good, but not exceptional. Most of the waiters do look like they have worked there forever and ours was very knowledgeable about the menu. The host was very nice even though it did take longer than I would liked to get my table.

Overall it was a very good experience. Because of the noise level I wouldn't recommend it for a romantic date unless you really don't want to be able to hear your date very well. We've all had those dates, right?

I do recommend Casa di Amore though and will definitely be back.
This is my favorite restaurant I've eaten at by far. The food is amazing and the decor and friendly people make it a great experience.

Loved the music, the old memories of Vegas on the walls and the atmosphere.  The food was fantastic and the service was perfect.  We had four different plates at the table and each and every one was as good as it gets.  The portions were large enough that no one finished their plate.  We had no reservation and stopped by about 6 pm, they sat us immediately.

Gr8 old Vegas ambience.  My meals have been inconsistent.  Had baked eggplant dish di casa which was overcooked.  Other times, I have had perfectly prepared dishes.  Place is a cross BTW a romantic dinner getaway and a loud party place.  Service can be inconsistent too.  Otherwise, nice menu selections, generous servings and comfortable booths.

Casa di Amore reminds me of a scene from the movie Goodfellas. You have a duo singing classic Frank Sinatra and Sammy Davis Jr songs, and amazing Italian dishes. It's a local spot way off the strip, but if you call in advance their courtesy shuttle will provide you with roundtrip transportation. 

I ordered the baked lasagna and shared the massive serving of spaghetti and meatballs with a friend. Both were delicious. The homemade sauce makes all the difference, both a must have.

Was looking for a family style Italian restaurant and saw the reviews so thought we'd give this place a try.  Wow, every dish was excellent and well deserving of the reviews.  I was a little concerned about getting our food on time because they had two large parties and the restaurant was packed but they were prompt delivering the food and kept checking on us.  Great service.  We had the arancini and garlic loaf as apps.  Small Cesar salad was excellent.  It's easy to mess this salad up with too much or too little dressing or just poor dressing period but the salad was well balanced and the dressing perfect.  Dinner was the osso buco, chicken piccata and chicken marsala.  All perfectly done and the chicken was moist.  About the only thing that wad just so so was the garlic loaf.  I would highly recommend this place if you're looking for a family type of Italian restaurant.

Found this amazing little place on Yelp! Used our restaurant.com gift card to get $50 off our meal as well. Great wine selection, beautiful live music, friendly atmosphere. Shout out to Michael, our server for a job well done. He took our pic, didn't rush us, explained everything thoroughly and was just a stand-up guy. As a restaurant manager, I'm pretty picky about everything when it comes to the service industry. I would hire him anyday to work in my place. Bravo!! We will definitely be back for Michael.

Just realized that for claiming not to be 'An Italian food Fan', I seem to eat at a lot of Italian places.  My friends like Italian.  We were out and about around Nov. 8th and saw this place as we drove by.  I remembered reading about it in one of our Vegas Weekly magazines.....so a quick "U-Turn", and we were at CASA DI AMORE. 
ATMOSPHERE: 4-STARS, Even tho this was Friday and we did not have reservations, the host did not make a big deal.  We waited at the bar for about 15 minutes or so and were seated. I liked the two-man band and old time songs. Just a nice casual little dark, dive- type place. Old Vegas.
FOOD: 3-4- STARS, good basic Italian.  Not wonderful like LAVO, but 'go back, good'.
SERVICE; 4-STARS, attentive and good.
PRICES: 3 STARS,  Pretty much in line with regular Vegas prices. 
I will go back for a second try with my many Italian foodie friends.

I am a local and have always brought visitors from out of town to Casa Di Amore because of the great ambiance, food, etc.   Brought my friend there recently for a big birthday and booked a booth.  There was no one in the restaurant when we arrived so we told the hostess we were there  and were having a drink at the bar, next thing a bus load of people arrived (CES convention) and we were handed the half booth by the stage.    Ended up eating in the bar area which was very disappointing.  I enjoyed my salmon dish, but my friend was disappointed in the chicken alfredo.   Also, beware if you buy the coupon at Restaurant.com, it is only good for after 9:30 pm - that was changed this year.

Unprofessional jerks. We have come here several times and the food is delicious with quick service. But when I have a reservation for 7 and they don't honor it and have me wait in the bar with not even a comped drink while we wait and lecture me about how reservations don't mean that they will have a table waiting I think that shitty attitude and and pretentious BS needs to be called out. Good food. Shitty manager shitty hostess and shitty scheduling system willing to screw over loyal customers.

Great old time atmosphere.  Live music from two very experienced singers. I went back into time here and loved it! Great service from our waiter to the bus boys. Food delicious. Had the special which was sirloin tips in potatoe gnocchi in a lite cream sauce. This was excellent and needs to be on the regular menu! A cannoli was the finishing touch. 

If you visit Vegas you must visit here. Uber, Lyft or taxi will take you here...no excuses!

Food was excellent, service was also very good.  Those are the positives.

Negatives - We got seated one hour after our reservation.  The lounge singer was loud enough that normal conversation was not possible.  

If you want old style Las Vegas off the strip with really good food, and don't want/need conversation and arrive knowing that you will probably be seated late than this is a good place to go.
Service was excellent once we saw our waitress and told her we had a show to get to.  My daughter had the shrimp scampi, and I had a perfectly cooked New York steak.

Italian food is VERY easy to mess up..I.E : olive garden..a place where the last thing you taste is something from Italy.

Lots of pseudo places, wanna be homemade spots try to mimic a great Italian flavor but fail tremendously. That is why I am so glad Casa di amore is still around

The ambiance of the place is great. The tables, the little stage with life performance, the bar and the service reminds me of NYC or san Francisco. Lightinig is very soft making the experience a mix between romantic and sexy.

The food is great as well!. The bruchettas are fresh and tasty and the consistencyof the calamari was great. The antipasto portion is pretty big and presentation is great as well. FYI, their bread and butter is AMAZING..just be carefull you end up like me and eat too much of it .

The entrees were as impressive as the appetizer. My lasagna tasted like homemade, and my friends white sauce seafood pasta was good. We noted that the noodles were a little on the plain side, but the sauces and seafood were able to share some of its flavor with it

Some days this place has some specials on wines . Be sure to ask your server about those before ordering. You might be able to save some money.

If you still have room for desert. Try the Tiramisu or caneloni. Freshly made and packed with flavor.

Hasta la pasta!

Overall this was a very pleasurable experience. 

The Italian American food is good with huge portions.   They're sauces were very flavorful and the pasta was cooked perfectly.   The appetizers are very large so be aware when you're ordering that you might get full fast. 

 The service was great.    Our server was very attentive as well as the server assistants.  We got our food pretty fast and with a good pace. 

The ambiance and decor was very nice.   The live singing was also a very nice touch.

My sister, nieces and BFF took me here last saturday for my 50th, and what a wonderful evening it was!  
First, a limo from the restaurant picks you up from wherever u are staying free of charge, how great is that! It is an older limo but has character and sure beats a dull cab ride any time!
