We had just come from seeing Jersey Boys so this added to the theme of the evening. Now you have to reserve in advance for the limo and tip the driver but totally worth it. 
The restaurant is very old Vegas decor and you would expect  Sinatra to walk in any minute. So charming. And there are a few older gentlemen crooning live which adds  to the ambience. 
Our waiter Brad was very knowledgeable with our food selections and had a wonderful, playful personality. Everyone in our party ordered a different entree and all agreed the food was delicious. 
 Our limo was waiting promptly after we dined to take us back to our hotel. I  recommend this restaurant to anyone who wants delicious Italian cuisine and an unforgettable experience.
Awesome classic Vegas Italian restaurant. I will definitely return. Lovely band. Romantic place for lovers.

Wow!! Never again. This place is so expensive. The bill that I had could have been used for Giada's Italian restaurant on the Strip and most likely could have been a heck of a lot cheaper. Come on, I order a thirty dollar plate and your going to charge me four dollars for the Alfredo sauce? Yes it's a cool environment and the staff was friendly but as soon as we sat down we were advised that there is only one server and it may be a while. For a 160.00 bill your going to staff one server? The food was not bad but got cold after a few minutes. The pasta was not consistent. I'm so sad to leave this.
Had spinach salad and they also buco and my wife had the veal parmesan everything was good the service was wonderful they had A 2 piece live music the aumbiance was great I would go back there again

Look no further if you're looking for a great, memorable Italian dinner not far off the strip. They have a full bar and live music that's not overbearing. Everyone was singing the hits having a great, festive time.  

Let's start with the service. I had the pleasure of getting Stephan as my server, he was very helpful in guiding me to what my taste buds wanted. I ended up getting the appetizer "Garlic Loaf" and for my entrée, I got the "Fettuccini Papasito", creamy and loaded with flavorful sausage. My mouth is watering now! It was wonderful, I can't wait to try other dishes when I return.

I called before I went to Casa Di Amore to see if there was a wait and I also had the pleasure of speaking with Lisa who was helpful with my questions. When I was done eating, I wanted to thank Lisa and she gave me a tour of their new OUTSTANDING huge Tiki bar in the rear.  You have to see it, It's straight out of Hollywood and very comfortable.  I can't wait to bring the work crew back to Casa Di Amore because now, I'm in love!

This place rocks from the top to the bottom.

This is a old time favorite place for Italian food. I have to say we have been going here for years. The food is freshly made, authentic, not premade like some chain restaurants. If you order Clams with red sauce or white sauce you get a ton of clams. They do not skimp. The atmosphere is like the old Vegas style and you will feel like you walked back into time, especially with the live music playing while you eat.
The bread is delicious and we always seem to get a little too much cause we love it! You will for sure not leave hungry. We have never had a bad experience here and we have been going for years! It is a little off the strip but so worth going if your in the mood for some good food. If you are visiting and have no car, just call and make a reservation they will come get you in their limo. ( I recommend reservations anyway because they can get pretty busy at dinner time)
Great place for special occasions or if you just want some good Italian food!! Oh and try their Cannolis you will love them!! Yummy!!!

Came here tonight with my wife for my birthday dinner and it was soooo delicious!!! Our waiter, Stephen, was so attentive. He brought out some marinara before hand to try with our bread, kept acknowledging that it was my special birthday and had the pianist sing for me while they provided an INCREDIBLE cannoli!!! My wife and I ordered the Gnocchi alle Prosciutto and the baked ziti. Half way through we swapped so we could get a taste of both. Although both were incredible, my fave was the gnocchi. Sooo amazing!! Cannot wait to come back here.

Went here with my husband late night at 1 am. Great food and our server was amazing. We got a nice booth next to the stage. Best Italian food I've had in a while. Bit of a drive for me since I live completely on the other side of town but totally worth it. They're also open til 5am which is great since my husband is off late.
We come here every time we're in town, great food and wonderful service I highly recommend it!

Came here for my birthday dinner with my husband and I absolutely loved it! The whole feel of the restaurant makes you feel like if you were in the 40s. Excellent service. Forgot our waitress name but she was amazing! The only thing I was a bit confused on was the entrance. We walked to the 'front' which is facing Tropicana and the door was closed. We then saw people going in through the back and that's how we got in. Keep in mind this was 7pm and the back entrance was only intended to be used after midnight I believe. However, other than that excellent service and food! I will definitely be coming back!
Wow! Spaghetti and meat balls can't be done better here! So good! The live music is a nice touch. So much fun! I will return!

If I were speaking strictly food alone, this is a 4 star place.  I'm giving it 5 stars for the experience  - that of a 1950s style eatery complete with live music and a very attentive and friendly staff.

We made reservations on a Wednesday night, arrived early and were still able to get seated relatively easily around 7pm.  It get more crowded as the night progresses.

Casa Di Amore has a number of classic Italian dishes.  We got the Mini Oso Bucco ($14), Calamari ($14), Gypsy Pasta ($26), Chicken Marsala ($27) and the Gnocchi Alla Prosciutto ($23).  All portions were quite generous, and in fact I could have eaten the Mini Oso Bucco as a main.  We had freshly baked house bread that came with garlic butter plus oil and vinegar.  

The Oso Bucco was very tender and the risotto it came on was excellent. I definitely would recommend this dish!  I liked the Calamari but it was borderline too crunchy.  Probably the "worst" dish was the Gypsy pasta.  If you're used to Thai food, it's not that spicy - has a nice kick, but I didn't find it that special and probably wouldn't order that again.  Overall, a fun place to take friends from out of town.

This place is a hidden gem! 

The restaurant itself is very elegant inside and offers live music while you're dining. A Frank Sinatra atmosphere to set the mood whether you're on a romantic date, or simply dining with friends and family. Reservations are recommended. 

The food quality is excellent. My personal favorite was the Spaghetti and Meatballs and Minestrone soup. Decent size portions depending on what you order. 

There is a tiki bar attached to the back of the restaurant. Per the staff, it's not opened year round. Summer is a good time to check it out. Tuesdays and Thursdays are the days to avoid as they have it closed. Unfortunately I was unable to experience it the first time I came here but hoping to go sometime soon.

So I thought long and hard about this review as I really wanted this to be one of the high lights of my trip. Tour guide suggested this as a local spot with home cooked food. Online they offered free limo service for the strip hotels so I booked about 2 months in advance. My pickup time was 7pm with dinner at 7:10-7:15 (this is what the girl on the phone stated when I booked).  The day of the reservation we got out side about 6:50 and at 7:05 when no one came I called the restaurant. They stated that they were trying to call me all day and that they had a party of 46 that they gave our table to to accommodate them. I stated that I never received a call and I gave them my phone number. The guy on the phone said that the number was written down incorrectly. That should of been the clue to not go but I had a gift certificate and the guy on the phone after several apologies stated that if I got a cab the restaurant would pay and they would seat us as soon as we got there. So ok we got there and could tell the dinning room was small and filled!!  The hostess seamed new and I gave our name several times as she was trying to add us to the 46 party. A guy came over greeted and apologized for the mixup, took my receipt for the cab and said we would be seated shortly. We walked over to the bar and ended up waiting about 45 min. At that point we moved back to the hostess station as I felt we were forgotten. About 15 min later and more headache we were seated.  The waiter was the best part of the dinner he was friendly and engaged.  The (I guess) manager came over apologized again for the mix up and offered us dessert.   Now if that wasn't enough there was a 2 man band playing that was also very good and I could of sat there for hours drinking wine and listening to them however at one point the restaurant let the organizer of the 46 sing and than speak to their group. At that point all the other tables were told by their tables that we had to be quiet and constantly heard (sssh) (sssh).  We got our food and it was ok.   But at the end of the day with everything else that happened here did not live up to my expectations.  I get it was 46 people and they didn't want to loose that bill but they should of just closed the restaurant for a private party especially since they literally took over the restaurant!!  With that experience I wouldn't go back.

Disappointed in myself that it took this long to find this late night gem. Open until 5am, live music during early dining hours to set the tone, half off pizzas after midnight, friendly informative service from Stephan(I hope I spelt this correct), and to top it amazing food that really has that "grandmas recipe" taste. We started with fresh bread , garlic butter. Sold! Lobster ravioli and shrimp scampi... I cleaned both plates with my second basket of bread. I had the steak flambé (NY strip) with a peppercorn sauce that was just right to not take away from the steak. Sautéed broccoli, twice baked potato, and roasted peppers. He had the chicken parmigiana with and extra side of that amazing marinara sauce. Both dishes clean and cleared. Just bummed we didn't save room for dessert. Next Monday cannoli here we come! Also on Mondays they have half off wine bottles!

Very nice late date.... diner was delicious. Wine bottle is half price on Mondays! That was a nice surprise. Our waiter was very friendly and we had a great time! I love créeme brûlée ... i ordered it and got a shirt from the house.

I've been here twice and since my first visit my likes and dislikes have changed because of several reasons. First visit was a dream and my second visit was iffy.  Let's talk about why...

My first experience here was like no other in Vegas. I usually stick to the strip and veer off only when it's a true joint to go to.  This was one must visit. And we had a friggin blast. The meal was so enjoyable and the entertainment was what was expected. Exceptional. 

The second visit was anticipated to be top notch because by that time we learned a pro tip. Which was you get a free car service to pick you up and drop you off after your meal.... WHAT!  Super awesome tip from a fellow YELPER. Thanks cuz that worked out great.  

That advantage of that service. Our driver was exceptional and even checked up on us during our meal. So sweet! 

This is were my review goes grim. Holy crap... the menu special was not what I expected.  You better know your fish when you order it and know what it looks like.  My sea bass was not chelean. It was from somewhere else sea bass. Wtf. Lmao. Anyway still good but not what was expected. 

Order freely tho because everything we've ordered has always been great. Make sure to order the Canoli for desert. You'll love it and you get a free novelty shirt to go home with.

I give this place 3 stars because it is very romantic. There's live music and a romantic ambiance at night. Tables are small. You can't really go with a group over four people without a reservation. I recommend making a reservation to get a booth, otherwise the tables are fairly small. Dinner was good but not greAt. Perhaps they need to make their pasta a little more fresh from scratch for an extra star from me. Overall the romance was there. The live music sends me back to Sinatra times. Service was great.  Menu options are numerous but pasta needs some work. People now a days expect freshly made mouthwatering pure pasta from a mom and pops place like Casa Di Amor.

I spent my birthday in Vegas and wanted Italian food. My friends suggested this place and I'm glad they did. It reminded me of almost every "real" italian restaurant I ever ate at growing up in Jersey.  The decor is dark and the aroma from the kitchen is wonderful.  I started off with Shrimp Cocktail with this amazing cocktail sauce that had a large clump of horseradish in the middle.....mmmm..mmmm..good. My sinus were cleared immediately. The Ceasar Salad was good. I could taste the anchovy's in the dressing. The entree was Veal Marsala. This was to die for.  Thin slices of perfectly cooked veal in this mushroom gravy.  I didn't leave anything on my plate.
The next visit to Vegas, I will be having Italian at this place. 
Don't let me forget to give "props" to the lounge singer, George.  He sounded alot like ole' Blue Eyes himself.

This restaurant offers a wonderful atmosphere that goes hand in hand with the friendly staff and delicious food. The pricing is perfect. It's worth leaving the madness of the 'Strip' to go here and have a decent Italian meal. Highly Recommended.

Excellent atmosphere, nice live music, amazing flavors. I was a bit disappointed at the amount of seafood in the Cioppino for $35, but the flavor more than made up for it (maybe just add the other half of the lobster tail for that price). The Oso Bucco was perfect, tender, and packed with flavor. The risotto was very good, and the smoked sausage dish my wife had was great. We finished off with a creme brulee and a canolli, both were just as wonderful as the rest of the dinner. 

Perfect date night spot, or party celebration. Staff was very friendly. Fantastic experience.

I loved this place! It was my favorite part of a whirl-wind Vegas trip :). The older musicians playing standards are phenomenal, and so fun. The food is old school Italian, which I very much enjoy. The front of the house staff is second to none. Plus, the whole place is like traveling back in time! My only reason for not giving it 5 stars is because of our waitress. We had a large party, and had warned her we would be splitting the tab... She said, "no problem, I'll print multiple receipts so everyone can circle what they had." So we do this, and she cops major attitude because we gave her 5 cards (NOTE: I know this is annoying for a server, but she said it was fine when asked about it). We proceeded to wait for a full 30 MINUTES for our checks to sign! The night had been perfect for me up to that point, and I'm sad it ended on a crappier note. None-the-less, you (review reader) should DEFINITELY go here! Especially if you like nostalgia; this place is very much for you ;).

So I went here on a first date recently and I wouldn't say its a good vibe for that! Lol Its very loud and to top if off they sat a family with a baby right behind us.. so when the singer is there with the loud music its hard to have any conversations here... the sweet sound of baby crying didn't help either. The patrons that come here is also on the loud side. This would be a good place for a large family to come to.. or friends that want to get together and want to be loud. I didn't choose the restaurant for our first date.. but its definitely not a nice romantic italian restaurant.. its more on the loud, bright and non fancy side. 

So lets talk about how the place looks.. its not fancy.. kinda bright lighting.. and more on the casual dress side. The service was okay.. Theres also a tiki bar in the outside back patio side of the restaurant which is kinda cool cause its very Hawaiian theme! but they close early back there around 11pm! even though the restaurant is open til 3am. 

So the food was alright tasting.. nothing amazing to rave about. I believe I ordered the gnocchi with prosciutto and added grilled shrimp no top of that. It tasted alright but its not something I would order again. The bread and butter at the beginning of the meal was actually pretty tasty! bread was warm and the butter was soft! very delish.  I also ordered moscow mules there and it tasted okay. not overly sweet which i loved. 

Oh parking is plentiful and no valet needed. Like I said its a very casual italian restaurant.

Food is a 4. Experience is a 3. The caprese salad is not very good- the tomatoes were under ripe and barely any basil on top. The pastas were very good. The music here is EXTREMELY loud!!!! Not average like it says, making everyone have to yell in the restaurant creating an aggravating buzz and it's not romantic having to scream to my husband especially over "When the saints go marching in" is being screamed in my ear...that is not an ideal song to play in a romantic setting?? The service was super slow, we didn't get bread til 25 mins in and then had to wait 15+ mins before he came back to take our order and over an hour from when we sat down to get our entrees. Anyway it left me feeling very annoyed bc of the loudness of it I didn't even feel like conversating bc my husband had to lean in and kept saying "Whaaat?"

If I could give six stars to this place I would. They have incredible service, food and entertainment. I've gone in small groups and large groups and everyone I've been with has had an amazing time; even the friends I thought wouldn't enjoy it loved it. 

My last time here I came with a group of 19 people. I called a week ahead of time to reserve our table. Another awesome perk of this place is that they provide free transportation from the strip in their limos. I had already known about the limos which is why I called so early to reserve them. We were all able to meet at the main valet of our casino and ride together to dinner. We got to the restaurant and our tables were ready. The food was quick to come out and was delicious. The waiter even offered to take pictures for the whole group. Everything was perfect.

Last night was the third time my girlfriend and I have been here.  On my first visit, my thought was, "it's pretty pricey for a small portion of macaroni."  Macaroni is cheap, except for here.  But we enjoyed the authentic Italian, homey atmosphere and most especially the live music. We chalked up the (too) high price to the added ambiance.  The food is good as in decent but nothing extraordinary.  And it certainly isn't great enough for the price.  Last night we ordered the sea bass special.  We both love sea bass and have had great sea bass in town.  We got a VERY small steak-like piece of sea bass, twice baked potato that was very small, a few broccoli florets and a few julienne pieces of roasted peppers (I believe).  The plate was $40.  I order the sea bass at Don Vito's which is more than twice that size, possibly 3 times, it is luscious (light, buttery like sea bass is) for $38.  The sea bass last night was much more dense and firm like halibut.  It was tasty but had I seen the plate before I ordered, I would have never ordered it.  Before I arrived there and knew of the special, I was kind of set on the Pasta Alla Forno (penne with chicken, shrimp, broc, mushrooms in a light pink sauce baked with mozz).  Sounds yummy, eh?  I imagine it could have been.  The sea bass wasn't much so I ordered still the Alla Forno to take home, thought I would have it for the next couple days lunches.  At $30 for the plate of macaroni, I expected a good size portion.  I was stunned when I got home and opened the plastic bag.  There was so little macaroni that I could see the bottom of the silver tin they package to go items in. No two lunches there.  When I got ready to eat it today, I literally dissected the dish to search for the shrimp - 4 tiny pcs maybe the size of my thumb nail, count the broccoli florets- 1 sm floret and 2 fragments and the penne - 50.(I do have pictures of all that I will post.)  

Here is the bottom line:  the food is waaaaaaaaaaaaaaay overpriced.  If paying a lot for the food is worth it for the ambiance, then I think you will find the food decent and love the music.  The ambiance is the ONLY reason we will go there on rare occasion.  If you could careless about the music and just want some good food for a decent price, this is NOT your place.  Since the closing of Tivoli Gardens, Nora's would be my favorite.  My favorite dish there is $20 (which I still think is overpriced) and in ways similar to the All Forno.  But I definitely get two meals out of it, way tastier and you don't have to hunt for the shrimp.  Full size shrimp.

Another overrated Yelp restaurant.
Food - 3 stars. Nothing special.
Prices are very high. I would say $$$ at least.
Service - 4 stars.

I gave this 4 stars but it's more like 4 1/2. Very retro Las Vegas decor, very romantic. I don't drink much but I did order a grasshopper while waiting to be seated and it was delicious. They had entertainment in the form of two elderly gentlemen playing dean Martin, Sinatra and Bacharach classics.  Very charming. The employees were extremely courteous. I had the New York steak and my boyfriend had the lasagna. Both were very good. Would definitely go back again to celebrate a special occasion. Also a good place to take out of town guests.
